value.verse: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, *
value.halfverse: by divine mercy we have a new birth into a living hope;
we have an inheritance that is imperishable in heaven.
value.verse: Through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, *

value.halfverse: was not paid in silver or gold,
value.verse: The ransom that was paid to free us *
But in the precious blood of Christ, *
value.halfverse: the Lamb without spot or stain.

value.verse: God raised Jesus from the dead and gave him glory *
value.halfverse: so that we might have faith and hope in God.

en-eow-canticle-m.label: Canticle M: A Song of Faith

value.verse:
My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord,
my spirit rejoices in you, O God my Savior; *
value.halfverse: for you have looked with favor on your lowly servant.

value.verse: From this day all generations will call me blessed: *
value.halfverse:
you, the Almighty, have done great things for me,
and holy is your Name.
from generation to generation.
value.verse: You have mercy on those who fear you *

value.halfverse: and scattered the proud in their conceit,
value.verse: You have shown strength with your arm, *

value.halfverse: and lifting up the lowly.
value.verse: Casting down the mighty from their thrones,

value.halfverse: and sent the rich away empty.
value.verse: You have filled the hungry with good things, *

value.halfverse: for you have remembered your promise of mercy,
value.verse: You have come to the help of your servant Israel, *

value.halfverse: to Abraham and his children for ever.
value.verse: The promise you made to our forebears, *

en-eow-canticle-b.label: Canticle B: A Song of Pilgrimage

value.verse:
Before I ventured forth,
even while I was very young, *
value.halfverse: I sought wisdom openly in my prayer.
and I will seek her to the end.
value.verse: In the forecourts of the temple I asked for her, *

value.halfverse: she has been the delight of my heart.
value.verse: From first blossom to early fruit, *

value.halfverse: diligently from my youth have I pursued her.
value.verse: My foot has kept firmly to the true path, *

value.halfverse: I found for myself much wisdom and became adept in her.
value.verse: I inclined my ear a little and received her; *

value.halfverse: for I have resolved to live according to her way.
value.verse: To the one who gives me wisdom will I give glory, *

value.halfverse: therefore I will not be forsaken.
value.verse: From the beginning I gained courage from her, *

value.halfverse: therefore have I gained a good possession.
value.verse: In my inmost being I have been stirred to seek her, *

value.halfverse: and with it will I offer praise to God.
value.verse: As my reward the Almighty has given me the gift of language, *

value.halfverse: you have come to your people and set them free.
value.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel; *

value.halfverse: born of the house of your servant David.
value.verse: You have raised up for us a mighty savior, *

Through your holy prophets you promised of old,
that you would save us from our enemies, *
value.halfverse: from the hands of all who hate us.
and to remember your holy covenant.
value.verse: To show mercy to our forebears *

value.halfverse: to set us free from the hands of our enemies,
value.verse: This was the oath you swore to our father Abraham, *
Free to worship you without fear, *
value.halfverse:
holy and righteous before you,
all the days of our life.
for you will go before the Lord to prepare the way,
value.verse: And you, child, shall be called the prophet of the Most High, *

value.halfverse: by the forgiveness of their sins.
value.verse: To give God’s people knowledge of salvation *

value.halfverse: the dawn from on high shall break upon us,
value.verse: In the tender compassion of our God *

value.halfverse: and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
value.verse:
To shine on those who dwell in darkness
and the shadow of death, *
I will take you from among all nations; *
value.halfverse: and gather you from all lands to bring you home.
and purify you from false gods and uncleanness.
value.verse: I will sprinkle clean water upon you; *

value.halfverse: and a new spirit put within you.
value.verse: A new heart I will give you *
I will take the stone heart from your chest *
value.halfverse: and give you a heart of flesh.

value.verse: I will help you walk in my laws *
value.halfverse: and cherish my commandments and do them.

value.verse: You shall be my people, *
value.halfverse: and I will be your God.

value.halfverse: the desert shall rejoice and blossom;

It shall blossom abundantly, *

the majesty of our God.
value.verse: They shall see the glory of the Lord, *

value.halfverse: and make firm the feeble knees.

Say to the anxious, “Be strong, do not fear! *

and the ears of the deaf be unstopped.

Then shall the lame leap like a deer, *

and streams in the desert;

The ransomed of God shall return with singing, *

en-eow-canticle-d.label: Canticle D: A Song of the Wilderness

value.verse: I will sing a new song to my God, *
value.halfverse: for you are great and glorious, wonderful in strength, invincible.

value.verse: Let the whole creation serve you, *
value.halfverse: for you spoke and all things came into being.
no one is able to resist your voice.
value.verse: You sent your breath and it formed them, *
Mountains and seas are stirred to their depths, *
value.halfverse: rocks melt like wax at your presence.
you continue to show mercy.
value.verse: But to those who fear you, *
No sacrifice, however fragrant, can please you, *
value.halfverse: but whoever fears the Lord shall stand in your sight for ever.

en-eow-canticle-n.label: Canticle N: A Song of God’s Love

value.verse: Beloved, let us love one another, *
value.halfverse: for love is of God.

value.verse: Whoever does not love does not know God, *
value.halfverse: for God is Love.

value.verse: In this the love of God was revealed among us, *
value.halfverse:
that God sent his only Son into the world,
so that we might live through Jesus Christ.

value.verse: In this is love, not that we loved God but that God loved us *
value.halfverse: and sent his Son that sins might be forgiven.

value.verse: Beloved, since God loved us so much, *
value.halfverse: we ought also to love one another.

value.verse: For if we love one another, God abides in us, *
value.halfverse: and God’s love will be perfected in us.

value.halfverse: to give to everyone according to their deeds.
value.verse:
“Behold, I am coming soon,” says the Lord,
“and bringing my reward with me, *

value.halfverse: the beginning and the end.”
value.verse: “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the first and the last, *

Blessed are those who do God’s commandments,
that they may have the right to the tree of life, *

with this testimony for all the churches.
value.verse: “I, Jesus, have sent my angel to you, *

value.halfverse: I am the bright morning star.”
value.verse: “I am the root and the offspring of David, *
“Come!” say the Spirit and the Bride; *
value.halfverse: “Come!” let each hearer reply!
let those who desire take the water of life as a gift.
value.verse: Come forward, you who are thirsty, *
I called to you, O God, out of my distress, and you answered me; *
value.halfverse: out of the belly of Sheol I cried, and you heard my voice.

value.verse: You cast me into the deep, into the heart of the seas, *
value.halfverse:
and the flood surrounded me;
all your waves and billows passed over me.
how shall I ever look again upon your holy temple?”
value.verse: Then I said, “I am driven away from your sight; *

value.halfverse: weeds were wrapped around my head at the roots of the mountains.
value.verse: The waters closed in over me, the deep was round about me; *

value.halfverse: yet you brought up my life from the depths, O God.
value.verse: I went down to the land beneath the earth, *
As my life was ebbing away, I remembered you, O God, *
value.halfverse: and my prayer came to you, into your holy temple.
what I have vowed I will pay, for deliverance belongs to the Lord!
value.verse: With the voice of thanksgiving, I will sacrifice to you; *

en-eow-canticle-i.label: Canticle I: A Song of Jonah

value.verse:
We praise you, O God, 
we acclaim you as Lord; 
all creation worships you, 
the  Father  everlasting. 
To you all angels, all the powers of heaven, 
the cherubim and seraphim, sing in endless praise: 
	Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of power and might, 
	heaven and earth are full of your glory. 
The glorious company of apostles praise you. 
The noble fellowship of prophets praise you. 
The white-robed army of martyrs praise you. 
Throughout the world the holy Church acclaims you: 
	Father, of majesty unbounded, 
	your true and only Son, worthy of all worship, 
	and the Holy Spirit, advocate and guide. 
You, Christ, are the king of glory, 
the eternal Son of the Father. 
When you took our flesh to set us free 
you humbly chose the Virgin’s womb. 
You overcame the sting of death 
and opened the kingdom of heaven to all believers. 
You are seated at God’s right hand in glory. 
We believe that you will come to be our judge. 
	Come then, Lord, and help your people, 
	bought with the price of your own blood, 
	and bring us with your saints 
	to glory everlasting.

I believe in God, the Father almighty,
     creator of heaven and earth.

value.text: Do you believe in Jesus Christ, the Son of God?

I believe in Jesus Christ, his only Son, our Lord.
     He was conceived by the power of the Holy Spirit
          and born of the Virgin Mary.
     He suffered under Pontius Pilate,
          was crucified, died, and was buried.
     He descended to the dead.
     On the third day he rose again.
     He ascended into heaven,
          and is seated at the right hand of the Father.
     He will come again to judge the living and the dead.

value: But chiefly are we bound to praise thee for the glorious resurrection of thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord; for he is the very Paschal Lamb, who was sacrificed for us, and hath taken away the sin of the world; who by his death hath destroyed death, and by his rising to life again hath won for us everlasting life.

For with thy co-eternal Son and Holy Spirit, thou art one God, one Lord, in Trinity of Persons and in Unity of Substance; and we celebrate the one and equal glory of thee, O Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.

Because thou didst send thy beloved Son to redeem us from sin and death, and to make us heirs in him of everlasting life; that when he shall come again in power and great triumph to judge the world, we may without shame or fear rejoice to behold his appearing.

Because thou didst give Jesus Christ, thine only Son, to be born for us; who, by the mighty power of the Holy Ghost, was made very Man of the substance of the Virgin Mary his mother; that we might be delivered from the bondage of sin, and receive power to become thy children.
Because in the mystery of the Word made flesh, thou hast caused a new light to shine in our hearts, to give the knowledge of thy glory in the face of thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who rose victorious from the dead, and doth comfort us with the blessed hope of everlasting life; for to thy faithful people, O Lord, life is changed, not ended; and when our mortal body doth lie in death, there is prepared for us a dwelling place eternal in the heavens.

Who dost bid thy faithful people cleanse their hearts, and prepare with joy for the Paschal feast; that, fervent in prayer and in works of mercy, and renewed by thy Word and Sacraments, they may come to the fullness of grace which thou hast prepared for those who love thee.

Because thou art greatly glorified in the assembly of thy saints. All thy creatures praise thee, and thy faithful servants bless thee, confessing before the rulers of this world the great Name of thine only Son.

Who, in the multitude of thy saints, hast compassed us about with so great a cloud of witnesses, that we, rejoicing in their fellowship, may run with patience the race that is set before us; and, together with them, may receive the crown of glory that fadeth not away.
Who in the obedience of thy saints hast given us an example of righteousness, and in their eternal joy a glorious pledge of the hope of our calling.
Because in Jesus Christ our Lord thou hast received us as thy sons and daughters, made us citizens of thy kingdom, and given us the Holy Spirit to guide us into all truth.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who was in every way tempted as we are, yet did not sin; by whose grace we are able to triumph over every evil, and to live no longer unto ourselves, but unto him who died for us and rose again.

Because in the love of wife and husband, thou hast given us an image of the heavenly Jerusalem, adorned as a bride for her bridegroom, thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who loveth her and gave himself for her, that he might make the whole creation new.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; according to whose true promise the Holy Ghost came down [on this day] from heaven, lighting upon the disciples, to teach them and to lead them into all truth; uniting peoples of many tongues in the confession of one faith, and giving to thy Church the power to serve thee as a royal priesthood, and to preach the Gospel to all nations.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who for our sins was lifted high upon the cross, that he might draw the whole world to himself; who by his suffering and death became the author of eternal salvation for all who put their trust in him.

Through thy dearly beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who after his glorious resurrection manifestly appeared to his disciples; and in their sight ascended into heaven, to prepare a place for us; that where he is, there we might also be, and reign with him in glory.
Who by water and the Holy Spirit hast made us a new people in Jesus Christ our Lord, to show forth thy glory in all the world.
For the wonderful grace and virtue declared in all thy saints, who have been chosen vessels of thy grace, and the lights of the world in their generations.
Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who on the first day of the week overcame death and the grave, and by his glorious resurrection opened to us the way of everlasting life.
Creator of the light and source of life, who hast made us in thine image, and called us to new life in Jesus Christ our Lord.

For with your co-eternal Son and Holy Spirit, you are one God, one Lord, in Trinity of Persons and in Unity of Being; and we celebrate the one and equal glory of you, O Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
Because in the mystery of the Word made flesh, you have caused a new light to shine in our hearts, to give the knowledge of your glory in the face of your son Jesus Christ our Lord.
For by water and the Holy Spirit you have made us a new people in Jesus Christ our Lord, to show forth your glory in all the world.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord. In fulfillment of his true promise, the Holy Spirit came down [on this day] from heaven, lighting upon the disciples, to teach them and to lead them into all truth; uniting peoples of many tongues in the confession of one faith, and giving to your Church the power to serve you as a royal priesthood, and to preach the Gospel to all nations.

You bid your faithful people cleanse their hearts, and prepare with joy for the Paschal feast; that, fervent in prayer and in works of mercy, and renewed by your Word and Sacraments, they may come to the fullness of grace which you have prepared for those who love you.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who was tempted in every way as we are, yet did not sin. By his grace we are able to triumph over every evil, and to live no longer for ourselves alone, but for him who died for us and rose again.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who rose victorious from the dead, and comforts us with the blessed hope of everlasting life. For to your faithful people, O Lord, life is changed, not ended; and when our mortal body lies in death, there is prepared for us a dwelling place eternal in the heavens.

Because in the love of wife and husband, you have given us an image of the heavenly Jerusalem, adorned as a bride for her bridegroom, your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who loves her and gave himself for her, that he might make the whole creation new.

Through your dearly beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord. After his glorious resurrection he openly appeared to his disciples, and in their sight ascended into heaven, to prepare a place for us; that where he is, there we might also be, and reign with him in glory.

Because you sent your beloved Son to redeem us from sin and death, and to make us heirs in him of everlasting life; that when he shall come again in power and great triumph to judge the world, we may without shame or fear rejoice to behold his appearing.
For the wonderful grace and virtue declared in all your saints, who have been the chosen vessels of your grace, and the lights of the world in their generations.
Because in Jesus Christ our Lord you have received us as your sons and daughters, made us citizens of your kingdom, and given us the Holy Spirit to guide us into all truth.

But chiefly are we bound to praise you for the glorious resurrection of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; for he is the true Paschal Lamb, who was sacrificed for us, and has taken away the sin of the world. By his death he has destroyed death, and by his rising to life again he has won for us everlasting life.
Because in the obedience of your saints you have given us an example of righteousness, and in their eternal joy a glorious pledge of the hope of our calling.
Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who on the first day of the week overcame death and the grave, and by his glorious resurrection opened to us the way of everlasting life.

Because you are greatly glorified in the assembly of your saints. All your creatures praise you, and your faithful servants bless you, confessing before the rulers of this world the great Name of your only Son.

For in the multitude of your saints you have surrounded us with a great cloud of witnesses, that we might rejoice in their fellowship, and run with endurance the race that is set before us; and, together with them, receive the crown of glory that never fades away.
For you are the source of light and life, you made us in your image, and called us to new life in Jesus Christ our Lord.

Because you gave Jesus Christ, your only Son, to be born for us; who, by the mighty power of the Holy Spirit, was made perfect Man of the flesh of the Virgin Mary his mother; so that we might be delivered from the bondage of sin, and receive power to become your children.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord. For our sins he was lifted high upon the cross, that he might draw the whole world to himself; and, by his suffering and death, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who put their trust in him.
Alleluia
Alleluia

value.verse: O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you; *
value.halfverse:
my soul thirsts for you, my flesh faints for you,
 as in a barren and dry land where there is no water.

value.verse: Therefore I have gazed upon you in your holy place, *
value.halfverse: that I might behold your power and your glory.

value.verse: For your loving-kindness is better than life itself; *
value.halfverse: my lips shall give you praise.

value.verse: So will I bless you as long as I live *
value.halfverse: and lift up my hands in your Name.
and my mouth praises you with joyful lips,
value.verse: My soul is content, as with marrow and fatness, *

value.halfverse: and meditate on you in the night watches.
value.verse: When I remember you upon my bed, *

value.halfverse: and under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.
value.verse: For you have been my helper, *
My soul clings to you; *
value.halfverse: your right hand holds me fast.

value.verse: [May those who seek my life to destroy it *
value.halfverse: go down into the depths of the earth;
and let them be food for jackals.
value.verse: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword, *

value.halfverse: for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.]
value.verse:
But the king will rejoice in God;
all those who swear by him will be glad; *
Teach me, O LORD, the way of your statutes, *
value.halfverse: and I shall keep it to the end.
I shall keep it with all my heart.
value.verse: Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law; *
Make me go in the path of your commandments, *
value.halfverse: for that is my desire.
and not to unjust gain.
value.verse: Incline my heart to your decrees *
Turn my eyes from watching what is worthless; *
value.halfverse: give me life in your ways.
which you make to those who fear you.
value.verse: Fulfill your promise to your servant, *
Turn away the reproach which I dread, *
value.halfverse: because your judgments are good.

value.verse: Behold, I long for your commandments; *
value.halfverse: in your righteousness preserve my life.

value.verse: LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger; *
value.halfverse: do not punish me in your wrath.

value.verse: Have pity on me, LORD, for I am weak; *
value.halfverse: heal me, LORD, for my bones are racked.
how long, O LORD, how long?
value.verse: My spirit shakes with terror; *

value.halfverse: save me for your mercy’s sake.
value.verse: Turn, O LORD, and deliver me; *
For in death no one remembers you; *
value.halfverse: and who will give you thanks in the grave?

value.verse: I grow weary because of my groaning; *
value.halfverse:
every night I drench my bed
 and flood my couch with tears.
and worn away because of all my enemies.
value.verse: My eyes are wasted with grief *
Depart from me, all evildoers, *
value.halfverse: for the LORD has heard the sound of my weeping.
the LORD accepts my prayer.
value.verse: The LORD has heard my supplication; *
All my enemies shall be confounded and quake with fear; *
value.halfverse: they shall turn back and suddenly be put to shame.

value.verse: I waited patiently upon the LORD; *
value.halfverse: he stooped to me and heard my cry.

value.verse: He lifted me out of the desolate pit, out of the mire and clay; *
value.halfverse: he set my feet upon a high cliff and made my footing sure.

many shall see, and stand in awe,
 and put their trust in the LORD.
value.verse:
He put a new song in my mouth,
a song of praise to our God; *
Happy are they who trust in the LORD! *
value.halfverse: they do not resort to evil spirits or turn to false gods.

value.verse:
Great things are they that you have done, O LORD my God!
how great your wonders and your plans for us! *
value.halfverse: there is none who can be compared with you.

value.verse: Oh, that I could make them known and tell them! *
value.halfverse: but they are more than I can count.

value.verse: In sacrifice and offering you take no pleasure *
value.halfverse: (you have given me ears to hear you);
and so I said, “Behold, I come.
value.verse: Burnt-offering and sin-offering you have not required, *
In the roll of the book it is written concerning me: *
value.halfverse:
‘I love to do your will, O my God;
 your law is deep in my heart.’”

behold, I did not restrain my lips;
 and that, O LORD, you know.
value.verse: I proclaimed righteousness in the great congregation; *

Your righteousness have I not hidden in my heart;
I have spoken of your faithfulness and your deliverance; *
value.halfverse: I have not concealed your love and faithfulness from the great congregation.
let your love and your faithfulness keep me safe for ever,
value.verse:
You are the LORD;
do not withhold your compassion from me; *

value.halfverse:
they are more in number than the hairs of my head,
 and my heart fails me.
value.verse:
For innumerable troubles have crowded upon me;
my sins have overtaken me, and I cannot see; *
Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me; *
value.halfverse: O LORD, make haste to help me.
let them draw back and be disgraced who take pleasure in my misfortune.
value.verse:
[Let them be ashamed and altogether dismayed
who seek after my life to destroy it; *
Let those who say “Aha!” and gloat over me be confounded, *
value.halfverse: because they are ashamed.

value.verse: Let all who seek you rejoice in you and be glad; *
value.halfverse:
let those who love your salvation continually say,
 “Great is the LORD!”
the Lord will have regard for me.
value.verse: Though I am poor and afflicted, *

value.halfverse: do not tarry, O my God.]
value.verse: You are my helper and my deliverer; *
Glory to God in the highest,
value.halfverse: and peace to his people on earth.

value.verse:
Lord God, heavenly King,
almighty God and Father,
value.halfverse:
we worship you, we give you thanks,
we praise you for your glory.

value.verse:
Lord Jesus Christ, only Son of the Father,
Lord God, Lamb of God,
you take away the sin of the world:
value.halfverse: have mercy on us;

value.verse: you are seated at the right hand of the Father:
value.halfverse: receive our prayer.

value.verse:
For you alone are the Holy One,
you alone are the Lord,
you alone are the Most High,
value.halfverse:
Jesus Christ,
with the Holy Spirit,
in the glory of God the Father. Amen.
until I make your enemies your footstool.”
value.verse: The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, *

value.halfverse: saying, “Rule over your enemies round about you.
value.verse: The LORD will send the scepter of your power out of Zion, *
Princely state has been yours from the day of your birth; *
value.halfverse:
in the beauty of holiness have I begotten you,
 like dew from the womb of the morning.”
“You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.”
value.verse: The LORD has sworn and he will not recant: *

The Lord who is at your right hand
will smite kings in the day of his wrath; *
value.halfverse: he will rule over the nations.
he will smash heads over the wide earth.
value.verse: He will heap high the corpses; *

value.halfverse: therefore he will lift high his head.
value.verse: He will drink from the brook beside the road; *
In Judah is God known; *
value.halfverse: his Name is great in Israel.
and his dwelling is in Zion.
value.verse: At Salem is his tabernacle, *
There he broke the flashing arrows, *
value.halfverse: the shield, the sword, and the weapons of battle.

value.verse: How glorious you are! *
value.halfverse: more splendid than the everlasting mountains!
none of the warriors can lift a hand.
value.verse:
The strong of heart have been despoiled;
they sink into sleep; *
At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, *
value.halfverse: both horse and rider lie stunned.
who can stand before you when you are angry?
value.verse: What terror you inspire! *

value.halfverse: the earth was afraid and was still;
value.verse: From heaven you pronounced judgment; *

value.halfverse: and to save all the oppressed of the earth.
value.verse: When God rose up to judgment *

value.halfverse: and the remnant of Hamath will keep your feasts.
value.verse: Truly, wrathful Edom will give you thanks, *
Make a vow to the LORD your God and keep it; *
value.halfverse: let all around him bring gifts to him who is worthy to be feared.

value.verse: He breaks the spirit of princes, *
value.halfverse: and strikes terror in the kings of the earth.

value.verse: Be joyful in God, all you lands; *
value.halfverse:
sing the glory of his Name;
 sing the glory of his praise.
because of your great strength your enemies cringe before you.
value.verse: Say to God, “How awesome are your deeds! *

value.halfverse: sings to you, sings out your Name.”
value.verse: All the earth bows down before you, *

value.halfverse: how wonderful he is in his doing toward all people.
value.verse: Come now and see the works of God, *

He turned the sea into dry land,
so that they went through the water on foot, *
value.halfverse: and there we rejoiced in him.

value.verse:
In his might he rules for ever;
his eyes keep watch over the nations; *
value.halfverse: let no rebel rise up against him.
make the voice of his praise to be heard;
value.verse: Bless our God, you peoples; *

value.halfverse: and will not allow our feet to slip.
value.verse: Who holds our souls in life, *

value.halfverse: you have tried us just as silver is tried.
value.verse: For you, O God, have proved us; *
You brought us into the snare; *
value.halfverse: you laid heavy burdens upon our backs.
but you brought us out into a place of refreshment.
value.verse:
You let enemies ride over our heads;
we went through fire and water; *

I will enter your house with burnt-offerings
and will pay you my vows, *
value.halfverse:
which I promised with my lips
 and spoke with my mouth when I was in trouble.

value.verse:
I will offer you sacrifices of fat beasts
with the smoke of rams; *
value.halfverse: I will give you oxen and goats.

value.verse: Come and listen, all you who fear God, *
value.halfverse: and I will tell you what he has done for me.
and his praise was on my tongue.
value.verse: I called out to him with my mouth, *

value.halfverse: the Lord would not have heard me;
value.verse: If I had found evil in my heart, *

value.halfverse: he has attended to the voice of my prayer.
value.verse: But in truth God has heard me; *
Blessed be God, who has not rejected my prayer, *
value.halfverse: nor withheld his love from me.
do not be jealous of those who do wrong.
value.verse: Do not fret yourself because of evildoers; *
For they shall soon wither like the grass, *
value.halfverse: and like the green grass fade away.
dwell in the land and feed on its riches.
value.verse: Put your trust in the LORD and do good; *
Take delight in the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and he shall give you your heart’s desire.
and he will bring it to pass.
value.verse: Commit your way to the LORD and put your trust in him, *

value.halfverse: and your just dealing as the noonday.
value.verse: He will make your righteousness as clear as the light *

value.halfverse: and wait patiently for him.
value.verse: Be still before the LORD *

value.halfverse: the one who succeeds in evil schemes.
value.verse: Do not fret yourself over the one who prospers, *

value.halfverse: do not fret yourself; it leads only to evil.
value.verse: Refrain from anger, leave rage alone; *

value.halfverse: but those who wait upon the LORD shall possess the land.
value.verse: For evildoers shall be cut off, *

value.halfverse: you shall search out their place, but they will not be there.
value.verse: In a little while the wicked shall be no more; *

value.halfverse: they will delight in abundance of peace.
value.verse: But the lowly shall possess the land; *
The wicked plot against the righteous *
value.halfverse: and gnash at them with their teeth.

value.verse: The Lord laughs at the wicked, *
value.halfverse: because he sees that their day will come.
to slaughter those who are upright in their ways.
value.verse:
The wicked draw their sword and bend their bow
to strike down the poor and needy, *

value.halfverse: and their bow shall be broken.
value.verse: Their sword shall go through their own heart, *

value.halfverse: is better than great riches of the wicked.
value.verse: The little that the righteous has *
For the power of the wicked shall be broken, *
value.halfverse: but the LORD upholds the righteous.
and all that is within me, bless his holy Name.
value.verse: Bless the LORD, O my soul, *

value.halfverse: and forget not all his benefits.
value.verse: Bless the LORD, O my soul, *

value.halfverse: and heals all your infirmities;
value.verse: He forgives all your sins *

value.halfverse: and crowns you with mercy and loving-kindness;
value.verse: He redeems your life from the grave *
He satisfies you with good things, *
value.halfverse: and your youth is renewed like an eagle’s.
and judgment for all who are oppressed.
value.verse: The LORD executes righteousness *
He made his ways known to Moses *
value.halfverse: and his works to the children of Israel.
slow to anger and of great kindness.
value.verse: The LORD is full of compassion and mercy, *

value.halfverse: nor will he keep his anger for ever.
value.verse: He will not always accuse us, *

value.halfverse: nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.
value.verse: He has not dealt with us according to our sins, *
For as the heavens are high above the earth, *
value.halfverse: so is his mercy great upon those who fear him.
so far has he removed our sins from us.
value.verse: As far as the east is from the west, *
As a father cares for his children, *
value.halfverse: so does the LORD care for those who fear him.

value.verse: For he himself knows whereof we are made; *
value.halfverse: he remembers that we are but dust.
we flourish like a flower of the field;
value.verse: Our days are like the grass; *

value.halfverse: and its place shall know it no more.
value.verse: When the wind goes over it, it is gone, *

value.halfverse: and his righteousness on children’s children;
value.verse: But the merciful goodness of the LORD endures for ever on those who fear him, *
On those who keep his covenant *
value.halfverse: and remember his commandments and do them.

value.verse: The LORD has set his throne in heaven, *
value.halfverse: and his kingship has dominion over all.

value.verse:
Bless the LORD, you angels of his,
you mighty ones who do his bidding, *
value.halfverse: and hearken to the voice of his word.
you ministers of his who do his will.
value.verse: Bless the LORD, all you his hosts, *

Bless the LORD, all you works of his,
in all places of his dominion; *
value.halfverse: bless the LORD, O my soul.
and his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, *
Let all those whom the LORD has redeemed proclaim *
value.halfverse: that he redeemed them from the hand of the foe.

from the east and from the west,
 from the north and from the south.
value.verse: He gathered them out of the lands; *

value.halfverse: they found no way to a city where they might dwell.
value.verse: Some wandered in desert wastes; *
They were hungry and thirsty; *
value.halfverse: their spirits languished within them.
and he delivered them from their distress.
value.verse: Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, *

value.halfverse: to go to a city where they might dwell.
value.verse: He put their feet on a straight path *

value.halfverse: and the wonders he does for his children.
value.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his mercy *

value.halfverse: and fills the hungry with good things.
value.verse: For he satisfies the thirsty *
Some sat in darkness and deep gloom, *
value.halfverse: bound fast in misery and iron;

value.verse: Because they rebelled against the words of God *
value.halfverse: and despised the counsel of the Most High.
they stumbled, and there was none to help.
value.verse: So he humbled their spirits with hard labor; *

value.halfverse: and he delivered them from their distress.
value.verse: Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, *
He led them out of darkness and deep gloom *
value.halfverse: and broke their bonds asunder.

value.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his mercy *
value.halfverse: and the wonders he does for his children.

value.verse: For he shatters the doors of bronze *
value.halfverse: and breaks in two the iron bars.
they were afflicted because of their sins.
value.verse: Some were fools and took to rebellious ways; *
They abhorred all manner of food *
value.halfverse: and drew near to death’s door.

value.verse: Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, *
value.halfverse: and he delivered them from their distress.
and saved them from the grave.
value.verse: He sent forth his word and healed them *
Let them give thanks to the LORD for his mercy *
value.halfverse: and the wonders he does for his children.

value.verse: Let them offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and tell of his acts with shouts of joy.
and plied their trade in deep waters;
value.verse: Some went down to the sea in ships *

value.halfverse: and his wonders in the deep.
value.verse: They beheld the works of the LORD *

value.halfverse: which tossed high the waves of the sea.
value.verse: Then he spoke, and a stormy wind arose, *
They mounted up to the heavens and fell back to the depths; *
value.halfverse: their hearts melted because of their peril.
and were at their wits’ end.
value.verse: They reeled and staggered like drunkards *
Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, *
value.halfverse: and he delivered them from their distress.
and quieted the waves of the sea.
value.verse: He stilled the storm to a whisper *
Then were they glad because of the calm, *
value.halfverse: and he brought them to the harbor they were bound for.
and the wonders he does for his children.
value.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his mercy *
Let them exalt him in the congregation of the people *
value.halfverse: and praise him in the council of the elders.

value.verse: The LORD changed rivers into deserts, *
value.halfverse: and water-springs into thirsty ground,
because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.
value.verse: A fruitful land into salt flats, *
He changed deserts into pools of water *
value.halfverse: and dry land into water-springs.

value.verse: He settled the hungry there, *
value.halfverse: and they founded a city to dwell in.
and brought in a fruitful harvest.
value.verse: They sowed fields, and planted vineyards, *

value.halfverse: he did not let their herds decrease.
value.verse: He blessed them, so that they increased greatly; *
Yet when they were diminished and brought low, *
value.halfverse: through stress of adversity and sorrow,

value.verse: (He pours contempt on princes *
value.halfverse: and makes them wander in trackless wastes)

value.verse: He lifted up the poor out of misery *
value.halfverse: and multiplied their families like flocks of sheep.
but all wickedness will shut its mouth.
value.verse: The upright will see this and rejoice, *
Whoever is wise will ponder these things, *
value.halfverse: and consider well the mercies of the LORD.
and his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, *
Let all those whom the LORD has redeemed proclaim *
value.halfverse: that he redeemed them from the hand of the foe.

value.verse: Then he spoke, and a stormy wind arose, *
They mounted up to the heavens and fell back to the depths; *
value.halfverse: their hearts melted because of their peril.
and were at their wits’ end.
value.verse: They reeled and staggered like drunkards *
Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, *
value.halfverse: and he delivered them from their distress.
and quieted the waves of the sea.
value.verse: He stilled the storm to a whisper *
Then were they glad because of the calm, *
value.halfverse: and he brought them to the harbor they were bound for.
and the wonders he does for his children.
value.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his mercy *
Let them exalt him in the congregation of the people *
value.halfverse: and praise him in the council of the elders.

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

antiphon.12-17: O come, Thou Rod of Jesse, free Thine own from Satan's tyranny; From depths of hell Thy people save, And give them victory o’er the grave.
antiphon.12-21: O come, Adonai, Lord of might, Who to Thy tribes, on Sinai's height, In ancient times didst give the law In cloud and majesty and awe.
antiphon.12-20: O come, Thou Key of David, come And open wide our heav'nly home; Make safe the way that leads on high, And close the path to misery.
antiphon.12-19: O come, Thou Dayspring, from on high, And cheer us by Thy drawing nigh; Disperse the gloomy clouds of night, And death's dark shadows put to flight.
antiphon.12-18: O come, Thou Rod of Jesse, free Thine own from Satan's tyranny; From depths of hell Thy people save, And give them victory o'er the grave.
antiphon.12-16: O come, O come, Emmanuel, And ransom captive Israel, That mourns in lonely exile here, Until the Son of God appear.
antiphon.12-23: O come, Desire of nations, bind All peoples in one heart and mind; Bid envy, strife and quarrels cease; Fill the whole world with heaven’s peace.
antiphon.12-22: O come, Thou Wisdom from on high, And order all things, far and nigh; To us the path of knowledge show, And cause us in her ways to go.

value.verse:
My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord,
my spirit rejoices in God my Savior; *
value.halfverse: for he has looked with favor on his lowly servant.

the Almighty has done great things for me,
and holy is his Name.
value.verse: From this day all generations will call me blessed: *

value.halfverse: in every generation.
value.verse: He has mercy on those who fear him *
He has shown the strength of his arm, *
value.halfverse: he has scattered the proud in their conceit.
and has lifted up the lowly.
value.verse: He has cast down the mighty from their thrones, *

value.halfverse: and the rich he has sent away empty.
value.verse: He has filled the hungry with good things, *

value.halfverse: for he has remembered his promise of mercy,
value.verse: He has come to the help of his servant Israel, *

value.halfverse: to Abraham and his children for ever.
value.verse: The promise he made to our fathers, *

value.halfverse: and have great delight in his commandments!
value.verse:
Hallelujah!
Happy are they who fear the Lord *
Their descendants will be mighty in the land; *
value.halfverse: the generation of the upright will be blessed.
and their righteousness will last for ever.
value.verse: Wealth and riches will be in their house, *
Light shines in the darkness for the upright; *
value.halfverse: the righteous are merciful and full of compassion.

value.verse: It is good for them to be generous in lending *
value.halfverse: and to manage their affairs with justice.

value.verse: For they will never be shaken; *
value.halfverse: the righteous will be kept in everlasting remembrance.

their heart is right;
 they put their trust in the Lord.
value.verse: They will not be afraid of any evil rumors; *
Their heart is established and will not shrink, *
value.halfverse: until they see their desire upon their enemies.

value.verse: They have given freely to the poor, *
value.halfverse:
and their righteousness stands fast for ever;
 they will hold up their head with honor.

value.verse:
The wicked will see it and be angry;
they will gnash their teeth and pine away; *
value.halfverse: the desires of the wicked will perish.

value.verse:
Have mercy on me, O God,
for my enemies are hounding me; *
value.halfverse: all day long they assault and oppress me.

value.verse: They hound me all the day long; *
value.halfverse: truly there are many who fight against me, O Most High.
I will put my trust in you.
value.verse: Whenever I am afraid, *

In God, whose word I praise,
in God I trust and will not be afraid, *
value.halfverse: for what can flesh do to me?
their only thought is to do me evil.
value.verse: All day long they damage my cause; *

value.halfverse:
they spy upon my footsteps;
 because they seek my life.
value.verse: They band together; they lie in wait; *
Shall they escape despite their wickedness? *
value.halfverse: O God, in your anger, cast down the peoples.
are they not recorded in your book?
value.verse:
You have noted my lamentation;
put my tears into your bottle; *

value.halfverse: this I know, for God is on my side.
value.verse: Whenever I call upon you, my enemies will be put to flight; *

value.halfverse: for what can mortals do to me?
value.verse:
In God the LORD, whose word I praise,
in God I trust and will not be afraid, *

value.halfverse: I will present to you thank-offerings;
value.verse: I am bound by the vow I made to you, O God; *

value.halfverse: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.
value.verse: For you have rescued my soul from death and my feet from stumbling, *
Blessed be the LORD my rock! *
value.halfverse: who trains my hands to fight and my fingers to battle;

my shield in whom I trust,
 who subdues the peoples under me.
value.verse: My help and my fortress, my stronghold and my deliverer, *

value.halfverse: mere mortals that you should think of us?
value.verse: O LORD, what are we that you should care for us? *

value.halfverse: our days are like a passing shadow.
value.verse: We are like a puff of wind; *

value.halfverse: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
value.verse: Bow your heavens, O LORD, and come down; *

value.halfverse: shoot out your arrows and rout them.
value.verse: Hurl the lightning and scatter them; *
Stretch out your hand from on high; *
value.halfverse:
rescue me and deliver me from the great waters,
 from the hand of foreign peoples,
and whose right hand is raised in falsehood.
value.verse: Whose mouths speak deceitfully *
O God, I will sing to you a new song; *
value.halfverse: I will play to you on a ten-stringed lyre.

value.verse: You give victory to kings *
value.halfverse: and have rescued David your servant.
and deliver me from the hand of foreign peoples,
value.verse: Rescue me from the hurtful sword *
Whose mouths speak deceitfully *
value.halfverse: and whose right hand is raised in falsehood.
and our daughters like sculptured corners of a palace.
value.verse: May our sons be like plants well nurtured from their youth, *
May our barns be filled to overflowing with all manner of crops; *
value.halfverse:
may the flocks in our pastures increase by thousands and tens of thousands;
 may our cattle be fat and sleek.
no wailing in the public squares.
value.verse: May there be no breaching of the walls, no going into exile, *
Happy are the people of whom this is so! *
value.halfverse: happy are the people whose God is the LORD!
and hide yourself in time of trouble?
value.verse: Why do you stand so far off, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: but they are trapped in the schemes they have devised.
value.verse: The wicked arrogantly persecute the poor, *
The wicked boast of their heart’s desire; *
value.halfverse: the covetous curse and revile the LORD.
their only thought is, “God does not matter.”
value.verse: The wicked are so proud that they care not for God; *

value.halfverse: they defy all their enemies.
value.verse:
Their ways are devious at all times;
your judgments are far above out of their sight; *

value.halfverse: no harm shall happen to me ever.”
value.verse: They say in their heart, “I shall not be shaken; *
Their mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and oppression; *
value.halfverse: under their tongue are mischief and wrong.

value.verse:
They lurk in ambush in public squares
and in secret places they murder the innocent; *
value.halfverse: they spy out the helpless.

value.verse:
They lie in wait, like a lion in a covert;
they lie in wait to seize upon the lowly; *
value.halfverse: they seize the lowly and drag them away in their net.
the helpless fall before their power.
value.verse: The innocent are broken and humbled before them; *

value.halfverse: he hides his face; he will never notice.”
value.verse: They say in their heart, “God has forgotten; *

value.halfverse: do not forget the afflicted.
value.verse:
Rise up, O LORD;
lift up your hand, O God; *

value.halfverse: why should they say in their heart, “You do not care”?
value.verse: Why should the wicked revile God? *
Surely, you behold trouble and misery; *
value.halfverse: you see it and take it into your own hand.
for you are the helper of orphans.
value.verse: The helpless commit themselves to you, *

value.halfverse: search out their wickedness until you find none.
value.verse: Break the power of the wicked and evil; *

value.halfverse: the ungodly shall perish from his land.
value.verse: The LORD is King for ever and ever; *
The LORD will hear the desire of the humble; *
value.halfverse: you will strengthen their heart and your ears shall hear;
so that mere mortals may strike terror no more.
value.verse: To give justice to the orphan and oppressed, *

value.halfverse: hide not your face from me in the day of my trouble.
value.verse: LORD, hear my prayer, and let my cry come before you; *

value.halfverse: when I call, make haste to answer me,
value.verse: Incline your ear to me; *
For my days drift away like smoke, *
value.halfverse: and my bones are hot as burning coals.
so that I forget to eat my bread.
value.verse: My heart is smitten like grass and withered, *

value.halfverse: I am but skin and bones.
value.verse: Because of the voice of my groaning *

value.halfverse: like an owl among the ruins.
value.verse: I have become like a vulture in the wilderness, *
I lie awake and groan; *
value.halfverse: I am like a sparrow, lonely on a house-top.
and those who scoff at me have taken an oath against me.
value.verse: My enemies revile me all day long, *

value.halfverse: and mingled my drink with weeping.
value.verse: For I have eaten ashes for bread *

value.halfverse: you have lifted me up and thrown me away.
value.verse: Because of your indignation and wrath *
My days pass away like a shadow, *
value.halfverse: and I wither like the grass.
and your Name from age to age.
value.verse: But you, O LORD, endure for ever, *

value.halfverse: indeed, the appointed time has come.
value.verse:
You will arise and have compassion on Zion,
for it is time to have mercy upon her; *

value.halfverse: and are moved to pity even for her dust.
value.verse: For your servants love her very rubble, *

value.halfverse: and all the kings of the earth your glory.
value.verse: The nations shall fear your Name, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: and his glory will appear.
value.verse: For the LORD will build up Zion, *
He will look with favor on the prayer of the homeless; *
value.halfverse: he will not despise their plea.
so that a people yet unborn may praise the LORD.
value.verse: Let this be written for a future generation, *
For the LORD looked down from his holy place on high; *
value.halfverse: from the heavens he beheld the earth;
and set free those condemned to die;
value.verse: That he might hear the groan of the captive *
That they may declare in Zion the Name of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and his praise in Jerusalem;
and the kingdoms also, to serve the LORD.
value.verse: When the peoples are gathered together, *

value.halfverse: he has shortened the number of my days;
value.verse: He has brought down my strength before my time; *

value.halfverse: your years endure throughout all generations.
value.verse:
And I said, “O my God,
do not take me away in the midst of my days; *

value.halfverse: and the heavens are the work of your hands;
value.verse: In the beginning, O LORD, you laid the foundations of the earth, *

They shall perish, but you will endure;
they all shall wear out like a garment; *
value.halfverse:
as clothing you will change them,
 and they shall be changed;

value.verse: But you are always the same, *
value.halfverse: and your years will never end.

value.verse: The children of your servants shall continue, *
value.halfverse: and their offspring shall stand fast in your sight.”

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

value.halfverse: I will trust in him and not be afraid.
value.verse: Surely, it is God who saves me; *

value.halfverse: and he will be my Savior.
value.verse: For the Lord is my stronghold and my sure defense, *
Therefore you shall draw water with rejoicing *
value.halfverse: from the springs of salvation.

value.verse: And on that day you shall say, *
value.halfverse: Give thanks to the Lord and call upon his Name;

value.verse: Make his deeds known among the peoples; *
value.halfverse: see that they remember that his Name is exalted.
and this is known in all the world.
value.verse: Sing praises of the Lord, for he has done great things, *
Cry aloud, inhabitants of Zion, ring out your joy, *
value.halfverse: for the great one in the midst of you is the Holy One of Israel.

en-bcp1979-canticle-9.label: Canticle 9: The First Song of Isaiah

value.halfverse:
lest, if you do not hear me,
 I become like those who go down to the Pit.
value.verse:
O LORD, I call to you;
my Rock, do not be deaf to my cry; *
Hear the voice of my prayer when I cry out to you, *
value.halfverse: when I lift up my hands to your holy of holies.

who speak peaceably with their neighbors,
 while strife is in their hearts.
value.verse: Do not snatch me away with the wicked or with the evildoers, *

value.halfverse: and according to the wickedness of their actions.
value.verse: Repay them according to their deeds, *

value.halfverse: and give them their just deserts.
value.verse: According to the work of their hands repay them, *

value.halfverse: therefore he will break them down and not build them up.
value.verse:
They have no understanding of the LORD’S doings,
nor of the works of his hands; *

value.halfverse: for he has heard the voice of my prayer.
value.verse: Blessed is the LORD! *

value.halfverse: my heart trusts in him, and I have been helped;
value.verse: The LORD is my strength and my shield; *

value.halfverse: and in my song will I praise him.
value.verse: Therefore my heart dances for joy, *

value.halfverse: a safe refuge for his anointed.
value.verse: The LORD is the strength of his people, *
Save your people and bless your inheritance; *
value.halfverse: shepherd them and carry them for ever.
how many there are who rise up against me!
value.verse: LORD, how many adversaries I have! *

value.halfverse: “There is no help for him in his God.”
value.verse: How many there are who say of me, *

value.halfverse: you are my glory, the one who lifts up my head.
value.verse: But you, O LORD, are a shield about me; *

value.halfverse: and he answers me from his holy hill;
value.verse: I call aloud upon the LORD, *
I lie down and go to sleep; *
value.halfverse: I wake again, because the LORD sustains me.

value.verse: I do not fear the multitudes of people *
value.halfverse: who set themselves against me all around.

value.verse: Rise up, O LORD; set me free, O my God; *
value.halfverse:
surely, you will strike all my enemies across the face,
 you will break the teeth of the wicked.

value.verse: Deliverance belongs to the LORD. *
value.halfverse: Your blessing be upon your people!
I have no haughty looks.
value.verse: O LORD, I am not proud; *

value.halfverse: or with things that are too hard for me.
value.verse: I do not occupy myself with great matters, *

value.halfverse: my soul is quieted within me.
value.verse:
But I still my soul and make it quiet,
like a child upon its mother’s breast; *
O Israel, wait upon the LORD, *
value.halfverse: from this time forth for evermore.

value.verse: Save me, O God, *
value.halfverse: for the waters have risen up to my neck.
and there is no firm ground for my feet.
value.verse: I am sinking in deep mire, *
I have come into deep waters, *
value.halfverse: and the torrent washes over me.

value.verse:
I have grown weary with my crying;
my throat is inflamed; *
value.halfverse: my eyes have failed from looking for my God.
Must I then give back what I never stole?
value.verse:
Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head;
my lying foes who would destroy me are mighty. *

value.halfverse: and my faults are not hidden from you.
value.verse: O God, you know my foolishness, *

value.halfverse: let not those who seek you be disgraced because of me, O God of Israel.
value.verse: Let not those who hope in you be put to shame through me, Lord GOD of hosts; *
Surely, for your sake have I suffered reproach, *
value.halfverse: and shame has covered my face.

value.verse: I have become a stranger to my own kindred, *
value.halfverse: an alien to my mother’s children.
the scorn of those who scorn you has fallen upon me.
value.verse: Zeal for your house has eaten me up; *

value.halfverse: but that was turned to my reproach.
value.verse: I humbled myself with fasting, *
I put on sack-cloth also, *
value.halfverse: and became a byword among them.

value.verse: Those who sit at the gate murmur against me, *
value.halfverse: and the drunkards make songs about me.

value.verse: But as for me, this is my prayer to you, *
value.halfverse: at the time you have set, O LORD:
answer me with your unfailing help.
value.verse: “In your great mercy, O God, *

value.halfverse:
let me be rescued from those who hate me
 and out of the deep waters.
value.verse: Save me from the mire; do not let me sink; *

Let not the torrent of waters wash over me,
neither let the deep swallow me up; *
value.halfverse: do not let the Pit shut its mouth upon me.
in your great compassion, turn to me.”
value.verse: Answer me, O LORD, for your love is kind; *
“Hide not your face from your servant; *
value.halfverse: be swift and answer me, for I am in distress.

value.verse: Draw near to me and redeem me; *
value.halfverse: because of my enemies deliver me.

value.verse: You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor; *
value.halfverse: my adversaries are all in your sight.”

I looked for sympathy, but there was none,
 for comforters, but I could find no one.
value.verse: Reproach has broken my heart, and it cannot be healed; *

value.halfverse: and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar to drink.
value.verse: They gave me gall to eat, *

value.halfverse: and their sacred feasts a snare.
value.verse: [Let the table before them be a trap *
Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, *
value.halfverse: and give them continual trembling in their loins.
and let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.
value.verse: Pour out your indignation upon them, *
Let their camp be desolate, *
value.halfverse: and let there be none to dwell in their tents.
and add to the pain of those whom you have pierced.
value.verse: For they persecute him whom you have stricken *

value.halfverse: and let them not receive your vindication.
value.verse: Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt, *

value.halfverse: and not be written among the righteous.]
value.verse: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living *

value.halfverse: your help, O God, will lift me up on high.
value.verse: As for me, I am afflicted and in pain; *

value.halfverse: I will proclaim his greatness with thanksgiving.
value.verse: I will praise the Name of God in song; *

value.halfverse: more than bullocks with horns and hoofs.
value.verse: This will please the LORD more than an offering of oxen, *
The afflicted shall see and be glad; *
value.halfverse: you who seek God, your heart shall live.

value.verse: For the LORD listens to the needy, *
value.halfverse: and his prisoners he does not despise.

value.verse: Let the heavens and the earth praise him, *
value.halfverse: the seas and all that moves in them;
they shall live there and have it in possession.
value.verse: For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah; *

value.halfverse: and those who love his Name will dwell therein.
value.verse: The children of his servants will inherit it, *

value.halfverse: do not hide yourself from my petition.
value.verse: Hear my prayer,O God; *
Listen to me and answer me; *
value.halfverse: I have no peace, because of my cares.

value.verse: I am shaken by the noise of the enemy *
value.halfverse: and by the pressure of the wicked;

value.verse: For they have cast an evil spell upon me *
value.halfverse: and are set against me in fury.
and the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
value.verse: My heart quakes within me, *

value.halfverse: and horror overwhelms me.
value.verse: Fear and trembling have come over me, *

value.halfverse: I would fly away and be at rest.
value.verse: And I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! *

value.halfverse: and make my lodging in the wilderness.
value.verse: I would flee to a far-off place *

value.halfverse: from the stormy wind and tempest.”
value.verse: I would hasten to escape *

Swallow them up, O Lord;
confound their speech; *
value.halfverse: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

value.verse: Day and night the watchmen make their rounds upon her walls, *
value.halfverse: but trouble and misery are in the midst of her.
her streets are never free of oppression and deceit.
value.verse: There is corruption at her heart; *

For had it been an adversary who taunted me,
then I could have borne it; *
value.halfverse:
or had it been an enemy who vaunted himself against me,
 then I could have hidden from him.

value.verse: But it was you, a man after my own heart, *
value.halfverse: my companion, my own familiar friend.

value.verse: We took sweet counsel together, *
value.halfverse: and walked with the throng in the house of God.

value.verse:
Let death come upon them suddenly;
let them go down alive to the grave; *
value.halfverse: for wickedness is in their dwellings, in their very midst.

value.verse: But I will call upon God, *
value.halfverse: and the LORD will deliver me.

value.verse:
In the evening, in the morning, and at noonday,
I will complain and lament, *
value.halfverse: and he will hear my voice.

value.verse: He will bring me safely back from the battle waged against me; *
value.halfverse: for there are many who fight me.
they never change; they do not fear God.
value.verse: God, who is enthroned of old, will hear me and bring them down; *
My companion stretched forth his hand against his comrade; *
value.halfverse: he has broken his covenant.
but war is in his heart.
value.verse: His speech is softer than butter, *

value.halfverse: but they are drawn swords.
value.verse: His words are smoother than oil, *

Cast your burden upon the LORD,
and he will sustain you; *
value.halfverse: he will never let the righteous stumble.

value.verse: For you will bring the bloodthirsty and deceitful *
value.halfverse: down to the pit of destruction, O God.
but I will put my trust in you.
value.verse: They shall not live out half their days, *
O LORD, you have dealt graciously with your servant, *
value.halfverse: according to your word.
for I have believed in your commandments.
value.verse: Teach me discernment and knowledge, *
Before I was afflicted I went astray, *
value.halfverse: but now I keep your word.
instruct me in your statutes.
value.verse: You are good and you bring forth good; *
The proud have smeared me with lies, *
value.halfverse: but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.
but my delight is in your law.
value.verse: Their heart is gross and fat, *

value.halfverse: that I might learn your statutes.
value.verse: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, *

value.halfverse: than thousands in gold and silver.
value.verse: The law of your mouth is dearer to me *

value.halfverse:
the LORD is the strength of my life;
 of whom then shall I be afraid?
value.verse:
The LORD is my light and my salvation;
whom then shall I fear? *

value.halfverse: it was they, my foes and my adversaries, who stumbled and fell.
value.verse: When evildoers came upon me to eat up my flesh, *
Though an army should encamp against me, *
value.halfverse: yet my heart shall not be afraid;
yet will I put my trust in him.
value.verse: And though war should rise up against me, *

One thing have I asked of the LORD;
one thing I seek; *
value.halfverse: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life;

value.verse: To behold the fair beauty of the LORD *
value.halfverse: and to seek him in his temple.

he shall hide me in the secrecy of his dwelling
 and set me high upon a rock.
value.verse: For in the day of trouble he shall keep me safe in his shelter; *

value.halfverse: above my enemies round about me.
value.verse: Even now he lifts up my head *

Therefore I will offer in his dwelling an oblation
with sounds of great gladness; *
value.halfverse: I will sing and make music to the LORD.

value.verse: Hearken to my voice, O LORD, when I call; *
value.halfverse: have mercy on me and answer me.
Your face, LORD, will I seek.
value.verse: You speak in my heart and say, “Seek my face.” *
Hide not your face from me, *
value.halfverse: nor turn away your servant in displeasure.

value.verse:
You have been my helper;
cast me not away; *
value.halfverse: do not forsake me, O God of my salvation.
the LORD will sustain me.
value.verse: Though my father and my mother forsake me, *
Show me your way, O LORD; *
value.halfverse: lead me on a level path, because of my enemies.

value.verse: Deliver me not into the hand of my adversaries, *
value.halfverse:
for false witnesses have risen up against me,
 and also those who speak malice.
in the land of the living!
value.verse:
What if I had not believed
that I should see the goodness of the LORD *

value.halfverse: wait patiently for the LORD.
value.verse:
O tarry and await the LORD’S pleasure;
be strong, and he shall comfort your heart; *

value.halfverse:
nor lingered in the way of sinners,
nor sat in the seats of the scornful!
value.verse: Happy are they who have not walked in the counsel of the wicked, *

value.halfverse: and they meditate on his law day and night.
value.verse: Their delight is in the law of the LORD, *

value.halfverse: everything they do shall prosper.
value.verse:
They are like trees planted by streams of water,
bearing fruit in due season, with leaves that do not wither; *

value.halfverse: they are like chaff which the wind blows away.
value.verse: It is not so with the wicked; *
Therefore the wicked shall not stand upright when judgment comes, *
value.halfverse: nor the sinner in the council of the righteous.
but the way of the wicked is doomed.
value.verse: For the LORD knows the way of the righteous, *

when shall I come to appear before the presence of God?
value.verse: My soul is athirst for God, athirst for the living God; *
My tears have been my food day and night, *
value.halfverse:
while all day long they say to me,
 “Where now is your God?”

value.verse: I pour out my soul when I think on these things; *
value.halfverse: how I went with the multitude and led them into the house of God,

value.verse: With the voice of praise and thanksgiving, *
value.halfverse: among those who keep holy-day.
and why are you so disquieted within me?
value.verse: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul? *

value.halfverse:
for I will yet give thanks to him,
 who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
value.verse: Put your trust in God; *

value.halfverse:
therefore I will remember you from the land of Jordan,
 and from the peak of Mizar among the heights of Hermon.
value.verse: My soul is heavy within me; *

value.halfverse: all your rapids and floods have gone over me.
value.verse: One deep calls to another in the noise of your cataracts; *
The LORD grants his loving-kindness in the daytime; *
value.halfverse:
in the night season his song is with me,
 a prayer to the God of my life.
and why do I go so heavily while the enemy oppresses me?”
value.verse:
I will say to the God of my strength,
“Why have you forgotten me? *
While my bones are being broken, *
value.halfverse: my enemies mock me to my face;
and say to me, “Where now is your God?”
value.verse: All day long they mock me *
Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul? *
value.halfverse: and why are you so disquieted within me?

for I will yet give thanks to him,
 who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
value.verse: Put your trust in God; *

value.halfverse: the house of Jacob from a people of strange speech,
value.verse:
Hallelujah!
When Israel came out of Egypt, *

value.halfverse: and Israel his dominion.
value.verse: Judah became God’s sanctuary *

value.halfverse: Jordan turned and went back.
value.verse: The sea beheld it and fled; *

value.halfverse: and the little hills like young sheep.
value.verse: The mountains skipped like rams, *
What ailed you, O sea, that you fled? *
value.halfverse: O Jordan, that you turned back?

value.verse: You mountains, that you skipped like rams? *
value.halfverse: you little hills like young sheep?
at the presence of the God of Jacob,
value.verse: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, *
Who turned the hard rock into a pool of water *
value.halfverse: and flint-stone into a flowing spring.
but your law do I love.
value.verse: I hate those who have a divided heart, *
You are my refuge and shield; *
value.halfverse: my hope is in your word.

value.verse: Away from me, you wicked! *
value.halfverse: I will keep the commandments of my God.

value.verse: Sustain me according to your promise, that I may live, *
value.halfverse: and let me not be disappointed in my hope.

value.verse: Hold me up, and I shall be safe, *
value.halfverse: and my delight shall be ever in your statutes.

value.verse: You spurn all who stray from your statutes; *
value.halfverse: their deceitfulness is in vain.
therefore I love your decrees.
value.verse: In your sight all the wicked of the earth are but dross; *

value.halfverse: I am afraid of your judgments.
value.verse: My flesh trembles with dread of you; *

value.halfverse: give praise, you servants of the LORD.
value.verse:
Hallelujah!
Praise the Name of the LORD; *

value.halfverse: in the courts of the house of our God.
value.verse: You who stand in the house of the LORD, *
Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good; *
value.halfverse: sing praises to his Name, for it is lovely.
and Israel for his own possession.
value.verse: For the LORD has chosen Jacob for himself *
For I know that the LORD is great, *
value.halfverse: and that our Lord is above all gods.

value.verse: The LORD does whatever pleases him, in heaven and on earth, *
value.halfverse: in the seas and all the deeps.

value.verse: He brings up rain clouds from the ends of the earth; *
value.halfverse:
he sends out lightning with the rain,
 and brings the winds out of his storehouse.

value.verse: It was he who struck down the firstborn of Egypt, *
value.halfverse: the firstborn both of man and beast.
against Pharaoh and all his servants.
value.verse: He sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, O Egypt, *

value.halfverse: and put mighty kings to death:
value.verse: He overthrew many nations *

value.halfverse: and all the kings of Canaan.
value.verse:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
and Og, the kingdoms of Bashan, *

value.halfverse: an inheritance for Israel his people.
value.verse: He gave their land to be an inheritance, *

value.halfverse: your renown, O LORD, endures from age to age.
value.verse: O LORD, your Name is everlasting; *

value.halfverse: and shows compassion to his servants.
value.verse: For the LORD gives his people justice *

value.halfverse: the work of human hands.
value.verse: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, *
They have mouths, but they cannot speak; *
value.halfverse: eyes have they, but they cannot see.
neither is there any breath in their mouth.
value.verse: They have ears, but they cannot hear; *

value.halfverse: and so are all who put their trust in them.
value.verse: Those who make them are like them, *

value.halfverse: O house of Aaron, bless the LORD.
value.verse: Bless the LORD, O house of Israel; *
Bless the LORD, O house of Levi; *
value.halfverse: you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD.

value.verse: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, *
value.halfverse:
who dwells in Jerusalem.
 Hallelujah!

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

value.halfverse: surpassing human understanding.
value.verse:
O ruler of the universe, Lord God,
great deeds are they that you have done, *

value.halfverse: O King of all the ages.
value.verse: Your ways are ways of righteousness and truth, *

Who can fail to do you homage, Lord,
and sing the praises of your Name? *
value.halfverse: for you only are the Holy One.
because your just and holy works have been revealed.
value.verse: All nations will draw near and fall down before you, *

en-bcp1979-canticle-19.label: Canticle 19: The Song of the Redeemed

value.verse: May God be merciful to us and bless us, *
value.halfverse: show us the light of his countenance and come to us.

value.verse: Let your ways be known upon earth, *
value.halfverse: your saving health among all nations.
let all the peoples praise you.
value.verse: Let the peoples praise you, O God; *

value.halfverse:
for you judge the peoples with equity
 and guide all the nations upon earth.
value.verse: Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, *

value.halfverse: let all the peoples praise you.
value.verse: Let the peoples praise you, O God; *
The earth has brought forth her increase; *
value.halfverse: may God, our own God, give us his blessing.

value.verse: May God give us his blessing, *
value.halfverse: and may all the ends of the earth stand in awe of him.

en-bcp1979-canticle-10.label: Canticle 10: The Second Song of Isaiah

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

value.verse: Seek the Lord while he wills to be found; *
value.halfverse: call upon him when he draws near.

value.verse: Let the wicked forsake their ways *
value.halfverse: and the evil ones their thoughts;
and to our God, for he will richly pardon.
value.verse: And let them turn to the Lord, and he will have compassion, *

value.halfverse: nor your ways my ways, says the Lord.
value.verse: For my thoughts are not your thoughts, *
For as the heavens are higher than the earth, *
value.halfverse:
so are my ways higher than your ways,
and my thoughts than your thoughts.

value.verse: For as rain and snow fall from the heavens *
value.halfverse: and return not again, but water the earth,

value.verse: Bringing forth life and giving growth, *
value.halfverse: seed for sowing and bread for eating,

value.verse: So is my word that goes forth from my mouth; *
value.halfverse: it will not return to me empty;
and prosper in that for which I sent it.
value.verse: But it will accomplish that which I have purposed, *

value.halfverse: and worshiped a molten image;
value.verse: Israel made a bull-calf at Horeb *
And so they exchanged their Glory *
value.halfverse: for the image of an ox that feeds on grass.
who had done great things in Egypt,
value.verse: They forgot God their Savior, *
Wonderful deeds in the land of Ham, *
value.halfverse: and fearful things at the Red Sea.

value.verse:
So he would have destroyed them,
had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, *
value.halfverse: to turn away his wrath from consuming them.

value.verse: They refused the pleasant land *
value.halfverse: and would not believe his promise.
and would not listen to the voice of the LORD.
value.verse: They grumbled in their tents *

value.halfverse: to overthrow them in the wilderness,
value.verse: So he lifted his hand against them, *
To cast out their seed among the nations, *
value.halfverse: and to scatter them throughout the lands.
and ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
value.verse: They joined themselves to Baal-Peor *
They provoked him to anger with their actions, *
value.halfverse: and a plague broke out among them.

value.verse: Then Phinehas stood up and interceded, *
value.halfverse: and the plague came to an end.
throughout all generations for ever.
value.verse: This was reckoned to him as righteousness *

value.halfverse: so that he punished Moses because of them;
value.verse: Again they provoked his anger at the waters of Meribah, *
For they so embittered his spirit *
value.halfverse: that he spoke rash words with his lips.

value.verse: They did not destroy the peoples *
value.halfverse: as the LORD had commanded them.
and learned their pagan ways,
value.verse: They intermingled with the heathen *

value.halfverse: which became a snare to them.
value.verse: So that they worshiped their idols, *

value.halfverse: and their daughters to evil spirits.
value.verse: They sacrificed their sons *

They shed innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and daughters, *
value.halfverse:
which they offered to the idols of Canaan,
 and the land was defiled with blood.
and went whoring in their evil deeds.
value.verse: Thus they were polluted by their actions *
Therefore the wrath of the LORD was kindled against his people *
value.halfverse: and he abhorred his inheritance.

value.verse: He gave them over to the hand of the heathen, *
value.halfverse: and those who hated them ruled over them.

value.verse: Their enemies oppressed them, *
value.halfverse: and they were humbled under their hand.
and were brought down in their iniquity.
value.verse:
Many a time did he deliver them,
but they rebelled through their own devices, *

value.halfverse: when he heard their lamentation.
value.verse: Nevertheless, he saw their distress, *
He remembered his covenant with them *
value.halfverse: and relented in accordance with his great mercy.

value.verse: He caused them to be pitied *
value.halfverse: by those who held them captive.

that we may give thanks to your holy Name
 and glory in your praise.
value.verse:
Save us, O LORD our God,
and gather us from among the nations, *

Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel,
from everlasting to everlasting; *
value.halfverse:
and let all the people say, “Amen!”
 Hallelujah!

value.verse: I call with my whole heart; *
value.halfverse: answer me, O LORD, that I may keep your statutes.
I will keep your decrees.
value.verse:
I call to you;
oh, that you would save me! *

value.halfverse: for in your word is my trust.
value.verse: Early in the morning I cry out to you, *
My eyes are open in the night watches, *
value.halfverse: that I may meditate upon your promise.

value.verse: Hear my voice, O LORD, according to your loving-kindness; *
value.halfverse: according to your judgments, give me life.

value.verse: They draw near who in malice persecute me; *
value.halfverse: they are very far from your law.

value.verse: You, O LORD, are near at hand, *
value.halfverse: and all your commandments are true.
that you have established them for ever.
value.verse: Long have I known from your decrees *
The earth is the LORD’S and all that is in it, *
value.halfverse: the world and all who dwell therein.
and made it firm upon the rivers of the deep.
value.verse: For it is he who founded it upon the seas *
“Who can ascend the hill of the LORD? *
value.halfverse: and who can stand in his holy place?”

value.verse: “Those who have clean hands and a pure heart, *
value.halfverse:
who have not pledged themselves to falsehood,
 nor sworn by what is a fraud.
and a just reward from the God of their salvation.”
value.verse: They shall receive a blessing from the LORD *

value.halfverse: of those who seek your face, O God of Jacob.
value.verse: Such is the generation of those who seek him, *

Lift up your heads, O gates;
lift them high, O everlasting doors; *
value.halfverse: and the King of glory shall come in.

value.verse: “Who is this King of glory?” *
value.halfverse:
“The LORD, strong and mighty,
 the LORD, mighty in battle.”
and the King of glory shall come in.
value.verse:
Lift up your heads, O gates;
lift them high, O everlasting doors; *

value.halfverse:
“The LORD of hosts,
 he is the King of glory.”
value.verse: “Who is he, this King of glory?” *

value.halfverse: sing his praise in the congregation of the faithful.
value.verse:
Hallelujah!
Sing to the LORD a new song; *
Let Israel rejoice in his Maker; *
value.halfverse: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

value.verse: Let them praise his Name in the dance; *
value.halfverse: let them sing praise to him with timbrel and harp.
and adorns the poor with victory.
value.verse: For the LORD takes pleasure in his people *

value.halfverse: let them be joyful on their beds.
value.verse: Let the faithful rejoice in triumph; *
