Let the praises of God be in their throat *
value.halfverse: and a two-edged sword in their hand;

value.verse: To wreak vengeance on the nations *
value.halfverse: and punishment on the peoples;
and their nobles with links of iron;
value.verse: To bind their kings in chains *
To inflict on them the judgment decreed; *
value.halfverse:
this is glory for all his faithful people.
 Hallelujah!
let the multitude of the isles be glad.
value.verse:
The LORD is King;
let the earth rejoice; *
Clouds and darkness are round about him, *
value.halfverse: righteousness and justice are the foundations of his throne.
and burns up his enemies on every side.
value.verse: A fire goes before him *

value.halfverse: the earth sees it and is afraid.
value.verse: His lightnings light up the world; *

value.halfverse: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
value.verse: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the LORD, *
The heavens declare his righteousness, *
value.halfverse: and all the peoples see his glory.
Bow down before him, all you gods.
value.verse:
Confounded be all who worship carved images
and delight in false gods! *
Zion hears and is glad, and the cities of Judah rejoice, *
value.halfverse: because of your judgments, O LORD.

value.verse:
For you are the LORD,
most high over all the earth; *
value.halfverse: you are exalted far above all gods.

value.verse: The LORD loves those who hate evil; *
value.halfverse:
he preserves the lives of his saints
 and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
and joyful gladness for those who are truehearted.
value.verse: Light has sprung up for the righteous, *
Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous, *
value.halfverse: and give thanks to his holy Name.

value.verse: God takes his stand in the council of heaven; *
value.halfverse: he gives judgment in the midst of the gods:
and show favor to the wicked?
value.verse: “How long will you judge unjustly, *
Save the weak and the orphan; *
value.halfverse: defend the humble and needy;

value.verse: Rescue the weak and the poor; *
value.halfverse: deliver them from the power of the wicked.

value.verse:
They do not know, neither do they understand;
they go about in darkness; *
value.halfverse: all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
and all of you children of the Most High;
value.verse: Now I say to you, ‘You are gods, *

value.halfverse: and fall like any prince.’”
value.verse: Nevertheless, you shall die like mortals, *

value.halfverse: for you shall take all nations for your own.
value.verse: Arise, O God, and rule the earth, *

value.halfverse: I will tell of all your marvelous works.
value.verse: I will give thanks to you, O LORD, with my whole heart; *

value.halfverse: I will sing to your Name, O Most High.
value.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in you; *

value.halfverse: they will stumble and perish at your presence.
value.verse: When my enemies are driven back, *
For you have maintained my right and my cause; *
value.halfverse: you sit upon your throne judging right.

value.verse: You have rebuked the ungodly and destroyed the wicked; *
value.halfverse: you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
their cities plowed under, the memory of them perished;
value.verse: As for the enemy, they are finished, in perpetual ruin, *
But the LORD is enthroned for ever; *
value.halfverse: he has set up this throne for judgment.
he judges the peoples with equity.
value.verse: It is he who rules the world with righteousness; *

value.halfverse: a refuge in time of trouble.
value.verse: The LORD will be a refuge for the oppressed, *

value.halfverse: for you never forsake those who seek you, O LORD.
value.verse: Those who know your Name will put their trust in you, *

value.halfverse: proclaim to the peoples the things he has done.
value.verse: Sing praise to the LORD who dwells in Zion; *

value.halfverse: he will not forget the cry of the afflicted.
value.verse: The Avenger of blood will remember them; *
Have pity on me, O LORD; *
value.halfverse:
see the misery I suffer from those who hate me,
 O you who lift me up from the gate of death;

value.verse:
So that I may tell of all your praises
and rejoice in your salvation *
value.halfverse: in the gates of the city of Zion.

value.verse: The ungodly have fallen into the pit they dug, *
value.halfverse: and in the snare they set is their own foot caught.
the wicked are trapped in the works of their own hands.
value.verse: The LORD is known by his acts of justice; *

value.halfverse: and also all the people that forget God.
value.verse: The wicked shall be given over to the grave, *

value.halfverse: and the hope of the poor shall not perish for ever.
value.verse: For the needy shall not always be forgotten, *

value.halfverse: let them be judged before you.
value.verse: Rise up, O LORD, let not the ungodly have the upper hand; *

value.halfverse: let the ungodly know they are but mortal.
value.verse: Put fear upon them, O LORD; *
I love you, O LORD my strength, *
value.halfverse: O LORD my stronghold, my crag, and my haven.

value.verse: My God, my rock in whom I put my trust, *
value.halfverse:
my shield, the horn of my salvation, and my refuge;
 you are worthy of praise.

value.verse: I will call upon the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and so shall I be saved from my enemies.
and the torrents of oblivion made me afraid.
value.verse: The breakers of death rolled over me, *

value.halfverse: and the snares of death were set for me.
value.verse: The cords of hell entangled me, *

value.halfverse: and cried out to my God for help.
value.verse: I called upon the LORD in my distress *
He heard my voice from his heavenly dwelling; *
value.halfverse: my cry of anguish came to his ears.

value.verse: The earth reeled and rocked; *
value.halfverse:
the roots of the mountains shook;
 they reeled because of his anger.

value.verse:
Smoke rose from his nostrils
and a consuming fire out of his mouth; *
value.halfverse: hot burning coals blazed forth from him.
with a storm cloud under his feet.
value.verse: He parted the heavens and came down *
He mounted on cherubim and flew; *
value.halfverse: he swooped on the wings of the wind.
he made dark waters and thick clouds his pavilion.
value.verse: He wrapped darkness about him; *
From the brightness of his presence, through the clouds, *
value.halfverse: burst hailstones and coals of fire.
the Most High uttered his voice.
value.verse: The LORD thundered out of heaven; *

value.halfverse: he hurled thunderbolts and routed them.
value.verse: He loosed his arrows and scattered them; *

value.halfverse:
at your battle cry, O LORD,
 at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
value.verse:
The beds of the seas were uncovered,
and the foundations of the world laid bare, *
He reached down from on high and grasped me; *
value.halfverse: he drew me out of great waters.
for they were too mighty for me.
value.verse:
He delivered me from my strong enemies
and from those who hated me; *

value.halfverse: but the LORD was my support.
value.verse: They confronted me in the day of my disaster; *

value.halfverse: he rescued me because he delighted in me.
value.verse: He brought me out into an open place; *
Oh, how good and pleasant it is, *
value.halfverse: when brethren live together in unity!

value.verse: It is like fine oil upon the head *
value.halfverse: that runs down upon the beard,
and runs down upon the collar of his robe.
value.verse: Upon the beard of Aaron, *

value.halfverse: that falls upon the hills of Zion.
value.verse: It is like the dew of Hermon *
For there the LORD has ordained the blessing: *
value.halfverse: life for evermore.
O LORD, make haste to help me.
value.verse: Be pleased, O God, to deliver me; *

value.halfverse:
let those who take pleasure in my misfortune
 draw back and be disgraced.
value.verse:
Let those who seek my life be ashamed
and altogether dismayed; *

value.halfverse: because they are ashamed.
value.verse: Let those who say to me “Aha!” and gloat over me turn back, *
Let all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; *
value.halfverse:
let those who love your salvation say for ever,
 “Great is the LORD!”
come to me speedily, O God.
value.verse: But as for me, I am poor and needy; *
You are my helper and my deliverer; *
value.halfverse: O LORD, do not tarry.

value.verse: LORD, who may dwell in your tabernacle? *
value.halfverse: who may abide upon your holy hill?
who speaks the truth from his heart.
value.verse: Whoever leads a blameless life and does what is right, *

There is no guile upon his tongue;
he does no evil to his friend; *
value.halfverse: he does not heap contempt upon his neighbor.
but he honors those who fear the LORD.
value.verse: In his sight the wicked is rejected, *

value.halfverse: and does not take back his word.
value.verse: He has sworn to do no wrong *
He does not give his money in hope of gain, *
value.halfverse: nor does he take a bribe against the innocent.
shall never be overthrown.
value.verse: Whoever does these things *

value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse:
Hallelujah!
Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, *

value.halfverse: or show forth all his praise?
value.verse: Who can declare the mighty acts of the LORD *

value.halfverse: and always do what is right!
value.verse: Happy are those who act with justice *

value.halfverse: and visit me with your saving help;
value.verse: Remember me, O LORD, with the favor you have for your people, *

That I may see the prosperity of your elect
and be glad with the gladness of your people, *
value.halfverse: that I may glory with your inheritance.

value.verse: We have sinned as our forebears did; *
value.halfverse: we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.

value.verse:
In Egypt they did not consider your marvelous works,
nor remember the abundance of your love; *
value.halfverse: they defied the Most High at the Red Sea.

value.verse: But he saved them for his Name’s sake, *
value.halfverse: to make his power known.
and he led them through the deep as through a desert.
value.verse: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up, *
He saved them from the hand of those who hated them *
value.halfverse: and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
not one of them was left.
value.verse: The waters covered their oppressors; *

value.halfverse: and sang him songs of praise.
value.verse: Then they believed his words *
But they soon forgot his deeds *
value.halfverse: and did not wait for his counsel.
and they put God to the test in the desert.
value.verse: A craving seized them in the wilderness, *

value.halfverse: but sent leanness into their soul.
value.verse: He gave them what they asked, *
They envied Moses in the camp, *
value.halfverse: and Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.

value.verse: The earth opened and swallowed Dathan *
value.halfverse: and covered the company of Abiram.
and flames devoured the wicked.
value.verse: Fire blazed up against their company, *
If the LORD had not been on our side, *
value.halfverse: let Israel now say;
when enemies rose up against us;
value.verse: If the LORD had not been on our side, *
Then would they have swallowed us up alive *
value.halfverse: in their fierce anger toward us;
and the torrent gone over us;
value.verse: Then would the waters have overwhelmed us *

value.halfverse: have gone right over us.
value.verse: Then would the raging waters *
Blessed be the LORD! *
value.halfverse: he has not given us over to be a prey for their teeth.

value.verse: We have escaped like a bird from the snare of the fowler; *
value.halfverse: the snare is broken, and we have escaped.

value.verse: Our help is in the Name of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: the maker of heaven and earth.

value.verse:
You are God: we praise you;
You are the Lord; we acclaim you;
You are the eternal Father:
All creation worships you.
To you all angels, all the powers of heaven,
Cherubim and Seraphim, sing in endless praise:
    Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of power and might,
    heaven and earth are full of your glory.
The glorious company of apostles praise you.
The noble fellowship of prophets praise you.
The white-robed army of martyrs praise you.
Throughout the world the holy Church acclaims you;
    Father, of majesty unbounded,
    your true and only Son, worthy of all worship,
    and the Holy Spirit, advocate and guide. 
You, Christ, are the king of glory,
the eternal Son of the Father.
When you became man to set us free
you did not shun the Virgin’s womb.
You overcame the sting of death
and opened the kingdom of heaven to all believers.
You are seated at God’s right hand in glory.
We believe that you will come and be our judge.
    Come then, Lord, and help your people,
    bought with the price of your own blood,
    and bring us with your saints
    to glory everlasting.

value.halfverse: how long will you hide your face from me?
value.verse:
How long, O LORD?
will you forget me for ever? *

value.halfverse: how long shall my enemy triumph over me?
value.verse:
How long shall I have perplexity in my mind,
and grief in my heart, day after day? *
Look upon me and answer me, O LORD my God; *
value.halfverse: give light to my eyes, lest I sleep in death;
and my foes rejoice that I have fallen.
value.verse: Lest my enemy say, “I have prevailed over him,” *
But I put my trust in your mercy; *
value.halfverse: my heart is joyful because of your saving help.
I will praise the Name of the Lord Most High.
value.verse: I will sing to the LORD, for he has dealt with me richly; *

value.halfverse: deliver me in your righteousness.
value.verse:
In you, O LORD, have I taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame; *
Incline your ear to me; *
value.halfverse: make haste to deliver me.
for the sake of your Name, lead me and guide me.
value.verse:
Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe,
for you are my crag and my stronghold; *

value.halfverse: for you are my tower of strength.
value.verse: Take me out of the net that they have secretly set for me, *
Into your hands I commend my spirit, *
value.halfverse:
for you have redeemed me,
 O LORD, O God of truth.
I have promised to keep your words.
value.verse: You only are my portion, O LORD; *
I entreat you with all my heart, *
value.halfverse: be merciful to me according to your promise.

value.verse: I have considered my ways *
value.halfverse: and turned my feet toward your decrees.

value.verse: I hasten and do not tarry *
value.halfverse: to keep your commandments.
I do not forget your law.
value.verse: Though the cords of the wicked entangle me, *

value.halfverse: because of your righteous judgments.
value.verse: At midnight I will rise to give you thanks, *

value.halfverse: and of those who keep your commandments.
value.verse: I am a companion of all who fear you *

value.halfverse: instruct me in your statutes.
value.verse: The earth, O LORD, is full of your love; *
Answer me when I call, O God, defender of my cause; *
value.halfverse:
you set me free when I am hard-pressed;
 have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

how long will you worship dumb idols
 and run after false gods?”
value.verse: “You mortals, how long will you dishonor my glory; *
Know that the LORD does wonders for the faithful; *
value.halfverse: when I call upon the LORD, he will hear me.
speak to your heart in silence upon your bed.
value.verse: Tremble, then, and do not sin; *

value.halfverse: and put your trust in the LORD.
value.verse: Offer the appointed sacrifices *

Many are saying,
“Oh, that we might see better times!” *
value.halfverse: Lift up the light of your countenance upon us, O LORD.
more than when grain and wine and oil increase.
value.verse: You have put gladness in my heart, *
I lie down in peace; at once I fall asleep; *
value.halfverse: for only you, LORD, make me dwell in safety.
give me life according to your word.
value.verse: My soul cleaves to the dust; *
I have confessed my ways, and you answered me; *
value.halfverse: instruct me in your statutes.

value.verse: Make me understand the way of your commandments, *
value.halfverse: that I may meditate on your marvelous works.

value.verse: My soul melts away for sorrow; *
value.halfverse: strengthen me according to your word.

value.verse: Take from me the way of lying; *
value.halfverse: let me find grace through your law.
I have set your judgments before me.
value.verse: I have chosen the way of faithfulness; *
I hold fast to your decrees; *
value.halfverse: O LORD, let me not be put to shame.
for you have set my heart at liberty.
value.verse: I will run the way of your commandments, *
I have done what is just and right; *
value.halfverse: do not deliver me to my oppressors.
let not the proud oppress me.
value.verse: Be surety for your servant’s good; *

value.halfverse: and for your righteous promise.
value.verse: My eyes have failed from watching for your salvation *

value.halfverse: and teach me your statutes.
value.verse: Deal with your servant according to your loving-kindness *
I am your servant; grant me understanding, *
value.halfverse: that I may know your decrees.
for they have broken your law.
value.verse: It is time for you to act, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: more than gold and precious stones.
value.verse: Truly, I love your commandments *

value.halfverse: all paths of falsehood I abhor.
value.verse: I hold all your commandments to be right for me; *

value.halfverse: a very present help in trouble.
value.verse: God is our refuge and strength, *
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be moved, *
value.halfverse: and though the mountains be toppled into the depths of the sea;
and though the mountains tremble at its tumult.
value.verse: Though its waters rage and foam, *

value.halfverse: the God of Jacob is our stronghold.
value.verse: The LORD of hosts is with us; *
There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, *
value.halfverse: the holy habitation of the Most High.
God shall help her at the break of day.
value.verse:
God is in the midst of her;
she shall not be overthrown; *

value.halfverse: God has spoken, and the earth shall melt away.
value.verse: The nations make much ado, and the kingdoms are shaken; *
The LORD of hosts is with us; *
value.halfverse: the God of Jacob is our stronghold.

value.verse: Come now and look upon the works of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: what awesome things he has done on earth.

value.verse: It is he who makes war to cease in all the world; *
value.halfverse:
he breaks the bow, and shatters the spear,
 and burns the shields with fire.

value.verse: “Be still, then, and know that I am God; *
value.halfverse:
I will be exalted among the nations;
 I will be exalted in the earth.”
the God of Jacob is our stronghold.
value.verse: The LORD of hosts is with us; *
LORD, remember David, *
value.halfverse: and all the hardships he endured;
and vowed a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
value.verse: How he swore an oath to the LORD *

value.halfverse: nor climb up into my bed;
value.verse: “I will not come under the roof of my house, *

value.halfverse: nor let my eyelids slumber;
value.verse: I will not allow my eyes to sleep, *

value.halfverse: a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
value.verse: Until I find a place for the LORD, *
“The ark! We heard it was in Ephratah; *
value.halfverse: we found it in the fields of Jearim.
let us fall upon our knees before his footstool.”
value.verse: Let us go to God’s dwelling place; *

value.halfverse: you and the ark of your strength.
value.verse: Arise, O LORD, into your resting-place, *
Let your priests be clothed with righteousness; *
value.halfverse: let your faithful people sing with joy.

value.verse: For your servant David’s sake, *
value.halfverse: do not turn away the face of your Anointed.

value.verse: The LORD has sworn an oath to David; *
value.halfverse: in truth, he will not break it:

value.verse: “A son, the fruit of your body *
value.halfverse: will I set upon your throne.
their children will sit upon your throne for evermore.”
value.verse:
If your children keep my covenant
and my testimonies that I shall teach them, *
For the LORD has chosen Zion; *
value.halfverse: he has desired her for his habitation:

value.verse: “This shall be my resting-place for ever; *
value.halfverse: here will I dwell, for I delight in her.
and satisfy her poor with bread.
value.verse: I will surely bless her provisions, *

value.halfverse: and her faithful people will rejoice and sing.
value.verse: I will clothe her priests with salvation, *

value.halfverse: I have prepared a lamp for my Anointed.
value.verse: There will I make the horn of David flourish; *

value.halfverse: but as for him, his crown will shine.”
value.verse: As for his enemies, I will clothe them with shame; *

value.halfverse:
and are so far from my cry
 and from the words of my distress?
value.verse: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? *

value.halfverse: by night as well, but I find no rest.
value.verse: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but you do not answer; *

value.halfverse: enthroned upon the praises of Israel.
value.verse: Yet you are the Holy One, *

value.halfverse: they trusted, and you delivered them.
value.verse: Our forefathers put their trust in you; *
They cried out to you and were delivered; *
value.halfverse: they trusted in you and were not put to shame.
scorned by all and despised by the people.
value.verse: But as for me, I am a worm and no man, *

value.halfverse: they curl their lips and wag their heads, saying,
value.verse: All who see me laugh me to scorn; *
“He trusted in the LORD; let him deliver him; *
value.halfverse: let him rescue him, if he delights in him.”

value.verse: Yet you are he who took me out of the womb, *
value.halfverse: and kept me safe upon my mother’s breast.
you were my God when I was still in my mother’s womb.
value.verse: I have been entrusted to you ever since I was born; *
Be not far from me, for trouble is near, *
value.halfverse: and there is none to help.
strong bulls of Bashan surround me.
value.verse: Many young bulls encircle me; *
They open wide their jaws at me, *
value.halfverse: like a ravening and a roaring lion.

value.verse:
I am poured out like water;
all my bones are out of joint; *
value.halfverse: my heart within my breast is melting wax.
and you have laid me in the dust of the grave.
value.verse:
My mouth is dried out like a pot-sherd;
my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth; *

value.halfverse:
they pierce my hands and my feet;
 I can count all my bones.
value.verse:
Packs of dogs close me in,
and gangs of evildoers circle around me; *

value.halfverse:
they divide my garments among them;
 they cast lots for my clothing.
value.verse: They stare and gloat over me; *

value.halfverse: you are my strength; hasten to help me.
value.verse: Be not far away, O LORD; *

value.halfverse: my life from the power of the dog.
value.verse: Save me from the sword, *

value.halfverse: my wretched body from the horns of wild bulls.
value.verse: Save me from the lion’s mouth, *

value.halfverse: in the midst of the congregation I will praise you.
value.verse: I will declare your Name to my brethren; *
Praise the LORD, you that fear him; *
value.halfverse:
stand in awe of him, O offspring of Israel;
 all you of Jacob’s line, give glory.
but when they cry to him he hears them.
value.verse:
For he does not despise nor abhor the poor in their poverty;
neither does he hide his face from them; *
My praise is of him in the great assembly; *
value.halfverse: I will perform my vows in the presence of those who worship him.

value.verse:
The poor shall eat and be satisfied,
and those who seek the LORD shall praise him: *
value.halfverse: “May your heart live for ever!”

value.verse: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and all the families of the nations bow before him.

value.verse: For kingship belongs to the LORD; *
value.halfverse: he rules over the nations.

value.verse: To him alone all who sleep in the earth bow down in worship; *
value.halfverse: all who go down to the dust fall before him.

value.verse:
My soul shall live for him;
my descendants shall serve him; *
value.halfverse: they shall be known as the LORD’S for ever.
the saving deeds that he has done.
value.verse: They shall come and make known to a people yet unborn *

value.halfverse: praise the Name of the LORD.
value.verse:
Hallelujah!
Give praise, you servants of the LORD; *

value.halfverse: from this time forth for evermore.
value.verse: Let the Name of the LORD be blessed, *

value.halfverse: let the Name of the LORD be praised.
value.verse: From the rising of the sun to its going down *
The LORD is high above all nations, *
value.halfverse: and his glory above the heavens.
but stoops to behold the heavens and the earth?
value.verse: Who is like the LORD our God, who sits enthroned on high, *

value.halfverse: and lifts up the poor from the ashes.
value.verse: He takes up the weak out of the dust *

value.halfverse: with the princes of his people.
value.verse: He sets them with the princes, *

value.halfverse: to be a joyful mother of children.
value.verse: He makes the woman of a childless house *

Give judgment for me, O God,
and defend my cause against an ungodly people; *
value.halfverse: deliver me from the deceitful and the wicked.
and why do I go so heavily while the enemy oppresses me?
value.verse:
For you are the God of my strength;
why have you put me from you? *
Send out your light and your truth, that they may lead me, *
value.halfverse:
and bring me to your holy hill
 and to your dwelling;
and on the harp I will give thanks to you, O God my God.
value.verse:
That I may go to the altar of God,
to the God of my joy and gladness; *
Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul? *
value.halfverse: and why are you so disquieted within me?

for I will yet give thanks to him,
 who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
value.verse: Put your trust in God; *

value.halfverse: shout to God with a cry of joy.
value.verse: Clap your hands, all you peoples; *

value.halfverse: he is the great King over all the earth.
value.verse: For the LORD Most High is to be feared; *

value.halfverse: and the nations under our feet.
value.verse: He subdues the peoples under us, *
He chooses our inheritance for us, *
value.halfverse: the pride of Jacob whom he loves.

value.verse: God has gone up with a shout, *
value.halfverse: the LORD with the sound of the ram’s-horn.

value.verse: Sing praises to God, sing praises; *
value.halfverse: sing praises to our King, sing praises.
sing praises with all your skill.
value.verse: For God is King of all the earth; *

value.halfverse: God sits upon his holy throne.
value.verse: God reigns over the nations; *
The nobles of the peoples have gathered together *
value.halfverse: with the people of the God of Abraham.
and he is highly exalted.
value.verse: The rulers of the earth belong to God, *

value.halfverse: and upright are your judgments.
value.verse: You are righteous, O LORD, *
You have issued your decrees *
value.halfverse: with justice and in perfect faithfulness.

value.verse: My indignation has consumed me, *
value.halfverse: because my enemies forget your words.

value.verse: Your word has been tested to the uttermost, *
value.halfverse: and your servant holds it dear.
yet I do not forget your commandments.
value.verse: I am small and of little account, *

value.halfverse: and your law is the truth.
value.verse: Your justice is an everlasting justice *
Trouble and distress have come upon me, *
value.halfverse: yet your commandments are my delight.

value.verse: The righteousness of your decrees is everlasting; *
value.halfverse: grant me understanding, that I may live.

the LORD loves the gates of Zion
 more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
value.verse: On the holy mountain stands the city he has founded; *

value.halfverse: O city of our God.
value.verse: Glorious things are spoken of you, *

value.halfverse:
behold Philistia, Tyre, and Ethiopia:
 in Zion were they born.
value.verse: I count Egypt and Babylon among those who know me; *

value.halfverse: and the Most High himself shall sustain her.”
value.verse: Of Zion it shall be said, “Everyone was born in her, *
The LORD will record as he enrolls the peoples, *
value.halfverse: “These also were born there.”
“All my fresh springs are in you.”
value.verse: The singers and the dancers will say, *

value.halfverse:
let me not be humiliated,
 nor let my enemies triumph over me.
value.verse:
To you, O LORD, I lift up my soul;
my God, I put my trust in you; *

value.halfverse: let the treacherous be disappointed in their schemes.
value.verse: Let none who look to you be put to shame; *

value.halfverse: and teach me your paths.
value.verse: Show me your ways, O LORD, *
Lead me in your truth and teach me, *
value.halfverse:
for you are the God of my salvation;
 in you have I trusted all the day long.

value.verse: Remember, O LORD, your compassion and love, *
value.halfverse: for they are from everlasting.

remember me according to your love
 and for the sake of your goodness, O LORD.
value.verse: Remember not the sins of my youth and my transgressions; *

value.halfverse: therefore he teaches sinners in his way.
value.verse: Gracious and upright is the LORD; *
He guides the humble in doing right *
value.halfverse: and teaches his way to the lowly.
to those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.
value.verse: All the paths of the LORD are love and faithfulness *

value.halfverse: forgive my sin, for it is great.
value.verse: For your Name’s sake, O LORD, *
Who are they who fear the LORD? *
value.halfverse: he will teach them the way that they should choose.
and their offspring shall inherit the land.
value.verse: They shall dwell in prosperity, *

value.halfverse: and will show them his covenant.
value.verse: The LORD is a friend to those who fear him *

value.halfverse: for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
value.verse: My eyes are ever looking to the LORD, *
Turn to me and have pity on me, *
value.halfverse: for I am left alone and in misery.

value.verse: The sorrows of my heart have increased; *
value.halfverse: bring me out of my troubles.
and forgive me all my sin.
value.verse: Look upon my adversity and misery *

value.halfverse: and they bear a violent hatred against me.
value.verse: Look upon my enemies, for they are many, *

value.halfverse: let me not be put to shame, for I have trusted in you.
value.verse: Protect my life and deliver me; *
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, *
value.halfverse: for my hope has been in you.

value.verse: Deliver Israel, O God, *
value.halfverse: out of all his troubles.
protect my life from fear of the enemy.
value.verse: Hear my voice, O God, when I complain; *

value.halfverse: from the mob of evildoers.
value.verse: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, *
They sharpen their tongue like a sword, *
value.halfverse: and aim their bitter words like arrows,

value.verse: That they may shoot down the blameless from ambush; *
value.halfverse: they shoot without warning and are not afraid.
they plan how they may hide their snares.
value.verse: They hold fast to their evil course; *

They say, “Who will see us?
who will find out our crimes? *
value.halfverse: we have thought out a perfect plot.”

but God will loose an arrow at them,
 and suddenly they will be wounded.
value.verse: The human mind and heart are a mystery; *

value.halfverse: and all who see them will shake their heads.
value.verse: He will make them trip over their tongues, *

value.halfverse: they will recognize his works.
value.verse: Everyone will stand in awe and declare God’s deeds; *

value.halfverse: and all who are true of heart will glory.
value.verse: The righteous will rejoice in the LORD and put their trust in him, *
He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High, *
value.halfverse: abides under the shadow of the Almighty.

value.verse:
He shall say to the LORD,
“You are my refuge and my stronghold, *
value.halfverse: my God in whom I put my trust.”

value.verse: He shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter *
value.halfverse: and from the deadly pestilence.

value.verse:
He shall cover you with his pinions,
and you shall find refuge under his wings; *
value.halfverse: his faithfulness shall be a shield and buckler.

value.verse: You shall not be afraid of any terror by night, *
value.halfverse: nor of the arrow that flies by day;
nor of the sickness that lays waste at mid-day.
value.verse: Of the plague that stalks in the darkness, *

value.halfverse: but it shall not come near you.
value.verse:
A thousand shall fall at your side
and ten thousand at your right hand, *
Your eyes have only to behold *
value.halfverse: to see the reward of the wicked.
and the Most High your habitation,
value.verse: Because you have made the LORD your refuge, *

value.halfverse: neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.
value.verse: There shall no evil happen to you, *

value.halfverse: to keep you in all your ways.
value.verse: For he shall give his angels charge over you, *

value.halfverse: lest you dash your foot against a stone.
value.verse: They shall bear you in their hands, *

value.halfverse: you shall trample the young lion and the serpent under your feet.
value.verse: You shall tread upon the lion and the adder; *

value.halfverse: I will protect him, because he knows my Name.
value.verse:
Because he is bound to me in love,
therefore will I deliver him; *

value.halfverse:
I am with him in trouble;
 I will rescue him and bring him to honor.
value.verse: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him; *

value.halfverse: and show him my salvation.
value.verse: With long life will I satisfy him, *

The LORD is King;
he has put on splendid apparel; *
value.halfverse:
the LORD has put on his apparel
 and girded himself with strength.
that it cannot be moved;
value.verse: He has made the whole world so sure *
Ever since the world began, your throne has been established; *
value.halfverse: you are from everlasting.
the waters have lifted up their pounding waves.
value.verse:
The waters have lifted up, O LORD,
the waters have lifted up their voice; *

value.halfverse: mightier is the LORD who dwells on high.
value.verse:
Mightier than the sound of many waters,
mightier than the breakers of the sea, *

value.halfverse:
and holiness adorns your house, O LORD,
 for ever and for evermore.
value.verse: Your testimonies are very sure, *
For God alone my soul in silence waits; *
value.halfverse: from him comes my salvation.
my stronghold, so that I shall not be greatly shaken.
value.verse: He alone is my rock and my salvation, *

value.halfverse: as if you were a leaning fence, a toppling wall?
value.verse:
How long will you assail me to crush me,
all of you together, *

value.halfverse: lies are their chief delight.
value.verse: They seek only to bring me down from my place of honor; *

value.halfverse: but in their hearts they curse.
value.verse: They bless with their lips, *

value.halfverse: truly, my hope is in him.
value.verse: For God alone my soul in silence waits; *

value.halfverse: my stronghold, so that I shall not be shaken.
value.verse: He alone is my rock and my salvation, *
In God is my safety and my honor; *
value.halfverse: God is my strong rock and my refuge.
pour out your hearts before him, for God is our refuge.
value.verse: Put your trust in him always, O people, *
Those of high degree are but a fleeting breath, *
value.halfverse: even those of low estate cannot be trusted.

value.verse: On the scales they are lighter than a breath, *
value.halfverse: all of them together.
though wealth increase, set not your heart upon it.
value.verse:
Put no trust in extortion;
in robbery take no empty pride; *

value.halfverse: that power belongs to God.
value.verse: God has spoken once, twice have I heard it, *

value.halfverse: for you repay everyone according to his deeds.
value.verse: Steadfast love is yours, O Lord, *

value.halfverse: because you have given me hope.
value.verse: Remember your word to your servant, *

value.halfverse: that your promise gives me life.
value.verse: This is my comfort in my trouble, *

value.halfverse: but I have not turned from your law.
value.verse: The proud have derided me cruelly, *

value.halfverse: O LORD, I take great comfort.
value.verse: When I remember your judgments of old, *

value.halfverse: because of the wicked who forsake your law.
value.verse: I am filled with a burning rage, *

value.halfverse: wherever I have lived as a stranger.
value.verse: Your statutes have been like songs to me *

value.halfverse: and dwell upon your law.
value.verse: I remember your Name in the night, O LORD, *
This is how it has been with me, *
value.halfverse: because I have kept your commandments.

value.verse: Hear my teaching, O my people; *
value.halfverse: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

value.verse: I will open my mouth in a parable; *
value.halfverse: I will declare the mysteries of ancient times.
we will not hide from their children.
value.verse:
That which we have heard and known,
and what our forefathers have told us, *

We will recount to generations to come
the praiseworthy deeds and the power of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and the wonderful works he has done.
which he commanded them to teach their children;
value.verse:
He gave his decrees to Jacob
and established a law for Israel, *

value.halfverse: that they in their turn might tell it to their children;
value.verse:
That the generations to come might know,
and the children yet unborn; *
So that they might put their trust in God, *
value.halfverse:
and not forget the deeds of God,
 but keep his commandments;

a generation whose heart was not steadfast,
 and whose spirit was not faithful to God.
value.verse:
And not be like their forefathers,
a stubborn and rebellious generation, *
The people of Ephraim, armed with the bow, *
value.halfverse: turned back in the day of battle;
and refused to walk in his law;
value.verse: They did not keep the covenant of God, *
They forgot what he had done, *
value.halfverse: and the wonders he had shown them.

value.verse: He worked marvels in the sight of their forefathers, *
value.halfverse: in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
he made the waters stand up like walls.
value.verse: He split open the sea and let them pass through; *

value.halfverse: and all the night through with a glow of fire.
value.verse: He led them with a cloud by day, *

value.halfverse: and gave them drink as from the great deep.
value.verse: He split the hard rocks in the wilderness *

value.halfverse: and the waters gushed out like rivers.
value.verse: He brought streams out of the cliff, *

value.halfverse: rebelling in the desert against the Most High.
value.verse: But they went on sinning against him, *
They tested God in their hearts, *
value.halfverse: demanding food for their craving.
“Can God set a table in the wilderness?
value.verse: They railed against God and said, *
True, he struck the rock, the waters gushed out, and the gullies overflowed; *
value.halfverse:
but is he able to give bread
 or to provide meat for his people?”

value.verse: When the LORD heard this, he was full of wrath; *
value.halfverse:
a fire was kindled against Jacob,
 and his anger mounted against Israel;

value.verse: For they had no faith in God, *
value.halfverse: nor did they put their trust in his saving power.

value.verse: So he commanded the clouds above *
value.halfverse: and opened the doors of heaven.
and gave them grain from heaven.
value.verse: He rained down manna upon them to eat *
So mortals ate the bread of angels; *
value.halfverse: he provided for them food enough.
and led out the south wind by his might.
value.verse: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens *

value.halfverse: and wingèd birds like the sand of the sea.
value.verse: He rained down flesh upon them like dust *

value.halfverse: and round about their dwellings.
value.verse: He let it fall in the midst of their camp *

value.halfverse: for he gave them what they craved.
value.verse: So they ate and were well filled, *
But they did not stop their craving, *
value.halfverse: though the food was still in their mouths.

value.verse: So God’s anger mounted against them; *
value.halfverse:
he slew their strongest men
 and laid low the youth of Israel.
and had no faith in his wonderful works.
value.verse: In spite of all this, they went on sinning *

value.halfverse: and their years in sudden terror.
value.verse: So he brought their days to an end like a breath *

value.halfverse: and repent, and diligently search for God.
value.verse: Whenever he slew them, they would seek him, *
They would remember that God was their rock, *
value.halfverse: and the Most High God their redeemer.
and lied to him with their tongues.
value.verse: But they flattered him with their mouths *

value.halfverse: and they were not faithful to his covenant.
value.verse: Their heart was not steadfast toward him, *

value.halfverse:
many times he held back his anger
 and did not permit his wrath to be roused.
value.verse:
But he was so merciful that he forgave their sins
and did not destroy them; *

value.halfverse: a breath that goes forth and does not return.
value.verse: For he remembered that they were but flesh, *

value.halfverse: to those who are pure in heart.
value.verse: Truly, God is good to Israel, *

value.halfverse: I had almost tripped and fallen;
value.verse: But as for me, my feet had nearly slipped; *
Because I envied the proud *
value.halfverse: and saw the prosperity of the wicked:
and their bodies are sleek and sound;
value.verse: For they suffer no pain, *

value.halfverse: they are not afflicted as others are;
value.verse: In the misfortunes of others they have no share; *

value.halfverse: and wrap their violence about them like a cloak.
value.verse: Therefore they wear their pride like a necklace *

value.halfverse: and their hearts overflow with wicked thoughts.
value.verse: Their iniquity comes from gross minds, *

value.halfverse: out of their haughtiness they plan oppression.
value.verse: They scoff and speak maliciously; *

value.halfverse: and their evil speech runs through the world.
value.verse: They set their mouths against the heavens, *
And so the people turn to them *
value.halfverse: and find in them no fault.
is there knowledge in the Most High?”
value.verse: They say, “How should God know? *

value.halfverse: always at ease, they increase their wealth.
value.verse: So then, these are the wicked; *

value.halfverse: and washed my hands in innocence.
value.verse: In vain have I kept my heart clean, *

value.halfverse: and punished every morning.
value.verse: I have been afflicted all day long, *
Had I gone on speaking this way, *
value.halfverse: I should have betrayed the generation of your children.
it was too hard for me;
value.verse: When I tried to understand these things, *

value.halfverse: and discerned the end of the wicked.
value.verse: Until I entered the sanctuary of God *
Surely, you set them in slippery places; *
value.halfverse: you cast them down in ruin.
come to an end, and perish from terror!
value.verse: Oh, how suddenly do they come to destruction, *

value.halfverse: when you arise you will make their image vanish.
value.verse: Like a dream when one awakens, O Lord, *
When my mind became embittered, *
value.halfverse: I was sorely wounded in my heart.
I was like a brute beast in your presence.
value.verse: I was stupid and had no understanding; *

value.halfverse: you hold me by my right hand.
value.verse: Yet I am always with you; *

value.halfverse: and afterwards receive me with glory.
value.verse: You will guide me by your counsel, *

value.halfverse: and having you I desire nothing upon earth.
value.verse: Whom have I in heaven but you? *

value.halfverse: God is the strength of my heart and my portion for ever.
value.verse: Though my flesh and my heart should waste away, *
Truly, those who forsake you will perish; *
value.halfverse: you destroy all who are unfaithful.

value.verse: But it is good for me to be near God; *
value.halfverse: I have made the Lord GOD my refuge.

value.verse: I will speak of all your works *
value.halfverse: in the gates of the city of Zion.

for the mouth of the wicked,
 the mouth of the deceitful, is opened against me.
value.verse: Hold not your tongue, O God of my praise; *

value.halfverse:
they encompass me with hateful words
 and fight against me without a cause.
value.verse: They speak to me with a lying tongue; *
Despite my love, they accuse me; *
value.halfverse: but as for me, I pray for them.
and hatred for my love.
value.verse: They repay evil for good, *
Set a wicked man against him, *
value.halfverse: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.
and let his appeal be in vain.
value.verse: When he is judged, let him be found guilty, *

value.halfverse: and let another take his office.
value.verse: Let his days be few, *
Let his children be fatherless, *
value.halfverse: and his wife become a widow.

value.verse: Let his children be waifs and beggars; *
value.halfverse: let them be driven from the ruins of their homes.

value.verse: Let the creditor seize everything he has; *
value.halfverse: let strangers plunder his gains.
and none to pity his fatherless children.
value.verse: Let there be no one to show him kindness, *

value.halfverse: and his name be blotted out in the next generation.
value.verse: Let his descendants be destroyed, *
Let the wickedness of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and his mother’s sin not be blotted out;

value.verse: Let their sin be always before the LORD; *
value.halfverse: but let him root out their names from the earth;

value.verse: Because he did not remember to show mercy, *
value.halfverse:
but persecuted the poor and needy
 and sought to kill the brokenhearted.

value.verse:
He loved cursing,
let it come upon him; *
value.halfverse:
he took no delight in blessing,
 let it depart from him.

let it soak into his body like water
 and into his bones like oil;
value.verse: He put on cursing like a garment, *
Let it be to him like the cloak which he wraps around himself, *
value.halfverse: and like the belt that he wears continually.
and to those who speak evil against me.
value.verse: Let this be the recompense from the LORD to my accusers, *

But you, O Lord my God,
oh, deal with me according to your Name; *
value.halfverse: for your tender mercy’s sake, deliver me.

value.verse: For I am poor and needy, *
value.halfverse: and my heart is wounded within me.

value.verse: I have faded away like a shadow when it lengthens; *
value.halfverse: I am shaken off like a locust.
and my flesh is wasted and gaunt.
value.verse: My knees are weak through fasting, *

value.halfverse: they see and shake their heads.
value.verse: I have become a reproach to them; *

value.halfverse: save me for your mercy’s sake.
value.verse: Help me, O LORD my God; *

value.halfverse: that you, O LORD, have done it.
value.verse: Let them know that this is your hand, *
They may curse, but you will bless; *
value.halfverse:
let those who rise up against me be put to shame,
 and your servant will rejoice.

value.verse: Let my accusers be clothed with disgrace *
value.halfverse: and wrap themselves in their shame as in a cloak.
in the midst of the multitude will I praise him;
value.verse: I will give great thanks to the LORD with my mouth; *

value.halfverse: to save his life from those who would condemn him.
value.verse: Because he stands at the right hand of the needy, *

value.halfverse: deliver me in your righteousness.
value.verse:
In you, O LORD, have I taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame; *

value.halfverse: make haste to deliver me.
value.verse: Incline your ear to me; *

value.halfverse: for the sake of your Name, lead me and guide me.
value.verse:
Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe,
for you are my crag and my stronghold; *
Take me out of the net that they have secretly set for me, *
value.halfverse: for you are my tower of strength.

value.verse: Into your hands I commend my spirit, *
value.halfverse:
for you have redeemed me,
 O LORD, O God of truth.

value.verse: I hate those who cling to worthless idols, *
value.halfverse: and I put my trust in the LORD.

for you have seen my affliction;
 you know my distress.
value.verse: I will rejoice and be glad because of your mercy; *
You have not shut me up in the power of the enemy; *
value.halfverse: you have set my feet in an open place.

my eye is consumed with sorrow,
 and also my throat and my belly.
value.verse: Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; *

value.halfverse:
my strength fails me because of affliction,
 and my bones are consumed.
value.verse:
For my life is wasted with grief,
and my years with sighing; *

I have become a reproach to all my enemies and even to my neighbors,
a dismay to those of my acquaintance; *
value.halfverse: when they see me in the street they avoid me.

value.verse: I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind; *
value.halfverse: I am as useless as a broken pot.

they put their heads together against me;
 they plot to take my life.
value.verse:
For I have heard the whispering of the crowd;
fear is all around; *

value.halfverse: I have said, “You are my God.
value.verse: But as for me, I have trusted in you, O LORD. *
My times are in your hand; *
value.halfverse:
rescue me from the hand of my enemies,
 and from those who persecute me.

value.verse: Make your face to shine upon your servant, *
value.halfverse: and in your loving-kindness save me.”

value.verse: LORD, let me not be ashamed for having called upon you; *
value.halfverse:
rather, let the wicked be put to shame;
 let them be silent in the grave.
haughtily, disdainfully, and with contempt.
value.verse: Let the lying lips be silenced which speak against the righteous, *

value.halfverse:
which you have done in the sight of all
 for those who put their trust in you.
value.verse:
How great is your goodness, O LORD!
which you have laid up for those who fear you; *
You hide them in the covert of your presence from those who slander them; *
value.halfverse: you keep them in your shelter from the strife of tongues.

value.verse: Blessed be the LORD! *
value.halfverse: for he has shown me the wonders of his love in a besieged city.

Nevertheless, you heard the sound of my entreaty
 when I cried out to you.
value.verse:
Yet I said in my alarm,
“I have been cut off from the sight of your eyes.” *
Love the LORD, all you who worship him; *
value.halfverse:
the LORD protects the faithful,
 but repays to the full those who act haughtily.

value.verse: Be strong and let your heart take courage, *
value.halfverse: all you who wait for the LORD.
from age to age my mouth will proclaim your faithfulness.
value.verse: Your love, O LORD, for ever will I sing; *
For I am persuaded that your love is established for ever; *
value.halfverse: you have set your faithfulness firmly in the heavens.
I have sworn an oath to David my servant:
value.verse: “I have made a covenant with my chosen one; *

value.halfverse: and preserve your throne for all generations.’”
value.verse: ‘I will establish your line for ever, *

value.halfverse: and to your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones;
value.verse: The heavens bear witness to your wonders, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: who is like the LORD among the gods?
value.verse: For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD? *

value.halfverse: great and terrible to all those round about him.
value.verse: God is much to be feared in the council of the holy ones, *

value.halfverse: O mighty LORD, your faithfulness is all around you.
value.verse: Who is like you, LORD God of hosts? *
You rule the raging of the sea *
value.halfverse: and still the surging of its waves.

value.verse: You have crushed Rahab of the deep with a deadly wound; *
value.halfverse: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

value.verse: Yours are the heavens; the earth also is yours; *
value.halfverse: you laid the foundations of the world and all that is in it.
Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your Name.
value.verse: You have made the north and the south; *

value.halfverse: strong is your hand and high is your right hand.
value.verse: You have a mighty arm; *

value.halfverse: love and truth go before your face.
value.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundations of your throne; *

value.halfverse: they walk, O LORD, in the light of your presence.
value.verse: Happy are the people who know the festal shout! *
They rejoice daily in your Name; *
value.halfverse: they are jubilant in your righteousness.

value.verse: For you are the glory of their strength, *
value.halfverse: and by your favor our might is exalted.
The Holy One of Israel is our King.
value.verse: Truly, the LORD is our ruler; *
You spoke once in vision and said to your faithful people: *
value.halfverse:
“I have set the crown upon a warrior
 and have exalted one chosen out of the people.
with my holy oil have I anointed him.
value.verse: I have found David my servant; *

value.halfverse: and my arm will make him strong.
value.verse: My hand will hold him fast *

value.halfverse: nor any wicked man bring him down.
value.verse: No enemy shall deceive him, *

value.halfverse: and strike down those who hate him.
value.verse: I will crush his foes before him *
My faithfulness and love shall be with him, *
value.halfverse: and he shall be victorious through my Name.

value.verse: I shall make his dominion extend *
value.halfverse: from the Great Sea to the River.

value.verse: He will say to me, ‘You are my Father, *
value.halfverse: my God, and the rock of my salvation.’

value.verse: I will make him my firstborn *
value.halfverse: and higher than the kings of the earth.
and my covenant will stand firm for him.
value.verse: I will keep my love for him for ever, *

value.halfverse: and his throne as the days of heaven.”
value.verse: I will establish his line for ever *

value.halfverse: from age to age my mouth will proclaim your faithfulness.
value.verse: Your love, O LORD, for ever will I sing; *
For I am persuaded that your love is established for ever; *
value.halfverse: you have set your faithfulness firmly in the heavens.
I have sworn an oath to David my servant:
value.verse: “I have made a covenant with my chosen one; *

value.halfverse: and preserve your throne for all generations.’”
value.verse: ‘I will establish your line for ever, *

value.halfverse: and to your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones;
value.verse: The heavens bear witness to your wonders, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: who is like the LORD among the gods?
value.verse: For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD? *

value.halfverse: great and terrible to all those round about him.
value.verse: God is much to be feared in the council of the holy ones, *

value.halfverse: O mighty LORD, your faithfulness is all around you.
value.verse: Who is like you, LORD God of hosts? *
You rule the raging of the sea *
value.halfverse: and still the surging of its waves.

value.verse: You have crushed Rahab of the deep with a deadly wound; *
value.halfverse: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

value.verse: Yours are the heavens; the earth also is yours; *
value.halfverse: you laid the foundations of the world and all that is in it.
Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your Name.
value.verse: You have made the north and the south; *

value.halfverse: strong is your hand and high is your right hand.
value.verse: You have a mighty arm; *

value.halfverse: love and truth go before your face.
value.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundations of your throne; *

value.halfverse: they walk, O LORD, in the light of your presence.
value.verse: Happy are the people who know the festal shout! *
They rejoice daily in your Name; *
value.halfverse: they are jubilant in your righteousness.

value.verse: For you are the glory of their strength, *
value.halfverse: and by your favor our might is exalted.
The Holy One of Israel is our King.
value.verse: Truly, the LORD is our ruler; *
Give the King your justice, O God, *
value.halfverse: and your righteousness to the King’s son;
and the poor with justice.
value.verse: That he may rule your people righteously *

value.halfverse: and the little hills bring righteousness.
value.verse: That the mountains may bring prosperity to the people, *

value.halfverse: he shall rescue the poor and crush the oppressor.
value.verse: He shall defend the needy among the people; *

value.halfverse: from one generation to another.
value.verse: He shall live as long as the sun and moon endure, *

value.halfverse: like showers that water the earth.
value.verse: He shall come down like rain upon the mown field, *
In his time shall the righteous flourish; *
value.halfverse: there shall be abundance of peace till the moon shall be no more.

value.verse: He shall rule from sea to sea, *
value.halfverse: and from the River to the ends of the earth.

value.verse: His foes shall bow down before him, *
value.halfverse: and his enemies lick the dust.

value.verse: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall pay tribute, *
value.halfverse: and the kings of Arabia and Saba offer gifts.
and all the nations do him service.
value.verse: All kings shall bow down before him, *
For he shall deliver the poor who cries out in distress, *
value.halfverse: and the oppressed who has no helper.

value.verse: He shall have pity on the lowly and poor; *
value.halfverse: he shall preserve the lives of the needy.

value.verse: He shall redeem their lives from oppression and violence, *
value.halfverse: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

may prayer be made for him always,
 and may they bless him all the day long.
value.verse:
Long may he live!
and may there be given to him gold from Arabia; *

May there be abundance of grain on the earth,
growing thick even on the hilltops; *
value.halfverse:
may its fruit flourish like Lebanon,
 and its grain like grass upon the earth.

value.verse:
May his Name remain for ever
and be established as long as the sun endures; *
value.halfverse: may all the nations bless themselves in him and call him blessed.

value.verse: Blessed be the Lord GOD, the God of Israel, *
value.halfverse: who alone does wondrous deeds!

value.verse: And blessed be his glorious Name for ever! *
value.halfverse: and may all the earth be filled with his glory. Amen. Amen.
attack those who are attacking me.
value.verse: Fight those who fight me, O LORD; *
Take up shield and armor *
value.halfverse: and rise up to help me.

value.verse: Draw the sword and bar the way against those who pursue me; *
value.halfverse: say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”

value.verse: Let those who seek after my life be shamed and humbled; *
value.halfverse: let those who plot my ruin fall back and be dismayed.
and let the angel of the LORD drive them away.
value.verse: Let them be like chaff before the wind, *

value.halfverse: and let the angel of the LORD pursue them.
value.verse: Let their way be dark and slippery, *

value.halfverse: without a cause they have dug a pit to take me alive.
value.verse: For they have secretly spread a net for me without a cause; *
Let ruin come upon them unawares; *
value.halfverse:
let them be caught in the net they hid;
 let them fall into the pit they dug.

value.verse: Then I will be joyful in the LORD; *
value.halfverse: I will glory in his victory.

You deliver the poor from those who are too strong for them,
 the poor and needy from those who rob them.”
value.verse: My very bones will say, “LORD, who is like you? *
Malicious witnesses rise up against me; *
value.halfverse: they charge me with matters I know nothing about.

value.verse: They pay me evil in exchange for good; *
value.halfverse: my soul is full of despair.
and humbled myself by fasting.
value.verse: But when they were sick I dressed in sack-cloth *

value.halfverse:
I behaved like one who mourns for his mother,
 bowed down and grieving.
value.verse:
I prayed with my whole heart,
as one would for a friend or a brother; *

value.halfverse: strangers whom I did not know tore me to pieces and would not stop.
value.verse:
But when I stumbled, they were glad and gathered together;
they gathered against me; *

value.halfverse: they gnashed at me with their teeth.
value.verse: They put me to the test and mocked me; *

value.halfverse:
rescue me from the roaring beasts,
 and my life from the young lions.
value.verse: O Lord, how long will you look on? *

value.halfverse: I will praise you in the mighty throng.
value.verse: I will give you thanks in the great congregation; *

value.halfverse: nor let those who hate me without a cause wink at each other.
value.verse: Do not let my treacherous foes rejoice over me, *
For they do not plan for peace, *
value.halfverse: but invent deceitful schemes against the quiet in the land.
“Aha! we saw it with our own eyes.”
value.verse: They opened their mouths at me and said, *

value.halfverse: O Lord, be not far from me.
value.verse: You saw it, O LORD; do not be silent; *
Awake, arise, to my cause! *
value.halfverse: to my defense, my God and my Lord!

value.verse:
Give me justice, O LORD my God,
according to your righteousness; *
value.halfverse: do not let them triumph over me.
Do not let them say, “We have swallowed him up.”
value.verse:
Do not let them say in their hearts,
“Aha! just what we want!” *

value.halfverse: let those who boast against me be clothed with dismay and shame.
value.verse: Let all who rejoice at my ruin be ashamed and disgraced; *
Let those who favor my cause sing out with joy and be glad; *
value.halfverse:
let them say always, “Great is the LORD,
 who desires the prosperity of his servant.”
and of your praise all the day long.
value.verse: And my tongue shall be talking of your righteousness *

value.halfverse:
I have said to the LORD, “You are my Lord,
 my good above all other.”
value.verse: Protect me, O God, for I take refuge in you; *

value.halfverse: upon those who are noble among the people.
value.verse: All my delight is upon the godly that are in the land, *
But those who run after other gods *
value.halfverse: shall have their troubles multiplied.

value.verse: Their libations of blood I will not offer, *
value.halfverse: nor take the names of their gods upon my lips.
it is you who uphold my lot.
value.verse: O LORD, you are my portion and my cup; *

value.halfverse: indeed, I have a goodly heritage.
value.verse: My boundaries enclose a pleasant land; *

value.halfverse: my heart teaches me, night after night.
value.verse: I will bless the LORD who gives me counsel; *

value.halfverse: because he is at my right hand I shall not fall.
value.verse: I have set the LORD always before me; *
My heart, therefore, is glad, and my spirit rejoices; *
value.halfverse: my body also shall rest in hope.
nor let your holy one see the Pit.
value.verse: For you will not abandon me to the grave, *
You will show me the path of life; *
value.halfverse:
in your presence there is fullness of joy,
 and in your right hand are pleasures for evermore.
from where is my help to come?
value.verse: I lift up my eyes to the hills; *
My help comes from the LORD, *
value.halfverse: the maker of heaven and earth.
and he who watches over you will not fall asleep.
value.verse: He will not let your foot be moved *
Behold, he who keeps watch over Israel *
value.halfverse: shall neither slumber nor sleep;

value.verse: The LORD himself watches over you; *
value.halfverse: the LORD is your shade at your right hand,
nor the moon by night.
value.verse: So that the sun shall not strike you by day, *

value.halfverse: it is he who shall keep you safe.
value.verse: The LORD shall preserve you from all evil; *

value.halfverse: from this time forth for evermore.
value.verse: The LORD shall watch over your going out and your coming in, *

value.halfverse: do not keep still nor hold your peace, O God;
value.verse: O God, do not be silent; *

value.halfverse: and those who hate you have lifted up their heads.
value.verse: For your enemies are in tumult, *
They take secret counsel against your people *
value.halfverse: and plot against those whom you protect.

value.verse: They have said, “Come, let us wipe them out from among the nations; *
value.halfverse: let the name of Israel be remembered no more.”

value.verse: They have conspired together; *
value.halfverse: they have made an alliance against you:
the Moabites and the Hagarenes;
value.verse: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; *
Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; *
value.halfverse: the Philistines and those who dwell in Tyre.

value.verse: The Assyrians also have joined them, *
value.halfverse: and have come to help the people of Lot.
to Sisera, and to Jabin at the river of Kishon:
value.verse: Do to them as you did to Midian, *

value.halfverse: they became like dung upon the ground.
value.verse: They were destroyed at Endor; *
Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeëb, *
value.halfverse: and all their commanders like Zebah and Zalmunna,

value.verse: Who said, “Let us take for ourselves *
value.halfverse: the fields of God as our possession.”

value.verse: O my God, make them like whirling dust *
value.halfverse: and like chaff before the wind;
like the flame that sets mountains ablaze.
value.verse: Like fire that burns down a forest, *

value.halfverse: and terrify them with your storm;
value.verse: Drive them with your tempest *
Cover their faces with shame, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: that they may seek your Name.
let them be put to confusion and perish.
value.verse: Let them be disgraced and terrified for ever; *

value.halfverse: you alone are the Most High over all the earth.
value.verse: Let them know that you, whose Name is YAHWEH, *
The LORD, the God of gods, has spoken; *
value.halfverse: he has called the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
God reveals himself in glory.
value.verse: Out of Zion, perfect in its beauty, *
Our God will come and will not keep silence; *
value.halfverse:
before him there is a consuming flame,
 and round about him a raging storm.

value.verse: He calls the heavens and the earth from above *
value.halfverse: to witness the judgment of his people.

those who have made a covenant with me
 and sealed it with sacrifice.”
value.verse: “Gather before me my loyal followers, *

value.halfverse: for God himself is judge.
value.verse: Let the heavens declare the rightness of his cause; *

Hear, O my people, and I will speak:
“O Israel, I will bear witness against you; *
value.halfverse: for I am God, your God.

value.verse: I do not accuse you because of your sacrifices; *
value.halfverse: your offerings are always before me.
nor he-goats out of your pens;
value.verse: I will take no bull-calf from your stalls, *

value.halfverse: the herds in their thousands upon the hills.
value.verse: For all the beasts of the forest are mine, *

value.halfverse: and the creatures of the fields are in my sight.
value.verse: I know every bird in the sky, *

value.halfverse: for the whole world is mine and all that is in it.
value.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell you, *

value.halfverse: or drink the blood of goats?
value.verse: Do you think I eat the flesh of bulls, *
Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and make good your vows to the Most High.

value.verse: Call upon me in the day of trouble; *
value.halfverse: I will deliver you, and you shall honor me.”

“Why do you recite my statutes,
 and take my covenant upon your lips;
value.verse: But to the wicked God says: *

value.halfverse: and toss my words behind your back?
value.verse: Since you refuse discipline, *

value.halfverse: and you cast in your lot with adulterers.
value.verse: When you see a thief, you make him your friend, *

value.halfverse: and harnessed your tongue to a lie.
value.verse: You have loosed your lips for evil, *

value.halfverse: and slandering your own mother’s son.
value.verse: You are always speaking evil of your brother *
These things you have done, and I kept still, *
value.halfverse: and you thought that I am like you.”
I have put my case in order before your eyes.
value.verse: “I have made my accusation; *

value.halfverse: lest I rend you and there be none to deliver you.
value.verse: Consider this well, you who forget God, *

value.halfverse: but to those who keep in my way will I show the salvation of God.”
value.verse: Whoever offers me the sacrifice of thanksgiving honors me; *
Have mercy on me, O God, according to your loving-kindness; *
value.halfverse: in your great compassion blot out my offenses.
and cleanse me from my sin.
value.verse: Wash me through and through from my wickedness *

value.halfverse: and my sin is ever before me.
value.verse: For I know my transgressions, *
Against you only have I sinned *
value.halfverse: and done what is evil in your sight.
and upright in your judgment.
value.verse: And so you are justified when you speak *

value.halfverse: a sinner from my mother’s womb.
value.verse: Indeed, I have been wicked from my birth, *

value.halfverse: and will make me understand wisdom secretly.
value.verse: For behold, you look for truth deep within me, *

value.halfverse: wash me, and I shall be clean indeed.
value.verse: Purge me from my sin, and I shall be pure; *

value.halfverse: that the body you have broken may rejoice.
value.verse: Make me hear of joy and gladness, *

value.halfverse: and blot out all my iniquities.
value.verse: Hide your face from my sins *
Create in me a clean heart, O God, *
value.halfverse: and renew a right spirit within me.

value.verse: Cast me not away from your presence *
value.halfverse: and take not your holy Spirit from me.
and sustain me with your bountiful Spirit.
value.verse: Give me the joy of your saving help again *

value.halfverse: and sinners shall return to you.
value.verse: I shall teach your ways to the wicked, *
Deliver me from death, O God, *
value.halfverse:
and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness,
 O God of my salvation.

value.verse: Open my lips, O Lord, *
value.halfverse: and my mouth shall proclaim your praise.
but you take no delight in burnt-offerings.
value.verse: Had you desired it, I would have offered sacrifice, *

value.halfverse: a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
value.verse: The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit; *

value.halfverse: and rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
value.verse: [Be favorable and gracious to Zion, *

Then you will be pleased with the appointed sacrifices,
with burnt-offerings and oblations; *
value.halfverse: then shall they offer young bullocks upon your altar.]
because my hands were clean he rewarded me;
value.verse: The LORD rewarded me because of my righteous dealing; *

value.halfverse: and have not offended against my God;
value.verse: For I have kept the ways of the LORD *

value.halfverse: and his decrees I have not put away from me;
value.verse: For all his judgments are before my eyes, *

value.halfverse: and have kept myself from iniquity;
value.verse: For I have been blameless with him *

value.halfverse: because of the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
value.verse: Therefore the LORD rewarded me according to my righteous dealing, *

value.halfverse: with the forthright you show yourself forthright.
value.verse: With the faithful you show yourself faithful, O God; *
With the pure you show yourself pure, *
value.halfverse: but with the crooked you are wily.
but you will humble the haughty eyes.
value.verse: You will save a lowly people, *

value.halfverse: my God, you make my darkness bright.
value.verse: You, O LORD, are my lamp; *
With you I will break down an enclosure; *
value.halfverse: with the help of my God I will scale any wall.
he is a shield to all who trust in him.
value.verse:
As for God, his ways are perfect;
the words of the LORD are tried in the fire; *
For who is God, but the LORD? *
value.halfverse: who is the Rock, except our God?

value.verse: It is God who girds me about with strength *
value.halfverse: and makes my way secure.
and lets me stand firm on the heights.
value.verse: He makes me sure-footed like a deer *

value.halfverse: and my arms for bending even a bow of bronze.
value.verse: He trains my hands for battle *

value.halfverse:
your right hand also sustains me;
 your loving care makes me great.
value.verse: You have given me your shield of victory; *

value.halfverse: and my ankles do not give way.
value.verse: You lengthen my stride beneath me, *

value.halfverse: I will not turn back till I have destroyed them.
value.verse: I pursue my enemies and overtake them; *
I strike them down, and they cannot rise; *
value.halfverse: they fall defeated at my feet.

you have cast down my adversaries beneath me;
 you have put my enemies to flight.
value.verse: You have girded me with strength for the battle; *

I destroy those who hate me;
they cry out, but there is none to help them; *
value.halfverse: they cry to the LORD, but he does not answer.

value.verse: I beat them small like dust before the wind; *
value.halfverse: I trample them like mud in the streets.

value.verse: You deliver me from the strife of the peoples; *
value.halfverse: you put me at the head of the nations.
strangers will cringe before me.
value.verse:
A people I have not known shall serve me;
no sooner shall they hear than they shall obey me; *
The foreign peoples will lose heart; *
value.halfverse: they shall come trembling out of their strongholds.
Exalted is the God of my salvation!
value.verse: The LORD lives!  Blessed is my Rock! *

value.halfverse: and cast down the peoples beneath me.
value.verse: He is the God who gave me victory *

You rescued me from the fury of my enemies;
you exalted me above those who rose against me; *
value.halfverse: you saved me from my deadly foe.

value.verse: Therefore will I extol you among the nations, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: and sing praises to your Name.

he shows loving-kindness to his anointed,
 to David and his descendants for ever.
value.verse: He multiplies the victories of his king; *

Hear my plea of innocence, O LORD;
give heed to my cry; *
value.halfverse: listen to my prayer, which does not come from lying lips.
let your eyes be fixed on justice.
value.verse: Let my vindication come forth from your presence; *
Weigh my heart, summon me by night, *
value.halfverse: melt me down; you will find no impurity in me.

value.verse: I give no offense with my mouth as others do; *
value.halfverse: I have heeded the words of your lips.
in your paths my feet shall not stumble.
value.verse: My footsteps hold fast to the ways of your law; *

value.halfverse: incline your ear to me and hear my words.
value.verse: I call upon you, O God, for you will answer me; *

value.halfverse:
O Savior of those who take refuge at your right hand
 from those who rise up against them.
value.verse: Show me your marvelous loving-kindness, *

value.halfverse: hide me under the shadow of your wings,
value.verse: Keep me as the apple of your eye; *

value.halfverse: from my deadly enemies who surround me.
value.verse: From the wicked who assault me, *
They have closed their heart to pity, *
value.halfverse: and their mouth speaks proud things.

value.verse:
They press me hard,
now they surround me, *
value.halfverse: watching how they may cast me to the ground,

value.verse: Like a lion, greedy for its prey, *
value.halfverse: and like a young lion lurking in secret places.
deliver me from the wicked by your sword.
value.verse: Arise, O LORD; confront them and bring them down; *
Deliver me, O LORD, by your hand *
value.halfverse: from those whose portion in life is this world;

value.verse: Whose bellies you fill with your treasure, *
value.halfverse:
who are well supplied with children
 and leave their wealth to their little ones.
when I awake, I shall be satisfied, beholding your likeness.
value.verse: But at my vindication I shall see your face; *
The king rejoices in your strength, O LORD; *
value.halfverse: how greatly he exults in your victory!
you have not denied him the request of his lips.
value.verse: You have given him his heart’s desire; *

value.halfverse: and set a crown of fine gold upon his head.
value.verse: For you meet him with blessings of prosperity, *
He asked you for life, and you gave it to him: *
value.halfverse: length of days, for ever and ever.
splendor and majesty have you bestowed upon him.
value.verse: His honor is great, because of your victory; *

value.halfverse: and will make him glad with the joy of your presence.
value.verse: For you will give him everlasting felicity *

value.halfverse: because of the loving-kindness of the Most High, he will not fall.
value.verse: For the king puts his trust in the LORD; *
[Your hand will lay hold upon all your enemies; *
value.halfverse: your right hand will seize all those who hate you.

value.verse: You will make them like a fiery furnace *
value.halfverse: at the time of your appearing, O LORD;

value.verse: You will swallow them up in your wrath, *
value.halfverse: and fire shall consume them.
and their descendants from among the peoples of the earth.
value.verse: You will destroy their offspring from the land *

value.halfverse: yet they shall not prevail.
value.verse:
Though they intend evil against you
and devise wicked schemes, *

value.halfverse: and aim your arrows at them.
value.verse: For you will put them to flight *

value.halfverse: we will sing and praise your power.]
value.verse: Be exalted, O LORD, in your might; *

value.halfverse: until I make your enemies your footstool.”
value.verse: The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, *

value.halfverse: saying, “Rule over your enemies round about you.
value.verse: The LORD will send the scepter of your power out of Zion, *

value.halfverse:
in the beauty of holiness have I begotten you,
 like dew from the womb of the morning.”
value.verse: Princely state has been yours from the day of your birth; *

value.halfverse: “You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.”
value.verse: The LORD has sworn and he will not recant: *

value.halfverse: he will rule over the nations.
value.verse:
The Lord who is at your right hand
will smite kings in the day of his wrath; *

value.halfverse: he will smash heads over the wide earth.
value.verse: [He will heap high the corpses; *

value.halfverse: therefore he will lift high his head.]
value.verse: He will drink from the brook beside the road; *
Sing to the LORD a new song, *
value.halfverse: for he has done marvelous things.
has he won for himself the victory.
value.verse: With his right hand and his holy arm *
The LORD has made known his victory; *
value.halfverse: his righteousness has he openly shown in the sight of the nations.

value.verse: He remembers his mercy and faithfulness to the house of Israel, *
value.halfverse: and all the ends of the earth have seen the victory of our God.

value.verse: Shout with joy to the LORD, all you lands; *
value.halfverse: lift up your voice, rejoice, and sing.

value.verse: Sing to the LORD with the harp, *
value.halfverse: with the harp and the voice of song.

value.verse: With trumpets and the sound of the horn *
value.halfverse: shout with joy before the King, the LORD.

value.verse: Let the sea make a noise and all that is in it, *
value.halfverse: the lands and those who dwell therein.

and let the hills ring out with joy before the LORD,
 when he comes to judge the earth.
value.verse: Let the rivers clap their hands, *
In righteousness shall he judge the world *
value.halfverse: and the peoples with equity.

value.verse:
O gracious light,
pure brightness of the everliving Father in heaven,
