O Jesus Christ, holy and blessed!

Now as we come to the setting of the sun,
and our eyes behold the vesper light,
we sing your praises, O God: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

You are worthy at all times to be praised by happy voices,
O Son of God, O Giver of Life,
and to be glorified through all the worlds.
Splendor and honor and kingly power *
value.halfverse: are yours by right, O Lord our God,
and by your will they were created and have their being;
value.verse: For you created everything that is, *

value.halfverse: for with your blood you have redeemed for God,
value.verse: And yours by right, O Lamb that was slain, *

value.halfverse: a kingdom of priests to serve our God.
value.verse: From every family, language, people, and nation, *
And so, to him who sits upon the throne, *
value.halfverse: and to Christ the Lamb,

value.verse: Be worship and praise, dominion and splendor, *
value.halfverse: for ever and for evermore.

en-bcp1979-canticle-18.label: Canticle 18: A Song to the Lamb

value.halfverse: let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.
value.verse: Come, let us sing to the Lord; *
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and raise a loud shout to him with psalms.
and a great King above all gods.
value.verse: For the Lord is a great God, *
In his hand are the caverns of the earth, *
value.halfverse: and the heights of the hills are his also.
and his hands have molded the dry land.
value.verse: The sea is his, for he made it, *

value.halfverse: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.
value.verse: Come, let us bow down, and bend the knee, *

For he is our God,
and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. *
value.halfverse: Oh, that today you would hearken to his voice!
for the waters have risen up to my neck.
value.verse: Save me, O God, *
I am sinking in deep mire, *
value.halfverse: and there is no firm ground for my feet.

value.verse: I have come into deep waters, *
value.halfverse: and the torrent washes over me.

value.verse:
I have grown weary with my crying;
my throat is inflamed; *
value.halfverse: my eyes have failed from looking for my God.
Must I then give back what I never stole?
value.verse:
Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head;
my lying foes who would destroy me are mighty. *
O God, you know my foolishness, *
value.halfverse: and my faults are not hidden from you.

value.verse: Let not those who hope in you be put to shame through me, Lord GOD of hosts; *
value.halfverse: let not those who seek you be disgraced because of me, O God of Israel.

value.verse: Surely, for your sake have I suffered reproach, *
value.halfverse: and shame has covered my face.
an alien to my mother’s children.
value.verse: I have become a stranger to my own kindred, *
Zeal for your house has eaten me up; *
value.halfverse: the scorn of those who scorn you has fallen upon me.
but that was turned to my reproach.
value.verse: I humbled myself with fasting, *
I put on sack-cloth also, *
value.halfverse: and became a byword among them.

value.verse: Those who sit at the gate murmur against me, *
value.halfverse: and the drunkards make songs about me.

value.verse: But as for me, this is my prayer to you, *
value.halfverse: at the time you have set, O LORD:
answer me with your unfailing help.
value.verse: “In your great mercy, O God, *

value.halfverse:
let me be rescued from those who hate me
 and out of the deep waters.
value.verse: Save me from the mire; do not let me sink; *

value.halfverse: do not let the Pit shut its mouth upon me.
value.verse:
Let not the torrent of waters wash over me,
neither let the deep swallow me up; *

value.halfverse: in your great compassion, turn to me.”
value.verse: Answer me, O LORD, for your love is kind; *

value.halfverse: be swift and answer me, for I am in distress.
value.verse: “Hide not your face from your servant; *

value.halfverse: because of my enemies deliver me.
value.verse: Draw near to me and redeem me; *

value.halfverse: my adversaries are all in your sight.”
value.verse: You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor; *

value.halfverse:
I looked for sympathy, but there was none,
 for comforters, but I could find no one.
value.verse: Reproach has broken my heart, and it cannot be healed; *
They gave me gall to eat, *
value.halfverse: and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar to drink.

value.verse: Let the table before them be a trap *
value.halfverse: and their sacred feasts a snare.
and give them continual trembling in their loins.
value.verse: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, *
Pour out your indignation upon them, *
value.halfverse: and let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.
and let there be none to dwell in their tents.
value.verse: Let their camp be desolate, *
For they persecute him whom you have stricken *
value.halfverse: and add to the pain of those whom you have pierced.
and let them not receive your vindication.
value.verse: Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt, *
Let them be wiped out of the book of the living *
value.halfverse: and not be written among the righteous.

value.verse: As for me, I am afflicted and in pain; *
value.halfverse: your help, O God, will lift me up on high.
I will proclaim his greatness with thanksgiving.
value.verse: I will praise the Name of God in song; *

value.halfverse: more than bullocks with horns and hoofs.
value.verse: This will please the LORD more than an offering of oxen, *
The afflicted shall see and be glad; *
value.halfverse: you who seek God, your heart shall live.
and his prisoners he does not despise.
value.verse: For the LORD listens to the needy, *

value.halfverse: the seas and all that moves in them;
value.verse: Let the heavens and the earth praise him, *

value.halfverse: they shall live there and have it in possession.
value.verse: For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah; *

value.halfverse: and those who love his Name will dwell therein.
value.verse: The children of his servants will inherit it, *
Behold now, bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: you that stand by night in the house of the LORD.

value.verse: Lift up your hands in the holy place and bless the LORD; *
value.halfverse: the LORD who made heaven and earth bless you out of Zion.
you have restored the good fortune of Jacob.
value.verse: You have been gracious to your land, O LORD, *
You have forgiven the iniquity of your people *
value.halfverse: and blotted out all their sins.
and turned yourself from your wrathful indignation.
value.verse: You have withdrawn all your fury *

value.halfverse: let your anger depart from us.
value.verse: Restore us then, O God our Savior; *
Will you be displeased with us for ever? *
value.halfverse: will you prolong your anger from age to age?

value.verse: Will you not give us life again, *
value.halfverse: that your people may rejoice in you?

value.verse: Show us your mercy, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: and grant us your salvation.

for he is speaking peace to his faithful people
 and to those who turn their hearts to him.
value.verse: I will listen to what the LORD God is saying, *

value.halfverse: that his glory may dwell in our land.
value.verse: Truly, his salvation is very near to those who fear him, *

value.halfverse: righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
value.verse: Mercy and truth have met together; *

value.halfverse: and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
value.verse: Truth shall spring up from the earth, *

value.halfverse: and our land will yield its increase.
value.verse: The LORD will indeed grant prosperity, *
Righteousness shall go before him, *
value.halfverse: and peace shall be a pathway for his feet.

value.verse: Sing with joy to God our strength *
value.halfverse: and raise a loud shout to the God of Jacob.
the merry harp, and the lyre.
value.verse: Raise a song and sound the timbrel, *

value.halfverse: and at the full moon, the day of our feast.
value.verse: Blow the ram’s-horn at the new moon, *
For this is a statute for Israel, *
value.halfverse: a law of the God of Jacob.

value.verse: He laid it as a solemn charge upon Joseph, *
value.halfverse: when he came out of the land of Egypt.

“I eased his shoulder from the burden;
 his hands were set free from bearing the load.”
value.verse: I heard an unfamiliar voice saying, *

value.halfverse:
I answered you from the secret place of thunder
 and tested you at the waters of Meribah.
value.verse: You called on me in trouble, and I saved you; *

value.halfverse: O Israel, if you would but listen to me!
value.verse: Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you: *
There shall be no strange god among you; *
value.halfverse: you shall not worship a foreign god.

value.verse:
I am the LORD your God,
who brought you out of the land of Egypt and said, *
value.halfverse: “Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.”
and Israel would not obey me.
value.verse: And yet my people did not hear my voice, *

value.halfverse: to follow their own devices.
value.verse: So I gave them over to the stubbornness of their hearts, *
Oh, that my people would listen to me! *
value.halfverse: that Israel would walk in my ways!

value.verse: I should soon subdue their enemies *
value.halfverse: and turn my hand against their foes.
and their punishment would last for ever.
value.verse: Those who hate the LORD would cringe before him, *
But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat *
value.halfverse: and satisfy him with honey from the rock.
calling upon your Name and declaring all your wonderful deeds.
value.verse: We give you thanks, O God, we give you thanks, *
“I will appoint a time,” says God; *
value.halfverse: “I will judge with equity.

value.verse: Though the earth and all its inhabitants are quaking, *
value.halfverse: I will make its pillars fast.

value.verse: I will say to the boasters, ‘Boast no more,’ *
value.halfverse: and to the wicked, ‘Do not toss your horns;

value.verse: Do not toss your horns so high, *
value.halfverse: nor speak with a proud neck.’”
nor yet from the wilderness or the mountains.
value.verse: For judgment is neither from the east nor from the west, *

value.halfverse: he puts down one and lifts up another.
value.verse: It is God who judges; *

value.halfverse: and all the wicked of the earth shall drink and drain the dregs.
value.verse:
For in the LORD’s hand there is a cup,
full of spiced and foaming wine, which he pours out, *
But I will rejoice for ever; *
value.halfverse: I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

value.verse: He shall break off all the horns of the wicked; *
value.halfverse: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

value.verse:
Not to us, O LORD, not to us,
but to your Name give glory; *
value.halfverse: because of your love and because of your faithfulness.
“Where then is their God?”
value.verse: Why should the heathen say, *

value.halfverse: whatever he wills to do he does.
value.verse: Our God is in heaven; *
Their idols are silver and gold, *
value.halfverse: the work of human hands.

value.verse: They have mouths, but they cannot speak; *
value.halfverse: eyes have they, but they cannot see;

value.verse: They have ears but they cannot hear; *
value.halfverse: noses, but they cannot smell;
they make no sound with their throat.
value.verse:
They have hands, but they cannot feel;
feet, but they cannot walk; *
Those who make them are like them, *
value.halfverse: and so are all who put their trust in them.
he is their help and their shield.
value.verse: O Israel, trust in the LORD; *

value.halfverse: he is their help and their shield.
value.verse: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD; *

value.halfverse: he is their help and their shield.
value.verse: You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD; *

value.halfverse:
he will bless the house of Israel;
 he will bless the house of Aaron;
value.verse: The LORD has been mindful of us, and he will bless us; *
He will bless those who fear the LORD, *
value.halfverse: both small and great together.

value.verse: May the LORD increase you more and more, *
value.halfverse: you and your children after you.
the maker of heaven and earth.
value.verse: May you be blessed by the LORD, *

value.halfverse: but he entrusted the earth to its peoples.
value.verse: The heaven of heavens is the LORD’S, *

value.halfverse: nor all those who go down into silence;
value.verse: The dead do not praise the LORD, *
But we will bless the LORD, *
value.halfverse:
from this time forth for evermore.
 Hallelujah!

value.verse: Be joyful in the LORD, all you lands; *
value.halfverse:
serve the LORD with gladness
 and come before his presence with a song.

he himself has made us, and we are his;
 we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
value.verse: Know this: The LORD himself is God; *

value.halfverse: give thanks to him and call upon his Name.
value.verse:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving;
go into his courts with praise; *

For the LORD is good;
his mercy is everlasting; *
value.halfverse: and his faithfulness endures from age to age.

value.verse: “Greatly have they oppressed me since my youth,” *
value.halfverse: let Israel now say;

value.verse: “Greatly have they oppressed me since my youth, *
value.halfverse: but they have not prevailed against me.”

value.verse: The plowmen plowed upon my back *
value.halfverse: and made their furrows long.
has cut the cords of the wicked.
value.verse: The LORD, the Righteous One, *

value.halfverse: all those who are enemies of Zion.
value.verse: Let them be put to shame and thrown back, *

value.halfverse: which withers before it can be plucked;
value.verse: Let them be like grass upon the housetops, *
Which does not fill the hand of the reaper, *
value.halfverse: nor the bosom of him who binds the sheaves;
We wish you well in the Name of the LORD.”
value.verse:
So that those who go by say not so much as,
“The LORD prosper you. *
Why are the nations in an uproar? *
value.halfverse: Why do the peoples mutter empty threats?
against the LORD and against his Anointed?
value.verse:
Why do the kings of the earth rise up in revolt,
and the princes plot together, *

value.halfverse: “let us cast off their bonds from us.”
value.verse: “Let us break their yoke,” they say; *
He whose throne is in heaven is laughing; *
value.halfverse: the Lord has them in derision.
and his rage fills them with terror.
value.verse: Then he speaks to them in his wrath, *

value.halfverse: upon my holy hill of Zion.”
value.verse: “I myself have set my king *

value.halfverse:
he said to me, “You are my Son;
 this day have I begotten you.
value.verse: Let me announce the decree of the LORD: *

value.halfverse: and the ends of the earth for your possession.
value.verse: Ask of me, and I will give you the nations for your inheritance *

value.halfverse: and shatter them like a piece of pottery.”
value.verse: You shall crush them with an iron rod *
And now, you kings, be wise; *
value.halfverse: be warned, you rulers of the earth.
and with trembling bow before him;
value.verse: Submit to the LORD with fear, *

value.halfverse: for his wrath is quickly kindled.
value.verse: Lest he be angry and you perish; *

value.halfverse: who take refuge in him!
value.verse: Happy are they all *

value.halfverse: because he has inclined his ear to me whenever I called upon him.
value.verse: I love the LORD, because he has heard the voice of my supplication, *

value.halfverse: I came to grief and sorrow.
value.verse:
The cords of death entangled me;
the grip of the grave took hold of me; *

value.halfverse: “O LORD, I pray you, save my life.”
value.verse: Then I called upon the Name of the LORD: *
Gracious is the LORD and righteous; *
value.halfverse: our God is full of compassion.

their teeth are spears and arrows,
 their tongue a sharp sword.
value.verse: I lie in the midst of lions that devour the people; *

value.halfverse:
they have dug a pit before me,
 but have fallen into it themselves.
value.verse:
They have laid a net for my feet,
and I am bowed low; *
Exalt yourself above the heavens, O God, *
value.halfverse: and your glory over all the earth.

value.verse: My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed; *
value.halfverse: I will sing and make melody.

value.verse:
Wake up, my spirit;
awake, lute and harp; *
value.halfverse: I myself will waken the dawn.

value.verse: I will confess you among the peoples, O LORD; *
value.halfverse: I will sing praise to you among the nations.
and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
value.verse: For your loving-kindness is greater than the heavens, *

value.halfverse: and your glory over all the earth.
value.verse: Exalt yourself above the heavens, O God, *

value.halfverse: and whose sin is put away!
value.verse: Happy are they whose transgressions are forgiven, *

value.halfverse: and in whose spirit there is no guile!
value.verse: Happy are they to whom the LORD imputes no guilt, *
While I held my tongue, my bones withered away, *
value.halfverse: because of my groaning all day long.
my moisture was dried up as in the heat of summer.
value.verse: For your hand was heavy upon me day and night; *
Then I acknowledged my sin to you, *
value.halfverse: and did not conceal my guilt.
Then you forgave me the guilt of my sin.
value.verse: I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD.” *

value.halfverse: when the great waters overflow, they shall not reach them.
value.verse: Therefore all the faithful will make their prayers to you in time of trouble; *

value.halfverse: you surround me with shouts of deliverance.
value.verse:
You are my hiding-place;
you preserve me from trouble; *
“I will instruct you and teach you in the way that you should go; *
value.halfverse: I will guide you with my eye.

who must be fitted with bit and bridle,
 or else they will not stay near you.”
value.verse: Do not be like horse or mule, which have no understanding; *

value.halfverse: but mercy embraces those who trust in the LORD.
value.verse: Great are the tribulations of the wicked; *
Be glad, you righteous, and rejoice in the LORD; *
value.halfverse: shout for joy, all who are true of heart.
and their inheritance shall last for ever.
value.verse: The LORD cares for the lives of the godly, *
They shall not be ashamed in bad times, *
value.halfverse: and in days of famine they shall have enough.

and the enemies of the LORD, like the glory of the meadows, shall vanish;
 they shall vanish like smoke.
value.verse: As for the wicked, they shall perish, *

value.halfverse: but the righteous are generous in giving.
value.verse: The wicked borrow and do not repay, *
Those who are blessed by God shall possess the land, *
value.halfverse: but those who are cursed by him shall be destroyed.

value.verse: Our steps are directed by the LORD; *
value.halfverse: he strengthens those in whose way he delights.

value.verse: If they stumble, they shall not fall headlong, *
value.halfverse: for the LORD holds them by the hand.

value.verse: I have been young and now I am old, *
value.halfverse:
but never have I seen the righteous forsaken,
 or their children begging bread.

value.verse: The righteous are always generous in their lending, *
value.halfverse: and their children shall be a blessing.
and dwell in the land for ever.
value.verse: Turn from evil, and do good, *

value.halfverse: he does not forsake his faithful ones.
value.verse: For the LORD loves justice; *

value.halfverse: but the offspring of the wicked shall be destroyed.
value.verse: They shall be kept safe for ever, *
The righteous shall possess the land *
value.halfverse: and dwell in it for ever.
and their tongue speaks what is right.
value.verse: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, *
The law of their God is in their heart, *
value.halfverse: and their footsteps shall not falter.
and seek occasion to kill them.
value.verse: The wicked spy on the righteous *
The LORD will not abandon them to their hand, *
value.halfverse: nor let them be found guilty when brought to trial.

he will raise you up to possess the land,
 and when the wicked are cut off, you will see it.
value.verse: Wait upon the LORD and keep his way; *

value.halfverse: flourishing like a tree in full leaf.
value.verse: I have seen the wicked in their arrogance, *

value.halfverse: I searched for them, but they could not be found.
value.verse: I went by, and behold, they were not there; *

value.halfverse: for there is a future for the peaceable.
value.verse:
Mark those who are honest;
observe the upright; *

value.halfverse: the future of the wicked is cut off.
value.verse: Transgressors shall be destroyed, one and all; *

value.halfverse: he is their stronghold in time of trouble.
value.verse: But the deliverance of the righteous comes from the LORD; *
The LORD will help them and rescue them; *
value.halfverse:
he will rescue them from the wicked and deliver them,
 because they seek refuge in him.
let your ears consider well the voice of my supplication.
value.verse:
Out of the depths have I called to you, O LORD;
LORD, hear my voice; *

value.halfverse: O LORD, who could stand?
value.verse: If you, LORD, were to note what is done amiss, *

value.halfverse: therefore you shall be feared.
value.verse: For there is forgiveness with you; *

value.halfverse: in his word is my hope.
value.verse: I wait for the LORD; my soul waits for him; *

My soul waits for the LORD,
more than watchmen for the morning, *
value.halfverse: more than watchmen for the morning.
for with the LORD there is mercy;
value.verse: O Israel, wait for the LORD, *
With him there is plenteous redemption, *
value.halfverse: and he shall redeem Israel from all their sins.
hear my voice when I cry to you.
value.verse: O LORD, I call to you; come to me quickly; *

value.halfverse: the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
value.verse: Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense, *

Set a watch before my mouth, O LORD,
and guard the door of my lips; *
value.halfverse: let not my heart incline to any evil thing.
nor eat of their choice foods.
value.verse: Let me not be occupied in wickedness with evildoers, *

value.halfverse: for my prayer is continually against their wicked deeds.
value.verse:
Let the righteous smite me in friendly rebuke;
let not the oil of the unrighteous anoint my head; *

value.halfverse: that they may know my words are true.
value.verse: Let their rulers be overthrown in stony places, *
As when a plowman turns over the earth in furrows, *
value.halfverse: let their bones be scattered at the mouth of the grave.

in you I take refuge;
 do not strip me of my life.
value.verse: But my eyes are turned to you, Lord GOD; *

value.halfverse: and from the traps of the evildoers.
value.verse: Protect me from the snare which they have laid for me *
Let the wicked fall into their own nets, *
value.halfverse: while I myself escape.

value.verse: The LORD changed rivers into deserts, *
value.halfverse: and water-springs into thirsty ground,
because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.
value.verse: A fruitful land into salt flats, *
He changed deserts into pools of water *
value.halfverse: and dry land into water-springs.

value.verse: He settled the hungry there, *
value.halfverse: and they founded a city to dwell in.
and brought in a fruitful harvest.
value.verse: They sowed fields, and planted vineyards, *

value.halfverse: he did not let their herds decrease.
value.verse: He blessed them, so that they increased greatly; *
Yet when they were diminished and brought low, *
value.halfverse: through stress of adversity and sorrow,

value.verse: (He pours contempt on princes *
value.halfverse: and makes them wander in trackless wastes)

value.verse: He lifted up the poor out of misery *
value.halfverse: and multiplied their families like flocks of sheep.
but all wickedness will shut its mouth.
value.verse: The upright will see this and rejoice, *
Whoever is wise will ponder these things, *
value.halfverse: and consider well the mercies of the LORD.

value.verse: Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, leading Joseph like a flock; *
value.halfverse: shine forth, you that are enthroned upon the cherubim.
stir up your strength and come to help us.
value.verse: In the presence of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, *

value.halfverse: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.
value.verse: Restore us, O God of hosts; *
O LORD God of hosts, *
value.halfverse:
how long will you be angered
 despite the prayers of your people?

value.verse: You have fed them with the bread of tears; *
value.halfverse: you have given them bowls of tears to drink.
and our enemies laugh us to scorn.
value.verse: You have made us the derision of our neighbors, *
Restore us, O God of hosts; *
value.halfverse: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.

value.verse: You have brought a vine out of Egypt; *
value.halfverse: you cast out the nations and planted it.
it took root and filled the land.
value.verse: You prepared the ground for it; *
The mountains were covered by its shadow *
value.halfverse: and the towering cedar trees by its boughs.

value.verse: You stretched out its tendrils to the Sea *
value.halfverse: and its branches to the River.

value.verse: Why have you broken down its wall, *
value.halfverse: so that all who pass by pluck off its grapes?
and the beasts of the field have grazed upon it.
value.verse: The wild boar of the forest has ravaged it, *

value.halfverse: preserve what your right hand has planted.
value.verse:
Turn now, O God of hosts, look down from heaven;
behold and tend this vine; *

value.halfverse: at the rebuke of your countenance let them perish.
value.verse: They burn it with fire like rubbish; *

value.halfverse: and son of man you have made so strong for yourself.
value.verse: Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand, *

value.halfverse: give us life, that we may call upon your Name.
value.verse: And so will we never turn away from you; *

value.halfverse: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.
value.verse: Restore us, O LORD God of hosts; *

value.halfverse: let those who hate him flee before him.
value.verse: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered; *

value.halfverse: as the wax melts at the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
value.verse: Let them vanish like smoke when the wind drives it away; *
But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; *
value.halfverse: let them also be merry and joyful.
YAHWEH is his Name, rejoice before him!
value.verse:
Sing to God, sing praises to his Name;
exalt him who rides upon the heavens; *

value.halfverse: God in his holy habitation!
value.verse: Father of orphans, defender of widows, *
God gives the solitary a home and brings forth prisoners into freedom; *
value.halfverse: but the rebels shall live in dry places.

value.verse: O God, when you went forth before your people, *
value.halfverse: when you marched through the wilderness,

value.verse:
The earth shook, and the skies poured down rain,
at the presence of God, the God of Sinai, *
value.halfverse: at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
you refreshed the land when it was weary.
value.verse: You sent a gracious rain, O God, upon your inheritance; *

value.halfverse: in your goodness, O God, you have made provision for the poor.
value.verse: Your people found their home in it; *
The Lord gave the word; *
value.halfverse: great was the company of women who bore the tidings:
the women at home are dividing the spoils.”
value.verse: “Kings with their armies are fleeing away; *

value.halfverse:
you shall be like a dove whose wings are covered with silver,
 whose feathers are like green gold.
value.verse: Though you lingered among the sheepfolds, *

value.halfverse: it was like snow falling in Zalmon.
value.verse: When the Almighty scattered kings, *
O mighty mountain, O hill of Bashan! *
value.halfverse: O rugged mountain, O hill of Bashan!

value.verse:
Why do you look with envy, O rugged mountain,
at the hill which God chose for his resting place? *
value.halfverse: truly, the LORD will dwell there for ever.

value.verse:
The chariots of God are twenty thousand,
even thousands of thousands; *
value.halfverse: the Lord comes in holiness from Sinai.
that the LORD God might dwell among them.
value.verse:
You have gone up on high and led captivity captive;
you have received gifts even from your enemies, *
Blessed be the Lord day by day, *
value.halfverse: the God of our salvation, who bears our burdens.

value.verse: He is our God, the God of our salvation; *
value.halfverse: God is the LORD, by whom we escape death.

value.verse: LORD, you have searched me out and known me; *
value.halfverse:
you know my sitting down and my rising up;
 you discern my thoughts from afar.

value.verse: You trace my journeys and my resting-places *
value.halfverse: and are acquainted with all my ways.

value.verse: Indeed, there is not a word on my lips, *
value.halfverse: but you, O LORD, know it altogether.
and lay your hand upon me.
value.verse: You press upon me behind and before *

value.halfverse: it is so high that I cannot attain to it.
value.verse: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; *

value.halfverse: where can I flee from your presence?
value.verse: Where can I go then from your Spirit? *

value.halfverse: if I make the grave my bed, you are there also.
value.verse: If I climb up to heaven, you are there; *

value.halfverse: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
value.verse: If I take the wings of the morning *

value.halfverse: and your right hand hold me fast.
value.verse: Even there your hand will lead me *
If I say, “Surely the darkness will cover me, *
value.halfverse: and the light around me turn to night,”
darkness and light to you are both alike.
value.verse:
Darkness is not dark to you;
the night is as bright as the day; *
For you yourself created my inmost parts; *
value.halfverse: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

value.verse: I will thank you because I am marvelously made; *
value.halfverse: your works are wonderful, and I know it well.

while I was being made in secret
 and woven in the depths of the earth.
value.verse: My body was not hidden from you, *

Your eyes beheld my limbs, yet unfinished in the womb;
all of them were written in your book; *
value.halfverse:
they were fashioned day by day,
 when as yet there was none of them.

value.verse: How deep I find your thoughts, O God! *
value.halfverse: how great is the sum of them!
to count them all, my life span would need to be like yours.
value.verse: If I were to count them, they would be more in number than the sand; *
[Oh, that you would slay the wicked, O God! *
value.halfverse: You that thirst for blood, depart from me.

value.verse: They speak despitefully against you; *
value.halfverse: your enemies take your Name in vain.

value.verse: Do I not hate those, O LORD, who hate you? *
value.halfverse: and do I not loathe those who rise up against you?

value.verse: I hate them with a perfect hatred; *
value.halfverse: they have become my own enemies.
try me and know my restless thoughts.
value.verse: Search me out, O God, and know my heart; *
Look well whether there be any wickedness in me *
value.halfverse: and lead me in the way that is everlasting.]

value.verse:
O gracious Light, Lord Jesus Christ,
in you the Father's glory shone.
Immortal, holy, blest is he,
and blest are you, his holy Son.

Now sunset comes, but light shines forth,
the lamps are lit to pierce the night.
Praise Father, Son, and Spirit: God
who dwells in the eternal light.

Worthy are you of endless praise,
O Son of God, Life-giving Lord;
wherefore you are through all the earth
and in the highest heaven adored.

value.halfverse: for I am poor and in misery.
value.verse: Bow down your ear, O LORD, and answer me, *

value.halfverse: save your servant who puts his trust in you.
value.verse: Keep watch over my life, for I am faithful; *

value.halfverse: I call upon you all the day long.
value.verse: Be merciful to me, O LORD, for you are my God; *

value.halfverse: for to you, O LORD, I lift up my soul.
value.verse: Gladden the soul of your servant, *

value.halfverse: and great is your love toward all who call upon you.
value.verse: For you, O LORD, are good and forgiving, *
Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer, *
value.halfverse: and attend to the voice of my supplications.
for you will answer me.
value.verse: In the time of my trouble I will call upon you, *

value.halfverse: nor anything like your works.
value.verse: Among the gods there is none like you, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: and glorify your Name.
value.verse: All the nations you have made will come and worship you, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: and you alone are God.
value.verse:
For you are great;
you do wondrous things; *

value.halfverse: knit my heart to you that I may fear your Name.
value.verse:
Teach me your way, O LORD,
and I will walk in your truth; *

value.halfverse: and glorify your Name for evermore.
value.verse: I will thank you, O LORD my God, with all my heart, *
For great is your love toward me; *
value.halfverse: you have delivered me from the nethermost Pit.

value.verse:
The arrogant rise up against me, O God,
and a band of violent men seeks my life; *
value.halfverse: they have not set you before their eyes.

value.verse: But you, O LORD, are gracious and full of compassion, *
value.halfverse: slow to anger, and full of kindness and truth.

give your strength to your servant;
 and save the child of your handmaid.
value.verse: Turn to me and have mercy upon me; *

value.halfverse: because you, O LORD, have helped me and comforted me.
value.verse:
Show me a sign of your favor,
so that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed; *

value.halfverse: that I may live and keep your word.
value.verse: Deal bountifully with your servant, *
Open my eyes, that I may see *
value.halfverse: the wonders of your law.
do not hide your commandments from me.
value.verse: I am a stranger here on earth; *

value.halfverse: with longing for your judgments.
value.verse: My soul is consumed at all times *

value.halfverse: cursed are they who stray from your commandments!
value.verse: You have rebuked the insolent; *
Turn from me shame and rebuke, *
value.halfverse: for I have kept your decrees.

value.verse: Even though rulers sit and plot against me, *
value.halfverse: I will meditate on your statutes.

value.verse: For your decrees are my delight, *
value.halfverse: and they are my counselors.
before the gods I will sing your praise.
value.verse: I will give thanks to you, O LORD, with my whole heart; *

I will bow down toward your holy temple
and praise your Name, *
value.halfverse: because of your love and faithfulness;
and your word above all things.
value.verse: For you have glorified your Name *
When I called, you answered me; *
value.halfverse: you increased my strength within me.

value.verse: All the kings of the earth will praise you, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: when they have heard the words of your mouth.

value.verse: They will sing of the ways of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: that great is the glory of the LORD.

value.verse: Though the LORD be high, he cares for the lowly; *
value.halfverse: he perceives the haughty from afar.

value.verse: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, you keep me safe; *
value.halfverse:
you stretch forth your hand against the fury of my enemies;
 your right hand shall save me.

value.verse: The LORD will make good his purpose for me; *
value.halfverse:
O LORD, your love endures for ever;
 do not abandon the works of your hands.

value.verse: Save me, O God, by your Name; *
value.halfverse: in your might, defend my cause.

value.verse: Hear my prayer, O God; *
value.halfverse: give ear to the words of my mouth.
those who have no regard for God.
value.verse:
For the arrogant have risen up against me,
and the ruthless have sought my life, *

value.halfverse: it is the Lord who sustains my life.
value.verse: Behold, God is my helper; *

value.halfverse: in your faithfulness, destroy them.
value.verse: Render evil to those who spy on me; *
I will offer you a freewill sacrifice *
value.halfverse: and praise your Name, O LORD, for it is good.

value.verse: For you have rescued me from every trouble, *
value.halfverse: and my eye has seen the ruin of my foes.

value.verse:
Hallelujah!
How good it is to sing praises to our God! *
value.halfverse: how pleasant it is to honor him with praise!

value.verse: The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem; *
value.halfverse: he gathers the exiles of Israel.
and binds up their wounds.
value.verse: He heals the brokenhearted *

value.halfverse: and calls them all by their names.
value.verse: He counts the number of the stars *

value.halfverse: there is no limit to his wisdom.
value.verse: Great is our LORD and mighty in power; *

value.halfverse: but casts the wicked to the ground.
value.verse: The LORD lifts up the lowly, *

value.halfverse: make music to our God upon the harp.
value.verse: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; *

value.halfverse: and prepares rain for the earth;
value.verse: He covers the heavens with clouds *

value.halfverse: and green plants to serve mankind.
value.verse: He makes grass to grow upon the mountains *
He provides food for flocks and herds *
value.halfverse: and for the young ravens when they cry.

value.verse: He is not impressed by the might of a horse; *
value.halfverse: he has no pleasure in the strength of a man;

value.verse: But the LORD has pleasure in those who fear him, *
value.halfverse: in those who await his gracious favor.

value.verse: Worship the LORD, O Jerusalem; *
value.halfverse: praise your God, O Zion;

value.verse: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates; *
value.halfverse: he has blessed your children within you.
he satisfies you with the finest wheat.
value.verse: He has established peace on your borders; *
He sends out his command to the earth, *
value.halfverse: and his word runs very swiftly.

value.verse: He gives snow like wool; *
value.halfverse: he scatters hoarfrost like ashes.

value.verse: He scatters his hail like bread crumbs; *
value.halfverse: who can stand against his cold?
he blows with his wind, and the waters flow.
value.verse: He sends forth his word and melts them; *

value.halfverse: his statutes and his judgments to Israel.
value.verse: He declares his word to Jacob, *

value.halfverse:
to them he has not revealed his judgments.
 Hallelujah!
value.verse: He has not done so to any other nation; *
You tyrant, why do you boast of wickedness *
value.halfverse: against the godly all day long?

value.verse:
You plot ruin;
your tongue is like a sharpened razor, *
value.halfverse: O worker of deception.

value.verse: You love evil more than good *
value.halfverse: and lying more than speaking the truth.
O you deceitful tongue.
value.verse: You love all words that hurt, *
Oh, that God would demolish you utterly, *
value.halfverse:
topple you, and snatch you from your dwelling,
 and root you out of the land of the living!
and they shall laugh at him, saying,
value.verse: The righteous shall see and tremble, *
“This is the one who did not take God for a refuge, *
value.halfverse:
but trusted in great wealth
 and relied upon wickedness.”
I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
value.verse: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; *

value.halfverse: and declare the goodness of your Name in the presence of the godly.
value.verse: I will give you thanks for what you have done *

en-bcp1979-canticle-12.citation: Song of the Three Young Men, 35-65
en-bcp1979-canticle-12.label: Canticle 12: A Song of Creation

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, all you works of the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.verse: In the firmament of his power, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
O heavens and all waters above the heavens.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, you angels and all powers of the Lord, *
Sun and moon and stars of the sky, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, every shower of rain and fall of dew, *
value.halfverse: all winds and fire and heat.

value.verse: Winter and Summer, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
drops of dew and flakes of snow
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O chill and cold, *

value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: Frost and cold, ice and sleet, glorify the Lord, *
Glorify the Lord, O nights and days, *
value.halfverse: O shining light and enfolding dark.

value.verse: Storm clouds and thunderbolts, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: Let the earth glorify the Lord, *

Glorify the Lord, O mountains and hills,
and all that grows upon the earth, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
O whales and all that move in the waters.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O springs of water, seas, and streams, *

value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: All birds of the air, glorify the Lord, *
Glorify the Lord, O beasts of the wild, *
value.halfverse: and all you flocks and herds.

value.verse: O men and women everywhere, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.label: II		The Earth and its Creatures

value.verse: Let the people of God glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O priests and servants of the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O spirits and souls of the righteous, *

value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: You that are holy and humble of heart, glorify the Lord, *
Let us glorify the Lord: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit; *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: In the firmament of his power, glorify the Lord, *

Alleluia.
Christ our Passover has been sacrificed for us; *
value.halfverse: therefore let us keep the feast,
but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth. Alleluia.
value.verse: Not with the old leaven, the leaven of malice and evil, *

value.halfverse: death no longer has dominion over him.
value.verse: Christ being raised from the dead will never die again; *
The death that he died, he died to sin, once for all; *
value.halfverse: but the life he lives, he lives to God.

value.verse: So also consider yourselves dead to sin, *
value.halfverse: and alive to God in Jesus Christ our Lord. Alleluia.
the first fruits of those who have fallen asleep.
value.verse: Christ has been raised from the dead, *
For since by a man came death, *
value.halfverse: by a man has come also the resurrection of the dead.

value.verse: For as in Adam all die, *
value.halfverse: so also in Christ shall all be made alive. Alleluia.

All are corrupt and commit abominable acts;
 there is none who does any good.
value.verse: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” *

value.halfverse:
to see if there is any who is wise,
 if there is one who seeks after God.
value.verse: God looks down from heaven upon us all, *

value.halfverse: there is none who does good; no, not one.
value.verse:
Every one has proved faithless;
all alike have turned bad; *

value.halfverse:
who eat up my people like bread
 and do not call upon God?
value.verse: Have they no knowledge, those evildoers *

value.halfverse:
for God has scattered the bones of the enemy;
 they are put to shame, because God has rejected them.
value.verse:
See how greatly they tremble,
such trembling as never was; *

value.halfverse:
when God restores the fortunes of his people
 Jacob will rejoice and Israel be glad.
value.verse: Oh, that Israel’s deliverance would come out of Zion! *

value.halfverse: do you judge the peoples with equity?
value.verse: Do you indeed decree righteousness, you rulers? *

value.halfverse: and your hands deal out violence in the land.
value.verse: No; you devise evil in your hearts, *
The wicked are perverse from the womb; *
value.halfverse: liars go astray from their birth.
they are like the deaf adder which stops its ears,
value.verse: They are as venomous as a serpent, *

value.halfverse: no matter how skillful his charming.
value.verse: Which does not heed the voice of the charmer, *

value.halfverse: pull the fangs of the young lions, O LORD.
value.verse: O God, break their teeth in their mouths; *

value.halfverse: let them wither like trodden grass.
value.verse: Let them vanish like water that runs off; *

value.halfverse: like a stillborn child that never sees the sun.
value.verse: Let them be like the snail that melts away, *

value.halfverse: like thorns and thistles let them be swept away.
value.verse: Before they bear fruit, let them be cut down like a brier; *
The righteous will be glad when they see the vengeance; *
value.halfverse: they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.

value.verse:
And they will say,
“Surely, there is a reward for the righteous; *
value.halfverse: surely, there is a God who rules in the earth.”
praise the Name of the LORD.
value.verse: Give praise, you servants of the LORD; *

value.halfverse: from this time forth for evermore.
value.verse: Let the Name of the LORD be blessed, *

value.halfverse: let the Name of the LORD be praised.
value.verse: From the rising of the sun to its going down *

value.halfverse: and his glory above the heavens.
value.verse: The LORD is high above all nations, *

value.halfverse: by day and night I cry to you.
value.verse: O LORD, my God, my Savior, *
Let my prayer enter into your presence; *
value.halfverse: incline your ear to my lamentation.
my life is at the brink of the grave.
value.verse: For I am full of trouble; *
I am counted among those who go down to the Pit; *
value.halfverse: I have become like one who has no strength;

value.verse: Lost among the dead, *
value.halfverse: like the slain who lie in the grave,
for they are cut off from your hand.
value.verse: Whom you remember no more, *
You have laid me in the depths of the Pit, *
value.halfverse: in dark places, and in the abyss.

value.verse: Your anger weighs upon me heavily, *
value.halfverse: and all your great waves overwhelm me.

value.verse:
You have put my friends far from me;
you have made me to be abhorred by them; *
value.halfverse: I am in prison and cannot get free.

LORD, I have called upon you daily;
 I have stretched out my hands to you.
value.verse: My sight has failed me because of trouble; *

value.halfverse: will those who have died stand up and give you thanks?
value.verse: Do you work wonders for the dead? *
Will your loving-kindness be declared in the grave? *
value.halfverse: your faithfulness in the land of destruction?
or your righteousness in the country where all is forgotten?
value.verse: Will your wonders be known in the dark? *

value.halfverse: in the morning my prayer comes before you.
value.verse: But as for me, O LORD, I cry to you for help; *
LORD, why have you rejected me? *
value.halfverse: why have you hidden your face from me?
I have borne your terrors with a troubled mind.
value.verse: Ever since my youth, I have been wretched and at the point of death; *
Your blazing anger has swept over me; *
value.halfverse: your terrors have destroyed me;
they encompass me on every side.
value.verse: They surround me all day long like a flood; *

value.halfverse: and darkness is my only companion.
value.verse: My friend and my neighbor you have put away from me, *
O Lord and Ruler of the hosts of heaven, *
value.halfverse:
God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob,
and of all their righteous offspring:
with all their vast array.
value.verse: You made the heavens and the earth, *

value.halfverse: they tremble because of your power.
value.verse: All things quake with fear at your presence; *

value.halfverse: it surpasses all that our minds can fathom.
value.verse: But your merciful promise is beyond all measure; *
O Lord, you are full of compassion, *
value.halfverse: long-suffering, and abounding in mercy.
you do not punish as we deserve.
value.verse: You hold back your hand; *

value.halfverse: that they may repent of their sin and be saved.
value.verse:
In your great goodness, Lord,
you have promised forgiveness to sinners, *
And now, O Lord, I bend the knee of my heart, *
value.halfverse: and make my appeal, sure of your gracious goodness.

value.verse: I have sinned, O Lord, I have sinned, *
value.halfverse: and I know my wickedness only too well.

value.verse: Therefore I make this prayer to you: *
value.halfverse: Forgive me, Lord, forgive me.

value.verse: Do not let me perish in my sin, *
value.halfverse: nor condemn me to the depths of the earth.
and in me you will show forth your goodness.
value.verse: For you, O Lord, are the God of those who repent, *

value.halfverse: and I will praise you without ceasing all the days of my life.
value.verse:
Unworthy as I am, you will save me,
in accordance with your great mercy, *

value.halfverse: and yours is the glory to ages of ages. Amen.
value.verse: For all the powers of heaven sing your praises, *

value.halfverse: I have trusted in the Lord and have not faltered.
value.verse:
Give judgment for me, O LORD,
for I have lived with integrity; *

value.halfverse: examine my heart and my mind.
value.verse: Test me, O LORD, and try me; *
For your love is before my eyes; *
value.halfverse: I have walked faithfully with you.

value.verse: I have not sat with the worthless, *
value.halfverse: nor do I consort with the deceitful.

value.verse: I have hated the company of evildoers; *
value.halfverse: I will not sit down with the wicked.

value.verse: I will wash my hands in innocence, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: that I may go in procession round your altar,

value.verse: Singing aloud a song of thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and recounting all your wonderful deeds.
and the place where your glory abides.
value.verse: LORD, I love the house in which you dwell *

value.halfverse: nor my life with those who thirst for blood,
value.verse: Do not sweep me away with sinners, *
Whose hands are full of evil plots, *
value.halfverse: and their right hand full of bribes.

value.verse: As for me, I will live with integrity; *
value.halfverse: redeem me, O LORD, and have pity on me.
in the full assembly I will bless the LORD.
value.verse: My foot stands on level ground; *

value.halfverse:
you have been angry;
 oh, take us back to you again.
value.verse: O God, you have cast us off and broken us; *
You have shaken the earth and split it open; *
value.halfverse: repair the cracks in it, for it totters.
you have given us wine that makes us stagger.
value.verse: You have made your people know hardship; *

value.halfverse: to be a refuge from the power of the bow.
value.verse: You have set up a banner for those who fear you, *
Save us by your right hand and answer us, *
value.halfverse: that those who are dear to you may be delivered.

“I will exult and parcel out Shechem;
  I will divide the valley of Succoth.
value.verse: God spoke from his holy place and said: *

value.halfverse: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my scepter.
value.verse: Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine; *

value.halfverse: and over Philistia will I shout in triumph.”
value.verse:
Moab is my wash-basin,
on Edom I throw down my sandal to claim it, *

value.halfverse: who will bring me to Edom?
value.verse: Who will lead me into the strong city? *

value.halfverse: you no longer go out, O God, with our armies.
value.verse: Have you not cast us off, O God? *
Grant us your help against the enemy, *
value.halfverse: for vain is the help of man.

value.verse: With God we will do valiant deeds, *
value.halfverse: and he shall tread our enemies under foot.

value.verse: Your decrees are wonderful; *
value.halfverse: therefore I obey them with all my heart.
it gives understanding to the simple.
value.verse: When your word goes forth it gives light; *
I open my mouth and pant; *
value.halfverse: I long for your commandments.

value.verse: Turn to me in mercy, *
value.halfverse: as you always do to those who love your Name.
let no iniquity have dominion over me.
value.verse: Steady my footsteps in your word; *
Rescue me from those who oppress me, *
value.halfverse: and I will keep your commandments.
and teach me your statutes.
value.verse: Let your countenance shine upon your servant *

value.halfverse: because people do not keep your law.
value.verse: My eyes shed streams of tears, *
The LORD is my shepherd; *
value.halfverse: I shall not be in want.

value.verse: He makes me lie down in green pastures *
value.halfverse: and leads me beside still waters.

value.verse: He revives my soul *
value.halfverse: and guides me along right pathways for his Name’s sake.

for you are with me;
 your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
value.verse:
Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
I shall fear no evil; *
You spread a table before me in the presence of those who trouble me; *
value.halfverse:
you have anointed my head with oil,
 and my cup is running over.

value.verse: Surely your goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, *
value.halfverse: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.

value.verse: Rulers have persecuted me without a cause, *
value.halfverse: but my heart stands in awe of your word.
as one who finds great spoils.
value.verse: I am as glad because of your promise *
As for lies, I hate and abhor them, *
value.halfverse: but your law is my love.
because of your righteous judgments.
value.verse: Seven times a day do I praise you, *
Great peace have they who love your law; *
value.halfverse: for them there is no stumbling block.

value.verse: I have hoped for your salvation, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: and have fulfilled your commandments.
and I have loved them deeply.
value.verse: I have kept your decrees *
I have kept your commandments and decrees, *
value.halfverse: for all my ways are before you.
and to sing praises to your Name, O Most High;
value.verse: It is a good thing to give thanks to the LORD, *
To tell of your loving-kindness early in the morning *
value.halfverse: and of your faithfulness in the night season;
and to the melody of the harp.
value.verse: On the psaltery, and on the lyre, *

value.halfverse: and I shout for joy because of the works of your hands.
value.verse: For you have made me glad by your acts, O LORD; *

value.halfverse: your thoughts are very deep.
value.verse: LORD, how great are your works! *

The dullard does not know,
nor does the fool understand, *
value.halfverse:
that though the wicked grow like weeds,
 and all the workers of iniquity flourish,
but you, O LORD, are exalted for evermore.
value.verse: They flourish only to be destroyed for ever; *

value.halfverse: and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
value.verse:
For lo, your enemies, O LORD,
lo, your enemies shall perish, *

value.halfverse: I am anointed with fresh oil.
value.verse: But my horn you have exalted like the horns of wild bulls; *

value.halfverse: and my ears rejoice to hear the doom of the wicked who rise up against me.
value.verse: My eyes also gloat over my enemies, *

value.halfverse: and shall spread abroad like a cedar of Lebanon.
value.verse: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree, *

value.halfverse: shall flourish in the courts of our God;
value.verse: Those who are planted in the house of the LORD *
They shall still bear fruit in old age; *
value.halfverse: they shall be green and succulent;

value.verse: That they may show how upright the LORD is, *
value.halfverse: my Rock, in whom there is no fault.
the faithful have vanished from among us.
value.verse: Help me, LORD, for there is no godly one left; *
Everyone speaks falsely with his neighbor; *
value.halfverse: with a smooth tongue they speak from a double heart.
and close the lips that utter proud boasts!
value.verse: Oh, that the LORD would cut off all smooth tongues, *

value.halfverse: our lips are our own; who is lord over us?”
value.verse: Those who say, “With our tongue will we prevail; *

“Because the needy are oppressed,
and the poor cry out in misery, *
value.halfverse:
I will rise up,” says the LORD,
 “and give them the help they long for.”

like silver refined from ore
 and purified seven times in the fire.
value.verse: The words of the LORD are pure words, *
O LORD, watch over us *
value.halfverse: and save us from this generation for ever.

value.verse: The wicked prowl on every side, *
value.halfverse: and that which is worthless is highly prized by everyone.
save and deliver me from all who pursue me;
value.verse: O LORD my God, I take refuge in you; *

value.halfverse: and snatch me away with none to deliver me.
value.verse: Lest like a lion they tear me in pieces *

value.halfverse: if there is any wickedness in my hands,
value.verse: O LORD my God, if I have done these things: *
If I have repaid my friend with evil, *
value.halfverse: or plundered him who without cause is my enemy;

value.verse: Then let my enemy pursue and overtake me, *
value.halfverse:
trample my life into the ground,
 and lay my honor in the dust.
rise up against the fury of my enemies.
value.verse: Stand up, O LORD, in your wrath; *
Awake, O my God, decree justice; *
value.halfverse: let the assembly of the peoples gather round you.
O LORD, judge the nations.
value.verse: Be seated on your lofty throne, O Most High; *
Give judgment for me according to my righteousness, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: and according to my innocence, O Most High.
for you test the mind and heart, O righteous God.
value.verse:
Let the malice of the wicked come to an end,
but establish the righteous; *

value.halfverse: he is the savior of the true in heart.
value.verse: God is my shield and defense; *

value.halfverse: God sits in judgment every day.
value.verse: God is a righteous judge; *

value.halfverse: he will bend his bow and make it ready.
value.verse: If they will not repent, God will whet his sword; *

value.halfverse: he makes his arrows shafts of fire.
value.verse: He has prepared his weapons of death; *
Look at those who are in labor with wickedness, *
value.halfverse: who conceive evil, and give birth to a lie.
and fall into the hole that they have made.
value.verse: They dig a pit and make it deep *

value.halfverse: their violence falls on their own scalp.
value.verse: Their malice turns back upon their own head; *
I will bear witness that the LORD is righteous; *
value.halfverse: I will praise the Name of the LORD Most High.

en-bcp1979-canticle-13.label: Canticle 13: A Song of Praise
en-bcp1979-canticle-13.citation: Song of the Three Young Men, 29-34

value.halfverse: you are worthy of praise; glory to you.
value.verse: Glory to you, Lord God of our fathers; *

value.halfverse: we will praise you and highly exalt you for ever.
value.verse: Glory to you for the radiance of your holy Name; *
Glory to you in the splendor of your temple; *
value.halfverse: on the throne of your majesty, glory to you.
we will praise you and highly exalt you for ever.
value.verse: Glory to you, seated between the Cherubim; *

value.halfverse: in the high vault of heaven, glory to you.
value.verse: Glory to you, beholding the depths; *
Glory to you, Father, Son, and Holy Spirit; *
value.halfverse: we will praise you and highly exalt you for ever.

value.verse: The king rejoices in your strength, O LORD; *
value.halfverse: how greatly he exults in your victory!
you have not denied him the request of his lips.
value.verse: You have given him his heart’s desire; *
For you meet him with blessings of prosperity, *
value.halfverse: and set a crown of fine gold upon his head.

value.verse: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him: *
value.halfverse: length of days, for ever and ever.

value.verse: His honor is great, because of your victory; *
value.halfverse: splendor and majesty have you bestowed upon him.
and will make him glad with the joy of your presence.
value.verse: For you will give him everlasting felicity *

value.halfverse: because of the loving-kindness of the Most High, he will not fall.
value.verse: For the king puts his trust in the LORD; *
Your hand will lay hold upon all your enemies; *
value.halfverse: your right hand will seize all those who hate you.

value.verse: You will make them like a fiery furnace *
value.halfverse: at the time of your appearing, O LORD;
and fire shall consume them.
value.verse: You will swallow them up in your wrath, *

value.halfverse: and their descendants from among the peoples of the earth.
value.verse: You will destroy their offspring from the land *

value.halfverse: yet they shall not prevail.
value.verse:
Though they intend evil against you
and devise wicked schemes, *

value.halfverse: and aim your arrows at them.
value.verse: For you will put them to flight *

value.halfverse: we will sing and praise your power.
value.verse: Be exalted, O LORD, in your might; *

value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, *

value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Give thanks to the God of gods, *
Give thanks to the Lord of lords, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: Who only does great wonders, *
Who by wisdom made the heavens, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;
for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: Who spread out the earth upon the waters, *

value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: Who created great lights, *
The sun to rule the day, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;

value.verse: The moon and the stars to govern the night, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: Who struck down the firstborn of Egypt, *
And brought out Israel from among them, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;
for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: With a mighty hand and a stretched-out arm, *
Who divided the Red Sea in two, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;

value.verse: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;
for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: But swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea, *

value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Who led his people through the wilderness, *

value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: Who struck down great kings, *
And slew mighty kings, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;
for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: Sihon, king of the Amorites, *
And Og, the king of Bashan, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;

value.verse: And gave away their lands for an inheritance, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;

value.verse: An inheritance for Israel his servant, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
for his mercy endures for ever;
value.verse: Who remembered us in our low estate, *
And delivered us from our enemies, *
value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever;
for his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Who gives food to all creatures, *

value.halfverse: for his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Give thanks to the God of heaven, *

value.halfverse: “Let us go to the house of the LORD.”
value.verse: I was glad when they said to me, *
Now our feet are standing *
value.halfverse: within your gates, O Jerusalem.
that is at unity with itself;
value.verse: Jerusalem is built as a city *

value.halfverse:
the assembly of Israel,
 to praise the Name of the LORD.
value.verse:
To which the tribes go up,
the tribes of the LORD, *

value.halfverse: the thrones of the house of David.
value.verse: For there are the thrones of judgment, *

value.halfverse: “May they prosper who love you.
value.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: *
Peace be within your walls *
value.halfverse: and quietness within your towers.
I pray for your prosperity.
value.verse: For my brethren and companions’ sake, *
Because of the house of the LORD our God, *
value.halfverse: I will seek to do you good.”

value.verse: Be joyful in the Lord, all you lands; *
value.halfverse:
serve the Lord with gladness
and come before his presence with a song.

value.verse: Know this: The Lord himself is God; *
value.halfverse:
he himself has made us, and we are his;
we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
give thanks to him and call upon his Name.
value.verse:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving;
go into his courts with praise; *

value.halfverse: and his faithfulness endures from age to age.
value.verse:
For the Lord is good;
his mercy is everlasting; *

value.halfverse: it is good for the just to sing praises.
value.verse: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous; *
Praise the LORD with the harp; *
value.halfverse: play to him upon the psaltery and lyre.
sound a fanfare with all your skill upon the trumpet.
value.verse: Sing for him a new song; *

value.halfverse: and all his works are sure.
value.verse: For the word of the LORD is right, *
He loves righteousness and justice; *
value.halfverse: the loving-kindness of the LORD fills the whole earth.

value.verse: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made, *
value.halfverse: by the breath of his mouth all the heavenly hosts.

value.verse: He gathers up the waters of the ocean as in a water-skin *
value.halfverse: and stores up the depths of the sea.
let all who dwell in the world stand in awe of him.
value.verse: Let all the earth fear the LORD; *
For he spoke, and it came to pass; *
value.halfverse: he commanded, and it stood fast.
he thwarts the designs of the peoples.
value.verse: The LORD brings the will of the nations to naught; *

value.halfverse: and the designs of his heart from age to age.
value.verse: But the LORD’S will stands fast for ever, *
Happy is the nation whose God is the LORD! *
value.halfverse: happy the people he has chosen to be his own!

value.verse: The LORD looks down from heaven, *
value.halfverse: and beholds all the people in the world.
on all who dwell on the earth.
value.verse: From where he sits enthroned he turns his gaze *
He fashions all the hearts of them *
value.halfverse: and understands all their works.
a strong man is not delivered by his great strength.
value.verse: There is no king that can be saved by a mighty army; *

value.halfverse: for all its strength it cannot save.
value.verse: The horse is a vain hope for deliverance; *

value.halfverse: on those who wait upon his love,
value.verse: Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon those who fear him, *

value.halfverse: and to feed them in time of famine.
value.verse: To pluck their lives from death, *
Our soul waits for the LORD; *
value.halfverse: he is our help and our shield.
for in his holy Name we put our trust.
value.verse: Indeed, our heart rejoices in him, *

value.halfverse: as we have put our trust in you.
value.verse: Let your loving-kindness, O LORD, be upon us, *
Deliver me, O LORD, from evildoers; *
value.halfverse: protect me from the violent,
and stir up strife all day long.
value.verse: Who devise evil in their hearts *

value.halfverse: adder’s poison is under their lips.
value.verse: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; *

value.halfverse:
protect me from the violent,
 who are determined to trip me up.
value.verse: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; *

value.halfverse: they have set traps for me along the path.
value.verse:
The proud have hidden a snare for me
and stretched out a net of cords; *

value.halfverse: listen, O LORD, to my supplication.
value.verse: I have said to the LORD, “You are my God; *

value.halfverse: you have covered my head in the day of battle.
value.verse: O Lord GOD, the strength of my salvation, *
Do not grant the desires of the wicked, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: nor let their evil plans prosper.

value.verse: Let not those who surround me lift up their heads; *
value.halfverse: let the evil of their lips overwhelm them.
let them be cast into the mire, never to rise up again.”
value.verse: Let hot burning coals fall upon them; *
A slanderer shall not be established on the earth, *
value.halfverse: and evil shall hunt down the lawless.

value.verse: I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the poor *
value.halfverse: and render justice to the needy.
and the upright shall continue in your sight.
value.verse: Surely, the righteous will give thanks to your Name, *
O LORD God of vengeance, *
value.halfverse: O God of vengeance, show yourself.

value.verse: Rise up, O Judge of the world; *
value.halfverse: give the arrogant their just deserts.

value.verse: How long shall the wicked, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: how long shall the wicked triumph?
all evildoers are full of boasting.
value.verse: They bluster in their insolence; *

value.halfverse: and afflict your chosen nation.
value.verse: They crush your people, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: and put the orphans to death.
value.verse: They murder the widow and the stranger *

value.halfverse: the God of Jacob takes no notice.”
value.verse: Yet they say, “The LORD does not see, *

value.halfverse: when will you fools understand?
value.verse: Consider well, you dullards among the people; *
He that planted the ear, does he not hear? *
value.halfverse: he that formed the eye, does he not see?

value.verse: He who admonishes the nations, will he not punish? *
value.halfverse: he who teaches all the world, has he no knowledge?

value.verse: The LORD knows our human thoughts; *
value.halfverse: how like a puff of wind they are.

value.verse: Happy are they whom you instruct, O Lord! *
value.halfverse: whom you teach out of your law;

value.verse: To give them rest in evil days, *
value.halfverse: until a pit is dug for the wicked.

value.verse: For the LORD will not abandon his people, *
value.halfverse: nor will he forsake his own.
and all the true of heart will follow it.
value.verse: For judgment will again be just, *
Who rose up for me against the wicked? *
value.halfverse: who took my part against the evildoers?
I should soon have dwelt in the land of silence.
value.verse: If the LORD had not come to my help, *

value.halfverse: your love, O LORD, upheld me.
value.verse: As often as I said, “My foot has slipped,” *
When many cares fill my mind, *
value.halfverse: your consolations cheer my soul.

value.verse: Can a corrupt tribunal have any part with you, *
value.halfverse: one which frames evil into law?
and condemn the innocent to death.
value.verse: They conspire against the life of the just *

value.halfverse: and my God the rock of my trust.
value.verse: But the LORD has become my stronghold, *

value.halfverse: the LORD our God will destroy them.
value.verse:
He will turn their wickedness back upon them
and destroy them in their own malice; *

O God, the heathen have come into your inheritance;
they have profaned your holy temple; *
value.halfverse: they have made Jerusalem a heap of rubble.
and the flesh of your faithful ones to the beasts of the field.
value.verse: They have given the bodies of your servants as food for the birds of the air, *

value.halfverse: and there was no one to bury them.
value.verse: They have shed their blood like water on every side of Jerusalem, *

value.halfverse: an object of scorn and derision to those around us.
value.verse: We have become a reproach to our neighbors, *
How long will you be angry, O LORD? *
value.halfverse: will your fury blaze like fire for ever?

value.verse: Pour out your wrath upon the heathen who have not known you *
value.halfverse: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your Name.

value.verse: For they have devoured Jacob *
value.halfverse: and made his dwelling a ruin.

value.verse:
Remember not our past sins;
let your compassion be swift to meet us; *
value.halfverse: for we have been brought very low.
deliver us and forgive us our sins, for your Name’s sake.
value.verse: Help us, O God our Savior, for the glory of your Name; *

value.halfverse:
Let it be known among the heathen and in our sight
 that you avenge the shedding of your servants’ blood.
value.verse: Why should the heathen say, “Where is their God?” *

value.halfverse: and by your great might spare those who are condemned to die.
value.verse: Let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you, *

value.halfverse: return seven-fold into their bosoms.
value.verse: May the revilings with which they reviled you, O Lord, *
For we are your people and the sheep of your pasture; *
value.halfverse:
we will give you thanks for ever
 and show forth your praise from age to age.
and listen to my prayer.
value.verse: Hear my cry, O God, *

value.halfverse: set me upon the rock that is higher than I.
value.verse:
I call upon you from the ends of the earth
with heaviness in my heart; *

value.halfverse: a strong tower against the enemy.
value.verse: For you have been my refuge, *
I will dwell in your house for ever; *
value.halfverse: I will take refuge under the cover of your wings.
you have granted me the heritage of those who fear your Name.
value.verse: For you, O God, have heard my vows; *
Add length of days to the king’s life; *
value.halfverse: let his years extend over many generations.
bid love and faithfulness watch over him.
value.verse: Let him sit enthroned before God for ever; *

value.halfverse: and day by day I will fulfill my vows.
value.verse: So will I always sing the praise of your Name, *

value.halfverse: he has come to his people and set them free.
value.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel; *
He has raised up for us a mighty savior, *
value.halfverse: born of the house of his servant David.
from the hands of all who hate us.
value.verse:
Through his holy prophets he promised of old,
that he would save us from our enemies, *
He promised to show mercy to our fathers *
value.halfverse: and to remember his holy covenant.

value.verse: This was the oath he swore to our father Abraham, *
value.halfverse: to set us free from the hands of our enemies,

holy and righteous in his sight
all the days of our life.
value.verse: Free to worship him without fear, *

value.halfverse: for you will go before the Lord to prepare his way,
value.verse: You, my child, shall be called the prophet of the Most High, *

value.halfverse: by the forgiveness of their sins.
value.verse: To give his people knowledge of salvation *

value.halfverse: the dawn from on high shall break upon us,
value.verse: In the tender compassion of our God *

value.halfverse: and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
value.verse: To shine on those who dwell in darkness and the shadow of death, *
O LORD, your word is everlasting; *
value.halfverse: it stands firm in the heavens.

value.verse: Your faithfulness remains from one generation to another; *
value.halfverse: you established the earth, and it abides.
for all things are your servants.
value.verse: By your decree these continue to this day, *

value.halfverse: I should have perished in my affliction.
value.verse: If my delight had not been in your law, *

value.halfverse: because by them you give me life.
value.verse: I will never forget your commandments, *

value.halfverse: for I study your commandments.
value.verse: I am yours; oh, that you would save me! *
Though the wicked lie in wait for me to destroy me, *
value.halfverse: I will apply my mind to your decrees.

value.verse: I see that all things come to an end, *
value.halfverse: but your commandment has no bounds.

value.verse: Your word is a lantern to my feet *
value.halfverse: and a light upon my path.
to keep your righteous judgments.
value.verse: I have sworn and am determined *

value.halfverse: preserve my life, O LORD, according to your word.
value.verse: I am deeply troubled; *
Accept, O LORD, the willing tribute of my lips, *
value.halfverse: and teach me your judgments.
yet I do not forget your law.
value.verse: My life is always in my hand, *

value.halfverse: but I have not strayed from your commandments.
value.verse: The wicked have set a trap for me, *

value.halfverse: truly, they are the joy of my heart.
value.verse: Your decrees are my inheritance for ever; *
I have applied my heart to fulfill your statutes *
value.halfverse: for ever and to the end.

value.verse: Have mercy on me, O God, according to your loving-kindness; *
value.halfverse: in your great compassion blot out my offenses.
and cleanse me from my sin.
value.verse: Wash me through and through from my wickedness *
For I know my transgressions, *
value.halfverse: and my sin is ever before me.
and done what is evil in your sight.
value.verse: Against you only have I sinned *
And so you are justified when you speak *
value.halfverse: and upright in your judgment.

value.verse: Indeed, I have been wicked from my birth, *
value.halfverse: a sinner from my mother’s womb.

value.verse: For behold, you look for truth deep within me, *
value.halfverse: and will make me understand wisdom secretly.
wash me, and I shall be clean indeed.
value.verse: Purge me from my sin, and I shall be pure; *

value.halfverse: that the body you have broken may rejoice.
value.verse: Make me hear of joy and gladness, *

value.halfverse: and blot out all my iniquities.
value.verse: Hide your face from my sins *

value.halfverse: and renew a right spirit within me.
value.verse: Create in me a clean heart, O God, *

value.halfverse: and take not your holy Spirit from me.
value.verse: Cast me not away from your presence *
Give me the joy of your saving help again *
value.halfverse: and sustain me with your bountiful Spirit.

value.verse: I shall teach your ways to the wicked, *
value.halfverse: and sinners shall return to you.

value.verse: Deliver me from death, O God, *
value.halfverse:
and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness,
 O God of my salvation.

value.verse: Open my lips, O Lord, *
value.halfverse: and my mouth shall proclaim your praise.
but you take no delight in burnt-offerings.
value.verse: Had you desired it, I would have offered sacrifice, *
The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit; *
value.halfverse: a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.

value.verse: Be favorable and gracious to Zion, *
value.halfverse: and rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
then shall they offer young bullocks upon your altar.
value.verse:
Then you will be pleased with the appointed sacrifices,
with burnt-offerings and oblations; *

value.halfverse: I have put my hope in your word.
value.verse: My soul has longed for your salvation; *
My eyes have failed from watching for your promise, *
value.halfverse: and I say, “When will you comfort me?”
but I have not forgotten your statutes.
value.verse: I have become like a leather flask in the smoke, *
How much longer must I wait? *
value.halfverse: when will you give judgment against those who persecute me?

value.verse: The proud have dug pits for me; *
value.halfverse: they do not keep your law.
help me, for they persecute me with lies.
value.verse: All your commandments are true; *
They had almost made an end of me on earth, *
value.halfverse: but I have not forsaken your commandments.

value.verse: In your loving-kindness, revive me, *
value.halfverse: that I may keep the decrees of your mouth.

value.verse: Lord, you now have set your servant free *
value.halfverse: to go in peace as you have promised;

value.verse: For these eyes of mine have seen the Savior, *
