value.halfverse: whom you have prepared for all the world to see:
and the glory of your people Israel.
value.verse: A Light to enlighten the nations, *

My heart is stirring with a noble song;
let me recite what I have fashioned for the king; *
value.halfverse: my tongue shall be the pen of a skilled writer.

grace flows from your lips,
 because God has blessed you for ever.
value.verse: You are the fairest of men; *
Strap your sword upon your thigh, O mighty warrior, *
value.halfverse: in your pride and in your majesty.

value.verse: Ride out and conquer in the cause of truth *
value.halfverse: and for the sake of justice.
your arrows are very sharp, O mighty warrior.
value.verse: Your right hand will show you marvelous things; *
The peoples are falling at your feet, *
value.halfverse: and the king’s enemies are losing heart.

a scepter of righteousness is the scepter of your kingdom;
 you love righteousness and hate iniquity.
value.verse: Your throne, O God, endures for ever and ever, *

value.halfverse: with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
value.verse: Therefore God, your God, has anointed you *
All your garments are fragrant with myrrh, aloes, and cassia, *
value.halfverse: and the music of strings from ivory palaces makes you glad.

value.verse: Kings’ daughters stand among the ladies of the court; *
value.halfverse:
on your right hand is the queen,
 adorned with the gold of Ophir.

value.verse: “Hear, O daughter; consider and listen closely; *
value.halfverse: forget your people and your father’s house.

value.verse: The king will have pleasure in your beauty; *
value.halfverse: he is your master; therefore do him honor.

value.verse: The people of Tyre are here with a gift; *
value.halfverse: the rich among the people seek your favor.”

value.verse: All glorious is the princess as she enters; *
value.halfverse: her gown is cloth-of-gold.

value.verse: In embroidered apparel she is brought to the king; *
value.halfverse: after her the bridesmaids follow in procession.
and enter into the palace of the king.
value.verse: With joy and gladness they are brought, *
“In place of fathers, O king, you shall have sons; *
value.halfverse: you shall make them princes over all the earth.
therefore nations will praise you for ever and ever.”
value.verse:
I will make your name to be remembered
from one generation to another; *

value.halfverse: I will sing and make melody.
value.verse: My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed; *

Wake up, my spirit;
awake, lute and harp; *
value.halfverse: I myself will waken the dawn.
I will sing praises to you among the nations.
value.verse: I will confess you among the peoples, O LORD; *

value.halfverse: and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
value.verse: For your loving-kindness is greater than the heavens, *

value.halfverse: and your glory over all the earth.
value.verse: Exalt yourself above the heavens, O God, *
So that those who are dear to you may be delivered, *
value.halfverse: save with your right hand and answer me.

value.verse: God spoke from his holy place and said, *
value.halfverse:
“I will exult and parcel out Shechem;
 I will divide the valley of Succoth.

value.verse: Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine; *
value.halfverse: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my scepter.
and over Philistia will I shout in triumph.”
value.verse:
Moab is my washbasin,
on Edom I throw down my sandal to claim it, *

value.halfverse: who will bring me into Edom?
value.verse: Who will lead me into the strong city? *
Have you not cast us off, O God? *
value.halfverse: you no longer go out, O God, with our armies.
for vain is the help of man.
value.verse: Grant us your help against the enemy, *
With God we will do valiant deeds, *
value.halfverse: and he shall tread our enemies under foot.
to you, O LORD, will I sing praises.
value.verse: I will sing of mercy and justice; *

value.halfverse: I will walk with sincerity of heart within my house.
value.verse:
I will strive to follow a blameless course;
oh, when will you come to me? *
I will set no worthless thing before my eyes; *
value.halfverse:
I hate the doers of evil deeds;
 they shall not remain with me.
I will not know evil.
value.verse: A crooked heart shall be far from me; *

value.halfverse: those who have a haughty look and a proud heart I cannot abide.
value.verse: Those who in secret slander their neighbors I will destroy; *

value.halfverse: and only those who lead a blameless life shall be my servants.
value.verse: My eyes are upon the faithful in the land, that they may dwell with me, *

value.halfverse: and those who tell lies shall not continue in my sight.
value.verse: Those who act deceitfully shall not dwell in my house, *
I will soon destroy all the wicked in the land, *
value.halfverse: that I may root out all evildoers from the city of the LORD.

value.verse: How often the people disobeyed him in the wilderness *
value.halfverse: and offended him in the desert!
and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
value.verse: Again and again they tempted God *
They did not remember his power *
value.halfverse: in the day when he ransomed them from the enemy;

value.verse: How he wrought his signs in Egypt *
value.halfverse: and his omens in the field of Zoan.
so that they could not drink of their streams.
value.verse: He turned their rivers into blood, *
He sent swarms of flies among them, which ate them up, *
value.halfverse: and frogs, which destroyed them.

value.verse: He gave their crops to the caterpillar, *
value.halfverse: the fruit of their toil to the locust.

value.verse: He killed their vines with hail *
value.halfverse: and their sycamores with frost.
and their livestock to hot thunderbolts.
value.verse: He delivered their cattle to hailstones *

value.halfverse:
fury, indignation, and distress,
 a troop of destroying angels.
value.verse: He poured out upon them his blazing anger: *

He gave full rein to his anger;
he did not spare their souls from death; *
value.halfverse: but delivered their lives to the plague.
the flower of manhood in the dwellings of Ham.
value.verse: He struck down all the firstborn of Egypt, *

value.halfverse: and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
value.verse: He led out his people like sheep *
He led them to safety, and they were not afraid; *
value.halfverse: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
the mountain his right hand had won.
value.verse: He brought them to his holy land, *

He drove out the Canaanites before them
and apportioned an inheritance to them by lot; *
value.halfverse: he made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

value.verse: But they tested the Most High God, and defied him, *
value.halfverse: and did not keep his commandments.

value.verse: They turned away and were disloyal like their fathers; *
value.halfverse: they were undependable like a warped bow.
they provoked his displeasure with their idols.
value.verse: The grieved him with their hill-altars *
When God heard this, he was angry *
value.halfverse: and utterly rejected Israel.

value.verse: He forsook the shrine at Shiloh, *
value.halfverse: the tabernacle where he had lived among his people.

value.verse: He delivered the ark into captivity, *
value.halfverse: his glory into the adversary’s hand.
and was angered against his inheritance.
value.verse: He gave his people to the sword *
The fire consumed their young men; *
value.halfverse: there were no wedding songs for their maidens.

value.verse: Their priests fell by the sword, *
value.halfverse: and their widows made no lamentation.

value.verse: Then the LORD woke as though from sleep, *
value.halfverse: like a warrior refreshed with wine.

value.verse: He struck his enemies on the backside *
value.halfverse: and put them to perpetual shame.
and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim;
value.verse: He rejected the tent of Joseph *

value.halfverse: and Mount Zion, which he loved.
value.verse: He chose instead the tribe of Judah *
He built his sanctuary like the heights of heaven, *
value.halfverse: like the earth which he founded for ever.

value.verse: He chose David his servant, *
value.halfverse: and took him away from the sheepfolds.

to be a shepherd over Jacob his people
 and over Israel his inheritance.
value.verse: He brought him from following the ewes, *

value.halfverse: and guided them with the skillfulness of his hands.
value.verse: So he shepherded them with a faithful and true heart *

value.halfverse: in the city of our God is his holy hill.
value.verse: Great is the LORD, and highly to be praised; *

value.halfverse: the very center of the world and the city of the great King.
value.verse: Beautiful and lofty, the joy of all the earth, is the hill of Zion, *

value.halfverse: he is known to be her sure refuge.
value.verse: God is in her citadels; *
Behold, the kings of the earth assembled *
value.halfverse: and marched forward together.

value.verse: They looked and were astounded; *
value.halfverse: they retreated and fled in terror.

value.verse: Trembling seized them there; *
value.halfverse:
they writhed like a woman in childbirth,
 like ships of the sea when the east wind shatters them.
God has established her for ever.
value.verse:
As we have heard, so have we seen,
in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God; *

value.halfverse: in the midst of your temple.
value.verse: We have waited in silence on your loving-kindness, O God, *

value.halfverse: your right hand is full of justice.
value.verse: Your praise, like your Name, O God, reaches to the world’s end; *

Let Mount Zion be glad
and the cities of Judah rejoice, *
value.halfverse: because of your judgments.
count the number of her towers.
value.verse:
Make the circuit of Zion;
walk round about her; *

value.halfverse: that you may tell those who come after.
value.verse:
Consider well her bulwarks;
examine her strongholds; *
This God is our God for ever and ever; *
value.halfverse: he shall be our guide for evermore.
the Name of the God of Jacob defend you;
value.verse: May the LORD answer you in the day of trouble, *

value.halfverse: and strengthen you out of Zion;
value.verse: Send you help from his holy place *

value.halfverse: and accept your burnt sacrifice;
value.verse: Remember all your offerings *

value.halfverse: and prosper all your plans.
value.verse: Grant you your heart’s desire *

We will shout for joy at your victory
and triumph in the Name of our God; *
value.halfverse: may the LORD grant all your requests.

value.verse: Now I know that the LORD gives victory to his anointed; *
value.halfverse:
he will answer him out of his holy heaven,
 with the victorious strength of his right hand.
but we will call upon the Name of the LORD our God.
value.verse: Some put their trust in chariots and some in horses, *
They collapse and fall down, *
value.halfverse: but we will arise and stand upright.
and answer us when we call.
value.verse: O LORD, give victory to the king *

value.halfverse:
my soul thirsts for you, my flesh faints for you,
 as in a barren and dry land where there is no water.
value.verse: O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you; *
Therefore I have gazed upon you in your holy place, *
value.halfverse: that I might behold your power and your glory.
my lips shall give you praise.
value.verse: For your loving-kindness is better than life itself; *
So will I bless you as long as I live *
value.halfverse: and lift up my hands in your Name.
and my mouth praises you with joyful lips,
value.verse: My soul is content, as with marrow and fatness, *

value.halfverse: and meditate on you in the night watches.
value.verse: When I remember you upon my bed, *

value.halfverse: and under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.
value.verse: For you have been my helper, *
My soul clings to you; *
value.halfverse: your right hand holds me fast.
go down into the depths of the earth;
value.verse: May those who seek my life to destroy it *
Let them fall upon the edge of the sword, *
value.halfverse: and let them be food for jackals.
for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.
value.verse:
But the king will rejoice in God;
all those who swear by him will be glad; *

en-bcp1979-canticle-11.label: Canticle 11: The Third Song of Isaiah

value.verse: Arise, shine, for your light has come, *
value.halfverse: and the glory of the Lord has dawned upon you.

value.verse: For behold, darkness covers the land; *
value.halfverse: deep gloom enshrouds the peoples.
and his glory will appear upon you.
value.verse: But over you the Lord will rise, *

value.halfverse: and kings to the brightness of your dawning.
value.verse: Nations will stream to your light, *

value.halfverse: by day or night they will never be shut.
value.verse: Your gates will always be open; *
They will call you, The City of the Lord, *
value.halfverse: The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

value.verse: Violence will no more be heard in your land, *
value.halfverse: ruin or destruction within your borders.
and all your portals, Praise.
value.verse: You will call your walls, Salvation, *

value.halfverse: by night you will not need the brightness of the moon.
value.verse: The sun will no more be your light by day; *
The Lord will be your everlasting light, *
value.halfverse: and your God will be your glory.

value.verse: Oh, how I love your law! *
value.halfverse: all the day long it is in my mind.

value.verse: Your commandment has made me wiser than my enemies, *
value.halfverse: and it is always with me.

value.verse: I have more understanding than all my teachers, *
value.halfverse: for your decrees are my study.
because I observe your commandments.
value.verse: I am wiser than the elders, *

value.halfverse: that I may keep your word.
value.verse: I restrain my feet from every evil way, *

value.halfverse: because you yourself have taught me.
value.verse: I do not shrink from your judgments, *
How sweet are your words to my taste! *
value.halfverse: they are sweeter than honey to my mouth.
therefore I hate every lying way.
value.verse: Through your commandments I gain understanding; *

value.halfverse: his praise shall ever be in my mouth.
value.verse: I will bless the LORD at all times; *

value.halfverse: let the humble hear and rejoice.
value.verse: I will glory in the LORD; *
Proclaim with me the greatness of the LORD; *
value.halfverse: let us exalt his Name together.
and delivered me out of all my terror.
value.verse: I sought the LORD, and he answered me *
Look upon him and be radiant, *
value.halfverse: and let not your faces be ashamed.

value.verse: I called in my affliction and the LORD heard me *
value.halfverse: and saved me from all my troubles.
and he will deliver them.
value.verse: The angel of the LORD encompasses those who fear him, *
Taste and see that the LORD is good; *
value.halfverse: happy are they who trust in him!
for those who fear him lack nothing.
value.verse: Fear the LORD, you that are his saints, *
The young lions lack and suffer hunger, *
value.halfverse: but those who seek the LORD lack nothing that is good.

value.verse: Come, children, and listen to me; *
value.halfverse: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
and desires long life to enjoy prosperity?
value.verse: Who among you loves life *

value.halfverse: and your lips from lying words.
value.verse: Keep your tongue from evil-speaking *

value.halfverse: seek peace and pursue it.
value.verse: Turn from evil and do good; *
The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous, *
value.halfverse: and his ears are open to their cry.

value.verse: The face of the LORD is against those who do evil, *
value.halfverse: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.
and delivers them from all their troubles.
value.verse: The righteous cry, and the LORD hears them *
The LORD is near to the brokenhearted *
value.halfverse: and will save those whose spirits are crushed.

value.verse: Many are the troubles of the righteous, *
value.halfverse: but the LORD will deliver him out of them all.

value.verse: He will keep safe all his bones; *
value.halfverse: not one of them shall be broken.
and those who hate the righteous will be punished.
value.verse: Evil shall slay the wicked, *

value.halfverse: and none will be punished who trust in him.
value.verse: The LORD ransoms the life of his servants, *
Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion, *
value.halfverse: which cannot be moved, but stands fast for ever.

value.verse: The hills stand about Jerusalem; *
value.halfverse:
so does the LORD stand round about his people,
 from this time forth for evermore.

value.verse: The scepter of the wicked shall not hold sway over the land allotted to the just, *
value.halfverse: so that the just shall not put their hands to evil.

value.verse: Show your goodness, O LORD, to those who are good *
value.halfverse: and to those who are true of heart.
but peace be upon Israel.
value.verse:
As for those who turn aside to crooked ways,
the LORD will lead them away with the evildoers; *
You spoke once in vision and said to your faithful people: *
value.halfverse:
“I have set the crown upon a warrior
 and have exalted one chosen out of the people.
with my holy oil have I anointed him.
value.verse: I have found David my servant; *

value.halfverse: and my arm will make him strong.
value.verse: My hand will hold him fast *

value.halfverse: nor any wicked man bring him down.
value.verse: No enemy shall deceive him, *

value.halfverse: and strike down those who hate him.
value.verse: I will crush his foes before him *
My faithfulness and love shall be with him, *
value.halfverse: and he shall be victorious through my Name.

value.verse: I shall make his dominion extend *
value.halfverse: from the Great Sea to the River.

value.verse: He will say to me, ‘You are my Father, *
value.halfverse: my God, and the rock of my salvation.’

value.verse: I will make him my firstborn *
value.halfverse: and higher than the kings of the earth.
and my covenant will stand firm for him.
value.verse: I will keep my love for him for ever, *

value.halfverse: and his throne as the days of heaven.”
value.verse: I will establish his line for ever *

value.halfverse: and do not walk according to my judgments;
value.verse: “If his children forsake my law *
If they break my statutes *
value.halfverse: and do not keep my commandments;

value.verse: I will punish their transgressions with a rod *
value.halfverse: and their iniquities with the lash;

value.verse: But I will not take my love from him, *
value.halfverse: nor let my faithfulness prove false.
nor change what has gone out of my lips.
value.verse: I will not break my covenant, *

value.halfverse: ‘I will not lie to David.
value.verse: Once for all I have sworn by my holiness: *

value.halfverse: and his throne as the sun before me;
value.verse: His line shall endure for ever *
It shall stand fast for evermore like the moon, *
value.halfverse: the abiding witness in the sky.’”
you have become enraged at him.
value.verse: But you have cast off and rejected your anointed; *

value.halfverse: defiled his crown, and hurled it to the ground.
value.verse: You have broken your covenant with your servant, *
You have breached all his walls *
value.halfverse: and laid his strongholds in ruins.
he has become the scorn of his neighbors.
value.verse: All who pass by despoil him; *
You have exalted the right hand of his foes *
value.halfverse: and made all his enemies rejoice.

value.verse: You have turned back the edge of his sword *
value.halfverse: and have not sustained him in battle.
and cast his throne to the ground.
value.verse: You have put an end to his splendor *
You have cut short the days of his youth *
value.halfverse: and have covered him with shame.
how long will your anger burn like fire?
value.verse:
How long will you hide yourself, O LORD?
will you hide yourself for ever? *
Remember, LORD, how short life is, *
value.halfverse: how frail you have made all flesh.
who can save himself from the power of the grave?
value.verse: Who can live and not see death? *

value.halfverse: which you promised David in your faithfulness?
value.verse: Where, Lord, are your loving-kindnesses of old, *

value.halfverse: how I carry in my bosom the taunts of many peoples,
value.verse: Remember, Lord, how your servant is mocked, *

value.halfverse: which they hurled at the heels of your anointed.
value.verse: The taunts your enemies have hurled, O LORD, *
Blessed be the LORD for evermore! *
value.halfverse: Amen, I say, Amen.
to you shall vows be performed in Jerusalem.
value.verse: You are to be praised, O God, in Zion; *
To you that hear prayer shall all flesh come, *
value.halfverse: because of their transgressions.

value.verse: Our sins are stronger than we are, *
value.halfverse: but you will blot them out.

they will be satisfied by the beauty of your house,
 by the holiness of your temple.
value.verse:
Happy are they whom you choose
and draw to your courts to dwell there! *

value.halfverse:
O Hope of all the ends of the earth
 and of the seas that are far away.
value.verse:
Awesome things will you show us in your righteousness,
O God of our salvation, *

value.halfverse: they are girded about with might.
value.verse: You make fast the mountains by your power; *
You still the roaring of the seas, *
value.halfverse:
the roaring of their waves,
 and the clamor of the peoples.
you make the dawn and the dusk to sing for joy.
value.verse: Those who dwell at the ends of the earth will tremble at your marvelous signs; *

value.halfverse: the river of God is full of water.
value.verse:
You visit the earth and water it abundantly;
you make it very plenteous; *
You prepare the grain, *
value.halfverse: for so you provide for the earth.

value.verse: You drench the furrows and smooth out the ridges; *
value.halfverse: with heavy rain you soften the ground and bless its increase.

value.verse: You crown the year with your goodness, *
value.halfverse: and your paths overflow with plenty.
and the hills be clothed with joy.
value.verse: May the fields of the wilderness be rich for grazing, *

May the meadows cover themselves with flocks,
and the valleys cloak themselves with grain; *
value.halfverse: let them shout for joy and sing.
who walk in the law of the LORD!
value.verse: Happy are they whose way is blameless, *
Happy are they who observe his decrees *
value.halfverse: and seek him with all their hearts!

value.verse: Who never do any wrong, *
value.halfverse: but always walk in his ways.
that we should fully keep them.
value.verse: You laid down your commandments, *
Oh, that my ways were made so direct *
value.halfverse: that I might keep your statutes!
when I regard all your commandments.
value.verse: Then I should not be put to shame, *
I will thank you with an unfeigned heart, *
value.halfverse: when I have learned your righteous judgments.
do not utterly forsake me.
value.verse: I will keep your statutes; *

value.halfverse: let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.
value.verse: Come, let us sing to the LORD; *
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and raise a loud shout to him with psalms.

value.verse: For the LORD is a great God, *
value.halfverse: and a great King above all gods.

value.verse: In his hand are the caverns of the earth, *
value.halfverse: and the heights of the hills are his also.
and his hands have molded the dry land.
value.verse: The sea is his, for he made it, *
Come, let us bow down, and bend the knee, *
value.halfverse: and kneel before the LORD our Maker.
Oh, that today you would hearken to his voice!
value.verse:
For he is our God,
and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. *

value.halfverse:
at Meribah, and on that day at Massah,
 when they tempted me.
value.verse:
Harden not your hearts,
as your forebears did in the wilderness, *
They put me to the test, *
value.halfverse: though they had seen my works.

value.verse: Forty years long I detested that generation and said, *
value.halfverse:
“This people are wayward in their hearts;
 they do not know my ways.”

value.verse: So I swore in my wrath, *
value.halfverse: “They shall not enter into my rest.”
give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.
value.verse: Your hands have made me and fashioned me; *

value.halfverse: because I trust in your word.
value.verse: Those who fear you will be glad when they see me, *
I know, O LORD, that your judgments are right *
value.halfverse: and that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.

value.verse: Let your loving-kindness be my comfort, *
value.halfverse: as you have promised to your servant.
for your law is my delight.
value.verse: Let your compassion come to me, that I may live, *

value.halfverse: but I will meditate on your commandments.
value.verse: Let the arrogant be put to shame, for they wrong me with lies; *
Let those who fear you turn to me, *
value.halfverse: and also those who know your decrees.
that I may not be put to shame.
value.verse: Let my heart be sound in your statutes, *
There is a voice of rebellion deep in the heart of the wicked; *
value.halfverse: there is no fear of God before his eyes.
that his hateful sin will not be found out.
value.verse: He flatters himself in his own eyes *
The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful; *
value.halfverse: he has left off acting wisely and doing good.

value.verse:
He thinks up wickedness upon his bed
and has set himself in no good way; *
value.halfverse: he does not abhor that which is evil.

value.verse: Your love, O LORD, reaches to the heavens, *
value.halfverse: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

value.verse:
Your righteousness is like the strong mountains,
your justice like the great deep; *
value.halfverse: you save both man and beast, O LORD.

value.verse: How priceless is your love, O God! *
value.halfverse: your people take refuge under the shadow of your wings.
you give them drink from the river of your delights.
value.verse: They feast upon the abundance of your house; *
For with you is the well of life, *
value.halfverse: and in your light we see light.

value.verse: Continue your loving-kindness to those who know you, *
value.halfverse: and your favor to those who are true of heart.
nor the hand of the wicked push me aside.
value.verse: Let not the foot of the proud come near me, *
See how they are fallen, those who work wickedness! *
value.halfverse: they are cast down and shall not be able to rise.

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

value.verse: I will sing to the Lord, for he is lofty and uplifted; *
value.halfverse: the horse and its rider has he hurled into the sea.
the Lord has become my Savior.
value.verse: The Lord is my strength and my refuge; *

value.halfverse: the God of my people and I will exalt him.
value.verse: This is my God and I will praise him, *

value.halfverse: Yahweh is his Name.
value.verse: The Lord is a mighty warrior; *

value.halfverse: the finest of those who bear armor have been drowned in the Red Sea.
value.verse: The chariots of Pharaoh and his army has he hurled into the sea; *
The fathomless deep has overwhelmed them; *
value.halfverse: they sank into the depths like a stone.
your right hand, O Lord, has overthrown the enemy.
value.verse: Your right hand, O Lord, is glorious in might; *

value.halfverse:
who is like you, glorious in holiness,
awesome in renown, and worker of wonders?
value.verse: Who can be compared with you, O Lord, among the gods? *

value.halfverse: the earth swallowed them up.
value.verse: You stretched forth your right hand; *

value.halfverse: with your might you brought them in safety to your holy dwelling.
value.verse: With your constant love you led the people you redeemed; *

value.halfverse: on the mount of your possession,
value.verse: You will bring them in and plant them *
The resting-place you have made for yourself, O Lord, *
value.halfverse: the sanctuary, O Lord, that your hand has established.
for ever and for ever.
value.verse: The Lord shall reign *
Let your loving-kindness come to me, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: and your salvation, according to your promise.

value.verse: Then shall I have a word for those who taunt me, *
value.halfverse: because I trust in your words.
for my hope is in your judgments.
value.verse: Do not take the word of truth out of my mouth, *

value.halfverse: I shall keep it for ever and ever.
value.verse: I shall continue to keep your law; *

value.halfverse: because I study your commandments.
value.verse: I will walk at liberty, *

value.halfverse: and will not be ashamed.
value.verse: I will tell of your decrees before kings *

value.halfverse: which I have always loved.
value.verse: I delight in your commandments, *

value.halfverse: and I will meditate on your statutes.
value.verse: I will lift up my hands to your commandments, *
Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered; *
value.halfverse: let those who hate him flee before him.

value.verse: Let them vanish like smoke when the wind drives it away; *
value.halfverse: as the wax melts at the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
let them also be merry and joyful.
value.verse: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; *

value.halfverse: YAHWEH is his Name, rejoice before him!
value.verse:
Sing to God, sing praises to his Name;
exalt him who rides upon the heavens; *
Father of orphans, defender of widows, *
value.halfverse: God in his holy habitation!

value.verse: God gives the solitary a home and brings forth prisoners into freedom; *
value.halfverse: but the rebels shall live in dry places.

value.verse: O God, when you went forth before your people, *
value.halfverse: when you marched through the wilderness,

value.verse:
The earth shook, and the skies poured down rain,
at the presence of God, the God of Sinai, *
value.halfverse: at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

value.verse: You sent a gracious rain, O God, upon your inheritance; *
value.halfverse: you refreshed the land when it was weary.

value.verse: Your people found their home in it; *
value.halfverse: in your goodness, O God, you have made provision for the poor.

value.verse: The Lord gave the word; *
value.halfverse: great was the company of women who bore the tidings:

value.verse: “Kings with their armies are fleeing away; *
value.halfverse: the women at home are dividing the spoils.”

you shall be like a dove whose wings are covered with silver,
 whose feathers are like green gold.
value.verse: Though you lingered among the sheepfolds, *
When the Almighty scattered kings, *
value.halfverse: it was like snow falling in Zalmon.

value.verse: O mighty mountain, O hill of Bashan! *
value.halfverse: O rugged mountain, O hill of Bashan!
truly, the LORD will dwell there for ever.
value.verse:
Why do you look with envy, O rugged mountain,
at the hill which God chose for his resting place? *

The chariots of God are twenty thousand,
even thousands of thousands; *
value.halfverse: the Lord comes in holiness from Sinai.

value.verse:
You have gone up on high and led captivity captive;
you have received gifts even from your enemies, *
value.halfverse: that the LORD God might dwell among them.

value.verse: Blessed be the Lord day by day, *
value.halfverse: the God of our salvation, who bears our burdens.
God is the LORD, by whom we escape death.
value.verse: He is our God, the God of our salvation; *

value.halfverse: and the hairy scalp of those who go on still in their wickedness.
value.verse: God shall crush the heads of his enemies, *
The Lord has said, “I will bring them back from Bashan; *
value.halfverse: I will bring them back from the depths of the sea;
the tongues of your dogs in the blood of your enemies.”
value.verse: That your foot may be dipped in blood, *
They see your procession, O God, *
value.halfverse: your procession into the sanctuary, my God and my King.

value.verse: The singers go before, musicians follow after, *
value.halfverse: in the midst of maidens playing upon the hand-drums.

value.verse: Bless God in the congregation; *
value.halfverse: bless the LORD, you that are of the fountain of Israel.
and the princes of Zebulon and Naphtali.
value.verse:
There is Benjamin, least of the tribes, at the head;
the princes of Judah in a company; *

value.halfverse: establish, O God, what you have wrought for us.
value.verse: Send forth your strength, O God; *

value.halfverse: for your temple’s sake at Jerusalem.
value.verse: Kings shall bring gifts to you, *

value.halfverse: and the peoples, a herd of wild bulls with its calves.
value.verse: Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, *
Trample down those who lust after silver; *
value.halfverse: scatter the peoples that delight in war.
let Ethiopia stretch out her hands to God.
value.verse: Let tribute be brought out of Egypt; *
Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth; *
value.halfverse: sing praises to the Lord.

value.verse: He rides in the heavens, the ancient heavens; *
value.halfverse: he sends forth his voice, his mighty voice.

his majesty is over Israel;
 his strength is in the skies.
value.verse: Ascribe power to God; *
How wonderful is God in his holy places! *
value.halfverse:
the God of Israel giving strength and power to his people!
 Blessed be God!
I will sing and make melody.
value.verse: My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed; *

Wake up, my spirit;
awake, lute and harp; *
value.halfverse: I myself will waken the dawn.

value.verse: I will confess you among the peoples, O LORD; *
value.halfverse: I will sing praises to you among the nations.

value.verse: For your loving-kindness is greater than the heavens, *
value.halfverse: and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
and your glory over all the earth.
value.verse: Exalt yourself above the heavens, O God, *
So that those who are dear to you may be delivered, *
value.halfverse: save with your right hand and answer me.

“I will exult and parcel out Shechem;
 I will divide the valley of Succoth.
value.verse: [God spoke from his holy place and said, *
Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine; *
value.halfverse: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my scepter.

value.verse:
Moab is my washbasin,
on Edom I throw down my sandal to claim it, *
value.halfverse: and over Philistia will I shout in triumph.”
who will bring me into Edom?
value.verse: Who will lead me into the strong city? *

value.halfverse: you no longer go out, O God, with our armies.
value.verse: Have you not cast us off, O God? *

value.halfverse: for vain is the help of man.
value.verse: Grant us your help against the enemy, *
With God we will do valiant deeds, *
value.halfverse: and he shall tread our enemies under foot.]
when we remembered you, O Zion.
value.verse: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept, *
As for our harps, we hung them up *
value.halfverse: on the trees in the midst of that land.
“Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
value.verse:
For those who led us away captive asked us for a song,
and our oppressors called for mirth: *

value.halfverse: upon an alien soil?
value.verse: How shall we sing the LORD’S song *

value.halfverse: let my right hand forget its skill.
value.verse: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, *

Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth
if I do not remember you, *
value.halfverse: if I do not set Jerusalem above my highest joy.

value.verse:
Remember the day of Jerusalem, O LORD,
against the people of Edom, *
value.halfverse:
who said, “Down with it! down with it!
 even to the ground!”

happy the one who pays you back
 for what you have done to us!
value.verse: O Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction, *

value.halfverse: and dashes them against the rock!
value.verse: Happy shall he be who takes your little ones, *
In the LORD have I taken refuge; *
value.halfverse:
how then can you say to me,
 “Fly away like a bird to the hilltop;

value.verse:
For see how the wicked bend the bow
and fit their arrows to the string, *
value.halfverse: to shoot from ambush at the true of heart.

value.verse: When the foundations are being destroyed, *
value.halfverse: what can the righteous do?”
the LORD’S throne is in heaven.
value.verse: The LORD is in his holy temple; *

value.halfverse: his piercing eye weighs our worth.
value.verse: His eyes behold the inhabited world; *

value.halfverse: but those who delight in violence he abhors.
value.verse: The LORD weighs the righteous as well as the wicked, *
Upon the wicked he shall rain coals of fire and burning sulphur; *
value.halfverse: a scorching wind shall be their lot.

value.verse:
For the LORD is righteous;
he delights in righteous deeds; *
value.halfverse: and the just shall see his face.

value.verse:
LORD, hear my prayer,
and in your faithfulness heed my supplications; *
value.halfverse: answer me in your righteousness.

value.verse: Enter not into judgment with your servant, *
value.halfverse: for in your sight shall no one living be justified.
he has made me live in dark places like those who are long dead.
value.verse:
For my enemy has sought my life;
he has crushed me to the ground; *

value.halfverse: my heart within me is desolate.
value.verse: My spirit faints within me; *

value.halfverse: I consider the works of your hands.
value.verse:
I remember the time past;
I muse upon all your deeds; *
I spread out my hands to you; *
value.halfverse: my soul gasps to you like a thirsty land.

value.verse: O LORD, make haste to answer me; my spirit fails me; *
value.halfverse:
do not hide your face from me
 or I shall be like those who go down to the Pit.

show me the road that I must walk,
 for I lift up my soul to you.
value.verse:
Let me hear of your loving-kindness in the morning,
for I put my trust in you; *

value.halfverse: for I flee to you for refuge.
value.verse: Deliver me from my enemies, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: let your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
value.verse: Teach me to do what pleases you, for you are my God; *

value.halfverse: for your righteousness’ sake, bring me out of trouble.
value.verse: Revive me, O LORD, for your Name’s sake; *

value.halfverse: for truly I am your servant.]
value.verse:
[Of your goodness, destroy my enemies
and bring all my foes to naught, *
How dear to me is your dwelling, O LORD of hosts! *
value.halfverse:
My soul has a desire and longing for the courts of the LORD;
 my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

by the side of your altars, O LORD of hosts,
 my King and my God.
value.verse:
The sparrow has found her a house
and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young; *
Happy are they who dwell in your house! *
value.halfverse: they will always be praising you.

value.verse: Happy are the people whose strength is in you! *
value.halfverse: whose hearts are set on the pilgrims’ way.
for the early rains have covered it with pools of water.
value.verse: Those who go through the desolate valley will find it a place of springs, *
They will climb from height to height, *
value.halfverse: and the God of gods will reveal himself in Zion.
hearken, O God of Jacob.
value.verse: LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; *

value.halfverse: and look upon the face of your Anointed.
value.verse: Behold our defender, O God; *

value.halfverse:
and to stand at the threshold of the house of my God
 than to dwell in the tents of the wicked.
value.verse: For one day in your courts is better than a thousand in my own room, *
For the LORD God is both sun and shield; *
value.halfverse: he will give grace and glory;
from those who walk with integrity.
value.verse: No good thing will the LORD withhold *

value.halfverse: happy are they who put their trust in you!
value.verse: O LORD of hosts, *
Unless the LORD builds the house, *
value.halfverse: their labor is in vain who build it.

value.verse: Unless the LORD watches over the city, *
value.halfverse: in vain the watchman keeps his vigil.

value.verse: It is in vain that you rise so early and go to bed so late; *
value.halfverse:
vain, too, to eat the bread of toil,
 for he gives to his beloved sleep.

value.verse: Children are a heritage from the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and the fruit of the womb is a gift.
are the children of one’s youth.
value.verse: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior *

value.halfverse:
he shall not be put to shame
 when he contends with his enemies in the gate.
value.verse: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them! *
In you, O LORD, have I taken refuge; *
value.halfverse: let me never be ashamed.

value.verse: In your righteousness, deliver me and set me free; *
value.halfverse: incline your ear to me and save me.
you are my crag and my stronghold.
value.verse: Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe; *

value.halfverse: from the clutches of the evildoer and the oppressor.
value.verse: Deliver me, my God, from the hand of the wicked, *

value.halfverse: my confidence since I was young.
value.verse: For you are my hope, O LORD God, *

value.halfverse: my praise shall be always of you.
value.verse:
I have been sustained by you ever since I was born;
from my mother’s womb you have been my strength; *
I have become a portent to many; *
value.halfverse: but you are my refuge and my strength.
and your glory all the day long.
value.verse: Let my mouth be full of your praise *
Do not cast me off in my old age; *
value.halfverse: forsake me not when my strength fails.
and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.
value.verse: For my enemies are talking against me, *

value.halfverse: because there is none who will save.”
value.verse:
They say, “God has forsaken him;
go after him and seize him; *
O God, be not far from me; *
value.halfverse: come quickly to help me, O my God.
let those who seek to do me evil be covered with scorn and reproach.
value.verse: Let those who set themselves against me be put to shame and be disgraced; *
But I shall always wait in patience, *
value.halfverse: and shall praise you more and more.
though I cannot know the number of them.
value.verse:
My mouth shall recount your mighty acts
and saving deeds all day long; *

value.halfverse: I will recall your righteousness, yours alone.
value.verse: I will begin with the mighty works of the Lord GOD; *
O God, you have taught me since I was young, *
value.halfverse: and to this day I tell of your wonderful works.

till I make known your strength to this generation
 and your power to all who are to come.
value.verse: And now that I am old and gray-headed, O God, do not forsake me, *
Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens; *
value.halfverse:
you have done great things;
 who is like you, O God?

but you will restore my life
 and bring me up again from the deep places of the earth.
value.verse: You have showed me great troubles and adversities, *

value.halfverse: you enfold and comfort me,
value.verse: You strengthen me more and more; *

value.halfverse: I will sing to you with the harp, O Holy One of Israel.
value.verse: Therefore I will praise you upon the lyre for your faithfulness, O my God; *

value.halfverse: and so will my soul, which you have redeemed.
value.verse: My lips will sing with joy when I play to you, *

value.halfverse: for they are ashamed and disgraced who sought to do me harm.
value.verse: My tongue will proclaim your righteousness all day long, *
The heavens declare the glory of God, *
value.halfverse: and the firmament shows his handiwork.

value.verse: One day tells its tale to another, *
value.halfverse: and one night imparts knowledge to another.

value.verse: Although they have no words or language, *
value.halfverse: and their voices are not heard,
and their message to the ends of the world.
value.verse: Their sound has gone out into all lands, *

value.halfverse:
it comes forth like a bridegroom out of his chamber;
 it rejoices like a champion to run its course.
value.verse: In the deep has he set a pavilion for the sun; *

value.halfverse: nothing is hidden from its burning heat.
value.verse:
It goes forth from the uttermost edge of the heavens
and runs about to the end of it again; *

value.halfverse: the testimony of the LORD is sure and gives wisdom to the innocent.
value.verse: The law of the LORD is perfect and revives the soul; *

value.halfverse: the commandment of the LORD is clear and gives light to the eyes.
value.verse: The statutes of the LORD are just and rejoice the heart; *

value.halfverse: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.
value.verse: The fear of the LORD is clean and endures for ever; *
More to be desired are they than gold, more than much fine gold, *
value.halfverse: sweeter far than honey, than honey in the comb.

value.verse: By them also is your servant enlightened, *
value.halfverse: and in keeping them there is great reward.

value.verse: Who can tell how often he offends? *
value.halfverse: cleanse me from my secret faults.

then shall I be whole and sound,
 and innocent of a great offense.
value.verse:
Above all, keep your servant from presumptuous sins;
let them not get dominion over me; *

value.halfverse: O LORD, my strength and my redeemer.
value.verse: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your sight, *

value.halfverse: I called to the LORD, and he answered me.
value.verse: When I was in trouble, I called to the LORD; *
Deliver me, O LORD, from lying lips *
value.halfverse: and from the deceitful tongue.

value.verse: What shall be done to you, and what more besides, *
value.halfverse: O you deceitful tongue?
along with hot glowing coals.
value.verse: The sharpened arrows of a warrior, *

value.halfverse: and dwell among the tents of Kedar!
value.verse: How hateful it is that I must lodge in Meshech *
Too long have I had to live *
value.halfverse: among the enemies of peace.
but when I speak of it, they are for war.
value.verse: I am on the side of peace, *

LORD, hear my prayer,
and in your faithfulness heed my supplications; *
value.halfverse: answer me in your righteousness.

value.verse: Enter not into judgment with your servant, *

value.verse:
For my enemy has sought my life;
he has crushed me to the ground; *

value.verse: My spirit faints within me; *

value.verse:
I remember the time past;

for the mouth of the wicked,

value: The Private Prayers of Lancelot Andrewes

value.label: Commemoration
value:
For the day that is past,
	I give you thanks, O Lord.
Evening draws near; make it bright.
Each day has an evening, and so too does our life.
Old age is the evening of life, and old age has overtaken me;
	make it bright.
Do not cast me off as I grow old;
	as my strength forsakes me, forsake me not.
Be with me until old age,
	bear me up until I grow old.
You have made me, and you will bear me;
	you will carry, and you will save me, O Lord.
Stay with me, O Lord, for I am already near the dusk,
and the day has turned aside from this hard-toiling life.
May your power be made perfect in my weakness.

The day is past and gone away,
so passes life,
	unsurvivable life.
Night comes, and death comes too,
	undying death.
Day’s end is near, near too the end of life.

And so with this in mind we pray to you,
that the ends of our lives may be Christian and good,
	sinless, shameless,
	and—should it please you—painless.
Guide us in peace, O Lord, O Lord,
gathering us under the feet of your elect,
when you will, and as you will,
	but without shame or sin.

Remember the days of darkness, which were many;
	that we may not be cast out into the outer darkness.
Remember and turn away the night, for we have done some good.
Judgment is near; grant us a good and acceptable defense
	before the fearsome and dreadful judgment seat
	of Jesus Christ our Lord.

value.label: Thanksgiving
value:
I lift up my hands by night in the holy place, and bless the Lord.
The Lord grants his loving-kindness in the daytime;
    in the night season his song is with me,
    a prayer to the God of my life.
So will I bless you through all my life,
	I will lift up my hands in your name.
Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense,
	the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

Blessed are you, O Lord our God,
	the God of our Fathers,
who created the exchange of day and night,
who gave us cause to sing at night,
who rescued us from the evil of this day,
who has not cut off my life like a weaver,
nor broken me down, from day until night.

As days pile upon days,
	so pile up our sins.
	Seven times a day falls the righteous,
	but I of extraordinary sin, seventy-seven;
	and it is strange and terrifying.
But I turn away from my evil ways and groan,
	and I bend my heart,
	I bend my whole heart to you,
the God of those who repent, and Savior of sinners,
	and evening after evening I will turn
	from the inmost marrow of my soul,
	and out of the depths my soul cries to you,

“I have sinned, O Lord, I have sinned—
	ah! alas! the wretchedness!
I repent, oh, I repent. Spare me, O Lord,
	I repent—oh, I repent!
	help me in my unrepentance.

Be merciful.Spare me, O Lord.
Be merciful.Have mercy on me.
	I have said, “Lord, have mercy.”
	Heal my soul, for I have sinned against you.
Have mercy on me, O Lord, according to your great kindness,
	and in your great compassion
	blot out my offenses.

Release the guilt,
heal the wound,
wipe away the stain,
rescue me from the shame,
snatch me away from the tyranny,
and make not an example of me.

Bring me out of my troubles,
	cleanse me from my secret faults.
Keep your servant from presumptuous sins;
	hold not against me
	my wanderings of mind
	and careless words.
Take me from the muck and mire
	of mean and lawless thoughts.

O Lord, my destruction comes from myself;
	however much I have sinned, mercifully forgive.
Do not deal with us according to our sins,
	nor reward us according to our wickedness.
Look mercifully upon our weakness,
	according to the glory of your all-holy name,
Turn evil away from us, and all harsh things
	that our sins—and on their account, we—
	have most justly and worthily deserved.
value.label: Penitence
Petition
value:
Grant me, O Lord, rest from my work;
	refresh me from my mighty toil.
Give light to my eyes,
	lest I sleep in death.
Rescue me from terror by night,
	from the plague that stalks in the darkness.
Give me wholesome rest,
	so that I pass this night without fear.

O Guardian of Israel who neither slumbers nor sleeps,
Guard me this night against all evil,
	Guard my soul, O Lord.
Visit me with your own visitation,
	reveal my mind to me in the visions of the night.

But if not—for I am not worthy, I am not worthy!
	even so, O loving Master,
may my sleep be a respite for me
	from both toil and from sin.
Yes, Lord—and in sleep, let me not desire
	that which grieves you or defiles me.
Let me not be filled with illusions, 
	but let me have a steady heart,
	without fear or dread.
Guard me against the dark sleep of sin,
but put every earthly and evil thought within me to sleep.

Give me gentle sleep, putting away from me
	all fantasies that come from the flesh and the Devil.
You know the sleeplessness of my unseen enemies, O Lord,
and the weakness of my struggling flesh—
	you formed me!

Let the wing of your mercy cover me.
Wake me up at the right time,
	at the time of prayer,
and give me grace to rise to seek you,
	to give you glory and care.

value.label: Commendation

value: Almighty and everlasting God, by whose Spirit the whole body of your faithful people is governed and sanctified: Receive our supplications and prayers which we offer before you for all members of your holy Church, that in their vocation and ministry they may truly and devoutly serve you; through our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
en-bcp1979-mp_prayers_for_mission.label: A Prayer for Mission

value: O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
en-bcp1979-mp_prayers_for_mission.label: A Prayer for Mission

value: Lord Jesus Christ, you stretched out your arms of love on the hard wood of the cross that everyone might come within the reach of your saving embrace: So clothe us in your Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know you to the knowledge and love of you; for the honor of your Name.
en-bcp1979-mp_prayers_for_mission.label: A Prayer for Mission

value: Keep watch, dear Lord, with those who work, or watch, or weep this night, and give thine angels charge over those who sleep. Tend the sick, Lord Christ; give rest to the weary, bless the dying, soothe the suffering, pity the afflicted, shield the joyous; and all for thy love’s sake.

O God, who dost manifest in thy servants the signs of thy presence: Send forth upon us the Spirit of love, that in companionship with one another thine abounding grace may increase among us; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

O God and Father of all, whom the whole heavens adore: Let the whole earth also worship you, all nations obey you, all tongues confess and bless you, and men and women everywhere love you and serve you in peace; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

O God, the author of peace and lover of concord, to know you is eternal life and to serve you is perfect freedom: Defend us, your humble servants, in all assaults of our enemies; that we, surely trusting in your defense, may not fear the power of any adversaries; through the might of Jesus Christ our Lord.
en-bcp1979-mp_daily_collect.label: A Collect for Peace

value: Lord God, almighty and everlasting Father, you have brought us in safety to this new day: Preserve us with your mighty power, that we may not fall into sin, nor be overcome by adversity; and in all we do, direct us to the fulfilling of your purpose; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
en-bcp1979-mp_daily_collect.label: A Collect for Grace

value: O God, the King eternal, whose light divides the day from the night and turns the shadow of death into the morning: Drive far from us all wrong desires, incline our hearts to keep your law, and guide our feet into the way of peace; that, having done your will with cheerfulness during the day, we may, when night comes, rejoice to give you thanks; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
en-bcp1979-mp_daily_collect.label: A Collect for the Renewal of Life
A Collect for Guidance
value: Heavenly Father, in you we live and move and have our being: We humbly pray you so to guide and govern us by your Holy Spirit, that in all the cares and occupations of our life we may not forget you, but may remember that we are ever walking in your sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

en-rite_i-mp_daily_collect.label: A Collect for the Renewal of Life
value: O God, the King eternal, who dividest the day from the night and turnest the shadow of death into the morning: Drive far from us all wrong desires, incline our hearts to keep thy law, and guide our feet into the way of peace; that, having done thy will with cheerfulness while it was day, we may, when the night cometh, rejoice to give thee thanks; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

en-rite_i-mp_daily_collect.label: A Collect for Peace
value: O God, who art the author of peace and lover of concord, in knowledge of whom standeth our eternal life, whose service is perfect freedom: Defend us, thy humble servants, in all assaults of our enemies; that we, surely trusting in thy defense, may not fear the power of any adversaries; through the might of Jesus Christ our Lord.

en-rite_i-mp_daily_collect.label: A Collect for Grace
value: O Lord, our heavenly Father, almighty and everlasting God, who hast safely brought us to the beginning of this day: Defend us in the same with thy mighty power; and grant that this day we fall into no sin, neither run into any kind of danger; but that we, being ordered by thy governance, may do always what is righteous in thy sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

en-rite_i-mp_daily_collect.label: A Collect for Guidance
value: O heavenly Father, in whom we live and move and have our being: We humbly pray thee so to guide and govern us by thy Holy Spirit, that in all the cares and occupations of our life we may not forget thee, but may remember that we are ever walking in thy sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

O God, who hast made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and didst send thy blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after thee and find thee; bring the nations into thy fold; pour out thy Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of thy kingdom; through the same thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
en-rite_i-mp_prayers_for_mission.label: A Prayer for Mission
A Prayer for Mission
value: Almighty and everlasting God, by whose Spirit the whole body of thy faithful people is governed and sanctified: Receive our supplications and prayers which we offer before thee for all members of thy holy Church, that in their vocation and ministry they may truly and godly serve thee; through our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

Lord Jesus Christ, who didst stretch out thine arms of love on the hard wood of the cross that everyone might come within the reach of thy saving embrace: So clothe us in thy Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know thee to the knowledge and love of thee; for the honor of thy Name.
en-rite_i-mp_prayers_for_mission.label: A Prayer for Mission

value: Praise to the holy and undivided Trinity, one God:
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

Most holy God, the source of all good desires, all right judgments, and all just works: Give to us, your servants, that peace which the world cannot give, so that our minds may be fixed on the doing of your will, and that we, being delivered from the fear of all enemies, may live in peace and quietness; through the mercies of Christ Jesus our Savior.
en-bcp1979-ep-daily-collect.label: A Collect for Aid against Perils

value: Lord Jesus, stay with us, for evening is at hand and the day is past; be our companion in the way, kindle our hearts, and awaken hope, that we may know you as you are revealed in Scripture and the breaking of bread. Grant this for the sake of your love.
en-bcp1979-ep-daily-collect.label: A Collect for the Presence of Christ
A Collect for Protection
value: O God, the life of all who live, the light of the faithful, the strength of those who labor, and the repose of the dead: We thank you for the blessings of the day that is past, and humbly ask for your protection through the coming night. Bring us in safety to the morning hours; through him who died and rose again for us, your Son our Savior Jesus Christ.

Most holy God, the source of all good desires, all right judgments, and all just works: Give to us, your servants, that peace which the world cannot give, so that our minds may be fixed on the doing of your will, and that we, being delivered from the fear of all enemies, may live in peace and quietness; through the mercies of Christ Jesus our Savior.
en-bcp1979-ep-daily-collect.label: A Collect for Peace

source.source: attr. to St. Epiphanius of Cyprus

value: What is happening? Today there is a great silence over the earth, a great silence, and stillness, a great silence because the King sleeps; the earth was in terror and was still, because God slept in the flesh and raised up those who were sleeping from the ages. God has died in the flesh, and the underworld has trembled.

Truly he goes to seek out our first parent like a lost sheep; he wishes to visit those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death. He goes to free the prisoner Adam and his fellow-prisoner Eve from their pains, he who is God, and Adam’s son.

The Lord goes in to them holding his victorious weapon, his cross. When Adam, the first created man, sees him, he strikes his breast in terror and calls out to all: 'My Lord be with you all.' And Christ in reply says to Adam: ‘And with your spirit.’ And grasping his hand he raises him up, saying: ‘Awake, O sleeper, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give you light.

‘I am your God, who for your sake became your son, who for you and your descendants now speak and command with authority those in prison: Come forth, and those in darkness: Have light, and those who sleep: Rise.

‘I command you: Awake, sleeper, I have not made you to be held a prisoner in the underworld. Arise from the dead; I am the life of the dead. Arise, O man, work of my hands, arise, you who were fashioned in my image. Rise, let us go hence; for you in me and I in you, together we are one undivided person.

‘For you, I your God became your son; for you, I the Master took on your form; that of slave; for you, I who am above the heavens came on earth and under the earth; for you, man, I became as a man without help, free among the dead; for you, who left a garden, I was handed over to Jews from a garden and crucified in a garden.

‘Look at the spittle on my face, which I received because of you, in order to restore you to that first divine inbreathing at creation. See the blows on my cheeks, which I accepted in order to refashion your distorted form to my own image.

'See the scourging of my back, which I accepted in order to disperse the load of your sins which was laid upon your back. See my hands nailed to the tree for a good purpose, for you, who stretched out your hand to the tree for an evil one.

‘I slept on the cross and a sword pierced my side, for you, who slept in paradise and brought forth Eve from your side. My side healed the pain of your side; my sleep will release you from your sleep in Hades; my sword has checked the sword which was turned against you.

‘But arise, let us go hence. The enemy brought you out of the land of paradise; I will reinstate you, no longer in paradise, but on the throne of heaven. I denied you the tree of life, which was a figure, but now I myself am united to you, I who am life. I posted the cherubim to guard you as they would slaves; now I make the cherubim worship you as they would God.

‘The cherubim throne has been prepared, the bearers are ready and waiting, the bridal chamber is in order, the food is provided, the everlasting houses and rooms are in readiness; the treasures of good things have been opened; the kingdom of heaven has been prepared before the ages.’

value: We beseech thee, O Lord, pour thy grace into our hearts, that we who have known the incarnation of thy Son Jesus Christ, announced by an angel to the Virgin Mary, may by his cross and passion be brought unto the glory of his resurrection; who liveth and reigneth with thee, in the unity of the Holy Spirit, one God, now and for ever.

O God, you manifest in your servants the signs of your presence: Send forth upon us the spirit of love, that in companionship with one another your abounding grace may increase among us; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

O God and Father of all, whom the whole heavens adore: Let the whole earth also worship you, all nations obey you, all tongues confess and bless you, and men and women everywhere love you and serve you in peace; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

O God and Father of all, whom the whole heavens adore: Let the whole earth also worship you, all nations obey you, all tongues confess and bless you, and men and women everywhere love you and serve you in peace; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

value: What is happening? Today there is a great silence over the earth, a great silence, and stillness, a great silence because the King sleeps; the earth was in terror and was still, because God slept in the flesh and raised up those who were sleeping from the ages. God has died in the flesh, and the underworld has trembled.

Truly he goes to seek out our first parent like a lost sheep; he wishes to visit those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death. He goes to free the prisoner Adam and his fellow-prisoner Eve from their pains, he who is God, and Adam's son.

The Lord goes in to them holding his victorious weapon, his cross. When Adam, the first created man, sees him, he strikes his breast in terror and calls out to all: 'My Lord be with you all. And Christ in reply says to Adam: ‘And with your spirit.’ And grasping his hand he raises him up, saying: ‘Awake, O sleeper, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give you light.

‘I am your God, who for your sake became your son, who for you and your descendants now speak and command with authority those in prison: Come forth, and those in darkness: Have light, and those who sleep: Rise.

‘I command you: Awake, sleeper, I have not made you to be held a prisoner in the underworld. Arise from the dead; I am the life of the dead. Arise, O man, work of my hands, arise, you who were fashioned in my image. Rise, let us go hence; for you in me and I in you, together we are one undivided person.

‘For you, I your God became your son; for you, I the Master took on your form; that of slave; for you, I who am above the heavens came on earth and under the earth; for you, man, I became as a man without help, free among the dead; for you, who left a garden, I was handed over to Jews from a garden and crucified in a garden.

‘Look at the spittle on my face, which I received because of you, in order to restore you to that first divine inbreathing at creation. See the blows on my cheeks, which I accepted in order to refashion your distorted form to my own image.

See the scourging of my back, which I accepted in order to disperse the load of your sins which was laid upon your back. See my hands nailed to the tree for a good purpose, for you, who stretched out your hand to the tree for an evil one.

‘I slept on the cross and a sword pierced my side, for you, who slept in paradise and brought forth Eve from your side. My side healed the pain of your side; my sleep will release you from your sleep in Hades; my sword has checked the sword which was turned against you.

‘But arise, let us go hence. The enemy brought you out of the land of paradise; I will reinstate you, no longer in paradise, but on the throne of heaven. I denied you the tree of life, which was a figure, but now I myself am united to you, I who am life. I posted the cherubim to guard you as they would slaves; now I make the cherubim worship you as they would God.

‘The cherubim throne has been prepared, the bearers are ready and waiting, the bridal chamber is in order, the food is provided, the everlasting houses and rooms are in readiness; the treasures of good things have been opened; the kingdom of heaven has been prepared before the ages.’
